story:
The First Level

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign.  We are raising funds to finish our new album, “Champions of the Universe” and to help us take it to the next level. 

For those of you who don’t know us, we are Ratboy Jr. and we play music for families. We used to say kids’ music, but some parents told us, “Hey we love your music just as much as they do!”  So, we play music for kids, adults, and everyone in between.  Some call it “Kindie music”, which is independent music for children.  We are very independent indeed.

So independent, in fact, that we handmade every single copy of our last album, Smorgasbord.  

This last album brought us all over the Northeast.  We opened for Levon Helm and played at such festivals as Mountain Jam (NY), The Green River Festival (MA), Top of the Park (MI), The LEAF Festival (NC), Clearwater Festival (NY), The River Meltdown (MA), and many more.

Why are we telling you all this?  We are ready to take it to the next level.  We have gotten so far and we need help to go even further.  We can’t keep making the CDs by hand. This next album is going to be so amazing that it deserves to look and sound the best it can.

The Next Level

We are currently finishing up our second album, “Champions of the Universe.”  We recorded most of it with our good friend Dean Jones from Dog on Fleas, our most favoritest band in all of the land.  He has an incredible hay bale studio in Rosendale, NY called No Parking Studio.  We also recorded some of it in Woodstock, NY at our friend’s studio, Tuttle Sound Labs. 

We can honestly say this is the best music we have ever written and the best cover art we have ever been involved with! We had our artist pal, Ryan Cronin paint us the most awesome cover we could possibly imagine.  We have come so far and we need your help to go even further.  Just imagine what we could do with a proper album.

Your Level

Here is where you come in.  Here is some of what we still need to do:

Mixing- This is where we adjust all the levels of the msuic to make it sound great.  Timmy says the vocals need to be louder and Matty says the Drums need to be louder and then we meet in the middle.  

Mastering- This is when someone takes the songs and makes them sound like they are ready for the radio.  We could not afford this last time and these songs want to be heard!

Print the CD- We want to have the CDs professionally duplicated.  Our hands hurt just thinking about making them ourselves.  The cover is so amazing and we want it to look fantastic.

Banner- We play a lot of festivals and we want to get a cool banner that says our name.

We are trying to raise $2,000.  This money will go directly toward helping us take it to the next level.  If we raise more then $2,000 we might make to the next, next level.  We can get T-shirts, a website, music vdoes, etc.  If we don’t raise the full $2,000 we still keep what we raise!

 

We have some cool perks for helping us out.  We can’t thank you enough, but we can give you STUFF! 

If you can’t contribute to our campaign, you can still help us get the word out.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much in advance, Timmy and Matty

story:
WE WILL BE DOING A SERIES OF VIDEOS FEATURING SHEVIL BASSIST PJ DUNPHY PROMOTING THIS GLORIOUS GOAL WE ARE TRYING TO ACHIEVE THROUGH YOU, OUR CHILDREN!

SHEVIL

We're the world's only 3 bassed epic doom band!  We consist of vocalist/bassist Kyle McDonald, bassist Shaun Crawford, bassist PJ Dunphy and drummer Errol Girvan.  Vocally we express a melodic approach laced with some darker/aggressive tendencies.

We have collectively played in a ton of bands over the years, featuring The Monoxides, Iron Giant, The Peter Parkers, Gallactus, Cop Shades, MANLORD, Blood Royal and many more.

To date we've released an EP, and toured from St. John's, Newfoundland to Toronto, Ontario having played with bands the likes of Cauldron, C'mon, sHEAVY, Electric Magma, and Wizards Of Kaos to name a handful.

Contribute To Our Plight!

By pre-ordering our new album in one of the options listed along the right side of the screen (which include shipping if applicable), you're enabling us to release our sophomore album on beautiful colored 12" vinyl!  You will get a personal thanks in our album credits for your contribution as you are enabling us to release this monstrous vision of an album on this unmatched analog format which is incredibly important to the 4 of us. 

The album is a deep concept on the reality of the Roman occupation of Scotland (Celts) between the years of 550 and 850 AD.  There isn't a reality of this album not to be pressed to vinyl.  The album is too personally important to us and needs to be etched into stone to remain on this world until it meets its eventual demise. 

Shevil Members As Contributors

Kyle McDonald has a web/tv show called THE MCDONS HOUSE which promotes independent music by showcasing bands/artists filmed in a live setting with high quality multi-tracked audio.  He is also a live show promoter, studio/live audio engineer, and runs Moncton DIY label Superbob Records at http://www.superbob.ca

PJ Dunphy is arguably Moncton's most well-known promoter and the most notorious musician.  He has a crazy history with booking in Moncton for over a decade and also ran/owned 53rd & 3rd - one of the coolest live music bars in Moncton history.  PJ also has a segment on THE MCDONS HOUSE called Cooking Up Songs With Peejay where he has a guest and promotes his/her/their band or business.

Errol Girvan has been a graphic designer for over a decade and has designed and worked on album covers and show posters for bands since the 90's.  He does a comedic-nerdy based podcast called Mother Function which is a staple in the Moncton music community.

Shaun Crawford is a visual/graphic artist and has a reputation of one of the best in Moncton.  His portraits of musicians in town is unmatched and he continues to work on designing posters and artwork for independent bands. 

Spread The Gospel!

We totally understand some people cannot contribute, which is of course beyond understandable.  That said, you can still be an enormous help to us by sharing this on your facebook for us and spreading the word in general.

story:
Adam Hammer used to spare for change as a homeless squatter. Now, almost 10 years sober and musically recharged with an acoustic style all his own, Hammer is sparing for change with a worthwhile purpose — to create his next studio CD.

With a fresh batch of songs that have fans singing along at shows throughout Minnesota, Hammer is eager to head back into the studio to create the follow-up to 2008’s “Tattooed Folk EP.” Many have been asking, “So when’s the new CD coming out?” The answer is always, “As soon as I can afford to do it justice.” Well, now’s your chance to help make the new disc happen!

This new album, tentatively titled “Broken Like You,” will feature a dozen or so new songs that require more studio treatment than Hammer can give at his home-based Hammered House Productions where the “Tattooed Folk EP” was recorded and produced.

You can listen to rough demos of some of the music slated for the new disc (“Underwater Love Song,” “Starshine,” “Scared Alive,” the title track and more) at http://www.reverbnation.com/adamhammer.

Along with the full-length, Hammer also will be releasing the “Let it Burn EP” with his band the Impact featuring some of his darker, drop-tuned cuts (“Let it Burn,” “Whistle Your Way to the Grave” and a new rendition of “Ballad of Lucy”) that just don’t fit in with the music pegged for “Broken Like You.”

You can also help fund this project by purchasing the “Tattooed Folk EP” on iTunes or at http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/adamhammer.

story:
The Band

Hi,we're Supermajor! We're a group of music-slinging friends who started playing together in late 2008, united by a love of big choruses, spine-tingly vocal harmony, and laser sounds. In late 2009, we recorded and self-released our first EP, and we've been rocking it on stages nationwide since then. We've come a long way in the past few years, and now we're ready to share more of the music we love to play with the world!

The EP

Since the last record, we've gone through some changes and discovered musical hair in places we never had musical hair before. We've been melting faces from here to St. Louis (literally), and have emerged, butterfly-like, from this rock 'n' roll chrysalis with a collection of songs we think are going to touch your very soul...or, at least, your soul's chocolatey outer shell.

What Your Money Pays For

Magic and unicorns! And if we have any left over, we'll use it to pay for:

  • Studio time!
  • The recording work of our excellent producer, John Gideon!
  • Mixing!
  • Mastering!
  • Reproduction and printing of a whole bunch of discs!
  • The biggest publicity push we can muster once the record is done so that everyone and their mom has the chance to enjoy it!

How to Donate

Click the "Contribute Now" button over on the right! You'll be able to choose at which reward tier level you'd like to contribute, or scroll down and enter a different amount, yourself. PLEASE NOTE: Which rewards you qualify for that you receive is entirely up to you! Even if you don't want the reward listed for your donation, you can still donate that amount. At the end of the campaign, we'll send an e-mail to all donors listing the rewards for which you qualify, and you can let us know what you'd like to receive! IT'S EASY IT'S FAST ZOMG.

What You Can Get

First and foremost, our undying love and devotion. But, on top of that, we have a whole list of shwag over there on the right just waiting to be claimed. Copies of the record, special exclusive artwork and merchandise, services only available to contributors, and more! We've come up with a whole slew of rewards and gifts for you guys, but if there's anything else that would make donating worth your while, drop us a line and let us know, and we'll see about adding it to the list!   

SUPERMAJOR THANKS YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

SUPERMAJOR IS....

Brian Bair - Drums
Sarah Engelke - Keyboards, Vocals
Patrick Malone - Bass
Adam Swiderski - Guitar, Vocals
Brooke Tarnoff - Vocals

story:
A shot rings out in the dark and thus begins an evening of seduction, mystery and intrigue .... the "soundtrack" from one of the most iconic eras in American music, film and literary history .... with all of the visuals to support the mood ... It's Jazz Noir! Come on a journey....back in time and experience the sultry and steamy world of a torch singing femme fatal and the private detective who is drawn in like a moth to a flame.... jazz, pulp fiction and film noir .... a sordid story with a twist, a turn and a few more twists .... all backed by a 20 piece orchestra.The greatest songs of the era will be performed live and will be woven into a story line that will be enhanced and embellished with live and video imagery.

Working with some of the top jazz arrangers and musicians and having a fan following of my own in the Los Angeles area, my initial goal will be to produce a full concert in front of a live audience that will be video taped and edited into an electronic press kit (EPK). The ultimate goal will be to submit the EPK  to booking agents and buyers at the major Performing Arts Centers across the U.S and around the world, with the idea of not only booking a tour of the original production, but to also create a license-able commodity for additional production companies in the future. 

The funds will be used to rent the venue; the multimedia elements (screens, projectors, etc.); the sound and lighting equipment; hire and rehearse the orchestra; hire a video crew to shoot and edit a performance EPK; pay for any licenses required for the multimedia portion of the production; pay for any marketing costs to promote the performance and; even though the arrangements and scores for the music are almost completed, there may be additional costs in those areas.   

We encourage you to take a look at Sylvia's website, www.sylviabrooks.net as well as our promotional video http://youtu.be/rhu1RqC7dKU . Just click on our links...provided here.

story:
My Story

Hello, lovely people! ;-) Chantae Cann here... I'm an independent singer/songwriter based out of Atlanta, GA, and as far as I can remember, music has ALWAYS been my LOVE.  I decided to PURSUE it with PASSION and have since been blessed with the AMAZING opportunity to sing as a professional backing vocalist for Grammy Award winning artist, India.Arie.  This has been a DREAM come true!  I've encountered a plethora of equally as breathtaking, opportunities to collaborate with some of the most INSPIRING artists & musicians in the music industry.  In 2008, I began branching out into my solo artistry and I am finally ready to release an OFFICIAL debut project! ;-)

As an independent artist, in can be disheartening when one of the major factors prohibiting you from having a finished quality project is...yup...you guessed it... SWEET MULA!  So I'm reaching out to my beloved supporters, encouragers & appreciators to let you all know that, FIRST and foremost, I appreciate the appreciation! SECONDLY, I have been working on something very special & from the heart for you guys, and NOW, more than ever, I need your support. I humbly extend the invitation to each of you all, that can and will, to consider becoming a part of this meaningful process.               

 

My Mission

"I sing because I LOVE to.  I sing because God has entrusted me with a gift purposed to CHANGE the WORLD one melody at time. I sing to HELP. I sing to HEAL. I sing to COMFORT. I sing to LIBERATE. I sing to APPRECIATE. I sing to MOTIVATE.  I sing to RELEASE. I sing to EXPRESS. I sing because, honestly, It's what I was MADE to do!" ;-) 

 

Cheese, Please!

 
My team-members at over at Love Heals Music and I, are aiming to raise $20,000 in order to finance the launch & release of my debut solo music project scheduled to release in late SPRING of 2013.  At first glance, $20, 000 may LOOK like a lot. ...Heck, at 2nd, 3rd & 4th glance TOO, I know!  However, it is our sole intention to bring you all the best of the best, in EVERY capacity.  The calibre of artistry & musicianship that we intend to present, with your help, will turn out to be one exquisite listening journey.  
 
 

Where's Your Cheddar Going?

Here's a breakdown of what the funds raised will go towards.

$10,000 - Major Recording Expenses ((Studio Time, Musicians, Producer/Engineer            Fees, Mixing/Mastering))

$3,000 - Photo/Video Shoot & Edit for Website Launch & Promo Use

$3,000 - Manufacture/Replication of Physical CD's ((Includes Album Artwork & Graphic Design))

$3000 - Professional PR Services

$500   - Website Launch & Design

$500   - Promo Gear ((Posters, T-Shirts, Hoodies, Fanny Packs, etc...))

 

 

***Any ADDITIONAL funds raised will go towards small tour start up costs, in addition to the launching of our affiliate Not for Profit Organization, also known as, The Love Heals Movement***

 
 

Cool Stuff for YOU!

 

Point blank..If you give money, you will get stuff. The cooler the money, the cooler the stuff.  I think that principle is pretty much universal but don't quote me on those statistics. Please refer to the list of PERKS located on the very RIGHT of this page -->> This way -->> Yup, that's it, keep going -->> You're almost there -->> Destination PERKVILLE arrived! ;-)    

 

 Every Bit Helps

 Whether, you can give a gazillion fafillion dollars ((wink, wink)) ...orrr, not QUITE that amount, we want you to know that we will accept every penny with a smile.  Every bit helps get us one step closer to our goal ;-)

 
 

Don't Worry...Be Happy! There are Other Ways You Can Help :)

 
BENJAMINS lookin' thin?? No worries, friend!  You don't need ENDS to make an IMPACT.  INDIEGOGO has provided some pretty cool share tools, that would mean the world to me if you used them. You can help simply by SPREADING the WORD to all your friends on Facebook, Twitter, (MySpace??), YouTube, SocialCam, Tumblr...etc. Here's a crazy idea...You could even tell a real live person, in PERSON! That'd be exciting, right?!  Tell'em that Chantae Cann is havin' a $20,000 baby and needs your help with the medical costs! That'll cause an riot for sure... Happy Sharing :-)
 
 

Last but NOT Least... THANK YOU!

If you've made it this far down the page, you were either held at gunpoint, OR you are actually somewhat interested in being a part.  Either way, I sincerely THANK YOU for your consideration and value your contribution greatly, whether monetarily or "share-ily", and yes I just made that word up.  I APPRECIATE EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU! THE END ;-) 

 

 

Let's Stay Together 

Here are some quick links to keep us in touch! Send a message, leave a question/comment, listen to music, book a performance, or simply track the progress of this campaign! We'd love to hear from you... 

Media:
www.facebook.com/ChantaeCann
www.twitter.com/ChantaeCann
www.youtube.com/ChantaeCannTV
 
Contact:
ChantaeCannBooking@gmail.com

My team-members at over at Love Heals Music and I, are aiming to raise $20,000 in order to finance the launch & release of my debut solo music project scheduled to release in late SPRING of 2013.  At first glance, $20, 000 may LOOK like a lot. ...Heck, at 2nd, 3rd & 4th glance TOO, I know!  However, it is our sole intention to bring you all the best of the best, in EVERY capacity.  The calibre of artistry & musicianship that we intend to present, with your help, will turn out to be one exquisite listening journey.  

 
 
Where's Your Cheddar Going?
Here's a breakdown of what the funds raised will go towards.
$10,000 - Major Recording Expenses ((Studio Time, Musicians, Producer/Engineer            Fees, Mixing/Mastering))
$3,000 - Photo/Video Shoot & Edit for Website Launch & Promo Use
$3,000 - Manufacture/Replication of Physical CD's ((Includes Album Artwork & Graphic Design))
$3000 - Professional PR Services
$500   - Website Launch & Design
$500   - Promo Gear ((Posters, T-Shirts, Hoodies, Fanny Packs, etc...))
 
 
***Any ADDITIONAL funds raised will go towards small tour start up costs, in addition to the launching of our affiliate Not for Profit Organization, also known as, The Love Heals Movement***
 

 

Cool Stuff for YOU!
 
Point blank..If you give money, you will get stuff. The cooler the money, the cooler the stuff.  I think that principle is pretty much universal but don't quote me on those statistics. Please refer to the list of PERKS located on the very RIGHT of this page -->> This way -->> Yup, that's it, keep going -->> You're almost there -->> Destination PERKVILLE arrived! ;-)    
 

 Every Bit Helps

 Whether, you can give a gazillion fafillion dollars ((wink, wink)) ...orrr, not QUITE that amount, we want you to know that we will accept every penny with a smile.  Every bit helps get us one step closer to our goal ;-)
 
 
Don't Worry...Be Happy! There are Other Ways You Can Help :)
 
BENJAMINS lookin' thin?? No worries, friend!  You don't need ENDS to make an IMPACT.  INDIEGOGO has provided some pretty cool share tools, that would mean the world to me if you used them. You can help simply by SPREADING the WORD to all your friends on Facebook, Twitter, (MySpace??), YouTube, SocialCam, Tumblr...etc. Here's a crazy idea...You could even tell a real live person, in PERSON! That'd be exciting, right?!  Tell'em that Chantae Cann is havin' a $20,000 baby and needs your help with the medical costs! That'll cause an riot for sure... Happy Sharing :-)
 
 
Last but NOT Least... THANK YOU!
If you've made it this far down the page, you were either held at gunpoint, OR you are actually somewhat interested in being a part.  Either way, I sincerely THANK YOU for your consideration and value your contribution greatly, whether monetarily or "share-ily", and yes I just made that word up.  I APPRECIATE EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU! THE END ;-) 
 
 

Let's Stay Together 
Here are some quick links to keep us in touch! Send a message, leave a question/comment, listen to music, book a performance, or simply track the progress of this campaign! We'd love to hear from you... 
Media:
www.facebook.com/ChantaeCann

www.twitter.com/ChantaeCann

www.youtube.com/ChantaeCannTV
 
Contact:
ChantaeCannBooking@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Maurice or 247 for those who know me from days past. I'm in a group called "Out Of Place" with Ugly Lovely & Black Cat Sylvester. We are putting out a new album and want our music pressed to vinyl. The purpose of this campaign is to make vinyl using Indiegogo as a pre order application. You pre order the record, I purchase the vinyl, and then I hand you a fresh new copy of the Out Of Place album.

What We Need & What You Get

We won't need much...just $1000 to pay for the vinyl. Below are pre order packages you can choose from. 

  • Digi Pack - $5 gets you a digital download of the album (once this campaign ends the album will cost $10).
  • Digi Pack + Vinyl - spend $20 and receive a vinyl record along with a digital download code
  • Digi Pack + Vinyl + Autographs - $50 buys you the golden ticket. You will receive a autographed vinyl by the album artist Tim Volodzko, screen printer Ryan Nole and many more.

The Impact

You are helping us put our music on vinyl and that is amazing :) THANK YOU.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell people about this to help us spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kyla Simone. I have been surrounded by music my entire life but it was a special gift of my first guitar on Christmas day, 2005 from my mom that unlocked my passion to share music on a more professional level.

Over the last few years God has inspired me to write a grouping of real-life experience based songs which was an outlet for me to process internally, but also to be eventually share with others who can relate to the messages.

"FlySoar" the EP is all about pursuing our dreams but with a mind bent on doing life God's way.  This campaign was designed to help me reach my goal of completing this EP as well as shooting my first ever music video to the song "Pride" which released in late January 2014.  I have been in talks with an amazing video company and the vision is there, we just need the finances to make it happen.

I desire to produce music that is heartfelt, filled with truth and inspiring, but quality and professionally done.  The hardest part of this process is to have all this bottled creativity and lack one of the things that matters most from a business standpoint, money.  I am independant and have invested so much into my dream but I simply can't realistically do this alone.  The easy thing to do is to just throw in the towel and move on to another pursuit, however the brave thing to do is to continue to fight. This is what I have decided to do.

So in a nutshell, your support  will allow me to accomplish so much. I will be able to complete my EP Project "FlySoar" with one of the most eclectic producers I have ever had the pleasure of working with, Charles Foster of the Dudley's B. Sharp Music Studio. I will also be able to film my first ever music video to my debut single "Pride", and your support will also help in the printing and distribution of the EP once it is complete.  This support means the entire world to me, you have no idea!

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to raise a total of $6000.  Let me break things down a bit.  The first $3500 will go directly towards the cost of production, mixing, mastering, printing, the promotion of my "FlySoar" EP, and lastly a percentage will be donated towards 2 special causes which I will explain in just a moment.  The remaining $2500 will go directly to the video production company to film my music video to "Pride."  Every penny will be used to complete these two projects plus further our passion for outreach.

My producer Charles and I have both decided to split and donate 10% of the funds raise to 2 causes we believe in.  Charles' cause is Gospel for Asia's Bridge of Hope which provides education, food, medical care, and other resources to children and their families in Asian regions.  I will be donating my half to the Virtuous Girls Mentoring Program which is a monthly creative arts and life skills program designed for middle school and high school girls right here in the DMV.  They also host in conjunction with Soul La Femme, Inc. an annual LifeArts Girls Dayshop which takes the same concept but provides a full day of fun and challenging activities and hands on learning experiences for tween and teen girls.  So your support will benefit more than just my project, but the lives of today's young people abroad and right here at home.

In return I am delighted to provide some wonderful perks which serve as my token of gratitude for your love and support of my ministry.  My gifts to you cover everything from a complimentary copy of my new single "Pride", to exclusive "FlySoar" merchandise, an exclusive invitation to the private pre-screening of "Pride" the music video before it officially releases to the public, and a special signed copy of my "FlySoar" EP one week before it hits the stores.

    The Impact

    I am believing that this project will truly make everyday men and women, young and old realize that they are not alone and that there is hope.  This project is intended to reach the furthest ends of the world and impact people in a way that produces forward movement and an interest in knowing more about Christ and how to live for Him instead of simply for ourselves.  I am hopeful that this and my future projects will change the world someday.  We all hurt, bleed, have dreams, and most of all need more...aka God.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      You may not be in the position to help financially but there is still something you can do!  Simply share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, and anyone you think may want to support good music.  You can also contribute by going to iTunes or Amazon and purchasing my new single "Pride" for just $0.99.  Also don't forget to LIKE my Facebook page by visiting www.facebook.com/kylasimone.

story:
WWW.IRELANDIMMERSIONWEEKEND.WEBS.COM

Who: The Ireland Immersion Weekend, is being hosted by The Irish Gift  a group of volunteer artists and professionals. We see our talents as a gift that has been passed down through the generations. We want to share that gift with the world, both online & in person.

Why: This Indiegogo is a fundraising project to preserve and promote the old traditions of Ireland that are in danger of dying out. Traditions such as sean nós dancing and singing, the East Galway music tradition  the Gaelic language, cooking techniques and recipes, folklore and much more.The Ireland Immersion Weekend  strives to  honor the Irish in Middle Tennessee and all those in the USA who have Irish roots.The Mockingbird Sings, a partner of The Irish gift is a musical that traces the roots of country music through Scottish, Irish, Delta Blues and Gospel influences. 

Where: This year’s annual event, the Ireland Immersion Weekend will be held at a beautiful plantation mansion just outside of Nashville. The event will also be streamed online.

When: November 15th, 16th & 17th, 2013

How: Friday night begins with a VIP reception and whiskey tasting, followed by a production of "The Mockingbird Sings". The evening will conclude with an  Irish seisiún with artists from Ireland. Morning festivities begin at 8:00am as guests will enjoy a real Irish breakfast in the beautiful mansion setting and mingle and chat with musicians, lecturers and performers. Later both days the hurlers will be in full-swing giving us a demonstration of the how the game and other sports are played. Guests will enjoy a delicious lunch of homemade delights (recipes all from Ireland). There will also be an opportunity to have a one-on-one or group lesson on an instrument of your choice. 

Lectures are designed to gain a deeper understanding of the different facets of the Irish culture including East Galway style of music (with demonstrations on the respective instruments). The Conamara ponies have been bred in Ireland and are flown over to the Windy Isles Farms near Chicago IL. and will be on display all weekend. You will also have the opportunity to take a jaunt in a real-life donkey and cart!  On Saturday, after the concert there will be an opportunity to sit and relax over a pint in the lovely surroundings of the mansion and cogitate over  the the wonderful days events. Keep an eye on our kitchen, where you can learn how to cook traditional favorites like Irish Soda bread.The Irish Kitchen is open all day Saturday & Sunday for classes and food from 8am to 5pm, and each night concludes with Irish seisiún with artists from Ireland on grounds with firepit til midnight.

story: Hallo zusammen und willkommen bei unserem "Eventgers Music Project"
story_txt: Hallo zusammen und willkommen bei unserem "Eventgers Music Project"

story:
Short Summary

We have been having an amazing run but we are in need of your help to keep it going. We are working on an album with award-winning producer Dan Ledwell to be released sometime in 2013. It's already sounding incredible but we have to finish it and then get it mixed, mastered and manufactured, then we can send it out to the right people. In order to do this we desperately need your help.

But this isn't just a plea for money: we're putting up some seriously unique items and experiences for you to choose from. You get back a lot for what you put in. Partner with us and you can help us make this album AND have a very special connection with the band.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5000 in order to:

  • Pay for recording the album
  • mix the album
  • master the album
  • commission album artwork from a local artist
  • complete publicity for the album and send it to music industry and media
  • manufacture physical copies of the album

 

You can get:

  • pre-release of the album, signed before anyone else
  • private shows
  • unique apparel made by the band
  • Special experiences with the band
  • the knowledge that when you listen to the album you helped create it
  • Bragging rights when you hear it on the radio!

ALSO - Anyone who makes any donation will get a link to a download of the first single when it is released in advance of the album.

The Impact

This album is going to be an amazing work, have no doubt. When it has been completed we can reach out across Canada and the world to send our recorded music out to new listeners, new radio stations, new blogs and new people who work in the industry and may be willing to give us a hand and share the music.

Your patronage helps us grow.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to the campiagn join us on FB and Twitter, and if you enjoy something that we did then share it, RT it or email it to friends and family. That's how music reaches people, and it is often the biggest thing you can do to help us.

story:
UPDATE: Donate today for a chance to win a LARGE "Taralicious" canvas print signed by Tara Strong. 

For the home stretch of our crowdfunding campaign we will randomly choose two people to receive a canvas print of Tara Strong's OC signed by Tara herself. Every $10 donation you send to us gets you a spot in our drawing for these awesome prints.

 

As an added bonus the lucky winners will also receive a custom plushie from Tellab Art, a signed art print from Dori-to, a whole bunch of MLP blind bags and some more pony related awesomeness!

 

Every $10 donation that you make will get  you one drawing in our raffle. So if you donate $20 that will bring your count up to two drawings, $30 for three and so on.

 

Good luck!!!

 

 

F*** Cancer

Seriously...

Cancer is a leading cause of death worldwide. According to the World Health Organization, in 2008, cancer accounted for 7.6 million fatalities (around 13% of all deaths). In Orange, California, 8 year old Kiki Havivy is fighting a nearly impossible battle to not be included in that statistic.

Thankfully, she is not fighting alone.

A group of almost 40 perfect strangers have come together in a random act of kindness to save this little girl. Since October 2012, this group has been hard at work producing an album to benefit Kiki and others like her. With your help, we can make this happen and possibly save some lives in the process.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Producing an album, even for charity, can quickly run up a hefty tab. Although we have done everything we can to minimize the overhead of the album, there are still a few unavoidable debts that we have to cover. Such as: the cost for CDs and Vinyls ($6,500), art prints and shipping ($200), legal fees ($75/hr) and many other costs. 

If you decide to donate to our project, we will make sure that your investment will be worthwhile. In addition to gaining some really good karma, you'll receive some pretty awesome stuff with each donation. We have some great things to give away as a "thank you" for making this project possible.

Before you decide to donate to our cause, we encourage you to donate something to the family that we are doing this to benefit. We would like to see Kiki get the help she needs sooner rather than later. So please, if you are conflicted between donating to us or donating to Kiki's Recovery Fund, we implore you to go here and donate to the original recovery effort instead.

 

Reaching our goal

If we don't reach our goal in time, the money raised will be split evenly. 50% will go to the Havivy family for Kiki and 50% will go to the Pediatric Brain Tumor Foundation.

If we do reach our goal in time, then we will be able to press and ship our initial order of 1,000 CDs and 500 vinyl LPs. If every physical unit is sold, then we will be able to raise over $30,000 for Kiki and other cancer patients worldwide!

If we exceed our goal before time is up, half of every $100 donation (or 50% of every $100) we receive will be split between: CURE Childhood Cancer, Inc. and Pediatric Brain Tumor Foundation.

 

The Impact

Our campaign is based on a very simple model: make music > raise money > cure cancer. Your donation can turn this model into something very real. Let's work together and help many children who need it the most.

 

Help make our campaign a success and you will be making a massive difference in the lives of many children afflicted with cancer. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough, we totally get it!  However, you don't just have to donate to help, because there is another big way that you can help our cause.

Making a whole lot of noise about this project can be one of the best ways to help us get funded. So, tell your friends, family, coworkers, teachers, random people on the streets, tell anyone and everyone what we are doing. This will help us, Kiki, and so many more that need it.

 

Thank you so very much.

 

-The Cure for Kiki Fund Team

 

 

For updates, check back here weekly or visit our Twitter!

https://twitter.com/savekiki

Don't forget to support Kiki Havivy in her fight against brain cancer

https://secure.giveforward.com/donate/33072/

 

By donating to this crowd funding effort, you acknowledge that your donations are not tax-deductible. Since we do not qualify as a 501(c)(3) organization, we cannot give you any tax breaks with the IRS (Sorry!). We do apologize for any inconvenience. We hope you will still consider being a part of this amazing project!

Times are tough, we totally get it!  However, you don't just have to donate to help, because there is another big way that you can help our cause.
Making a whole lot of noise about this project can be one of the best ways to help us get funded. So, tell your friends, family, coworkers, teachers, random people on the streets, tell anyone and everyone what we are doing. This will help us, Kiki, and so many more that need it.
 
Thank you so very much.
 
-The Cure for Kiki Fund Team
 
 
For updates, check back here weekly or visit our Twitter!
https://twitter.com/savekiki
Don't forget to support Kiki Havivy in her fight against brain cancer
https://secure.giveforward.com/donate/33072/
 
By donating to this crowd funding effort, you acknowledge that your donations are not tax-deductible. Since we do not qualify as a 501(c)(3) organization, we cannot give you any tax breaks with the IRS (Sorry!). We do apologize for any inconvenience. We hope you will still consider being a part of this amazing project!

story:
Your support will help me continue to make new music. Funds will also be used to help kids around the world get some basic necessities, like food, medicine, and shelter. Win/win!



Bert Jerred on Soundcloud

I create music and share it with anyone who will listen. That, in a nutshell, is what prompted the launch of this project. That, and a desire for better equipment than what I am using now.

I have worked on crowdfunding projects in the past, and successfully managed a comic book launch last year. I'm hoping to follow that success with this one: making new connections and friends, finding new listeners, making new music, and now, more important than any of the above, truly helping children in need.

Questions? Suggestions? Email me at charlesherbertjerred@gmail.com. I look forward to hearing from you.

story:
Dead in 5 is an original, melodic hard rock band from Detroit. We sound like a hemi-powered hybrid of Clutch, Soundgarden and Motorhead - fueled by Detroit Muscle.

Since debuting in January 2013 - we've been on the fast track to success - headlining Detroit's top venues and festivals,and  performing to packed crowds.  Now, we are ready to break out NATIONALLY. Our singles "Pressue Head" and "Burn My Eyes" from our debut CD have been getting rave reviews.

Now it's time to take it to the NEXT LEVEL:

To go from local heroes to an in-demand national act - we need RADIO AIRPLAY.  Given the nature of the music business - we need to hire a reputable radio promotion company to do this.  We've found one - they represent the likes of BLACK SABBATH and are behind Dead in 5 - 1000%!

But this costs money - at least $5000 to start an 8 week radio campaign.

Do you want to hear Dead in 5 on Octane, Sixx Sense, and YOUR favorite commercial rock radio station? This is the way to get US in YOUR EARS :)

You can help by donating $5 to $1000.  We've come up with some fun premiums - and anyone who knows us - can atest to that fact that we're not only talented - but great people who are a blast to hang around with!

If you can't donate - please help us by sharing this campaign on social media - and requesting Dead in 5 on your favorite ROCK RADIO STATION!

Thank you for helping our rock and roll dreams come true! We hope to see you on tour soon!

More on Dead in 5 at:

http://facebook.com/deadinfive

and

http://twitter.com/@deadin5

story:
If the video's audio isn't coming through for you, listen to us sing here:

www.chiefofstaff.bandcamp.com

Chief of Staff

Chief of Staff is a five-part all male a cappella group that has taken form over the last 6 months here in Bellingham. The members, Aidan Glaze, AJ Russo, Hunter Dunn, Ian Slater, and Luke Robinson originally came together back in April of 2013 simply to put together an a cappella song to sing for their school talent show (they are all seniors and juniors at Bellingham High School). However, due somewhat to the outstanding popularity of the performance at the talent show, they decided to continue performing and start Bellingham's newest a cappella band, Chief of Staff. All sharing a deep passion for music, and a cappella especially, Chief of Staff wanted to have more chances to perform that style of music for people around the community. Over the summer, Hunter Dunn and Aidan Glaze spent a lot of time creating their own arrangements of songs from many different genres including titles such as Maroon 5's "She Will Be Loved", Dobie Gray's "Drift Away", and "Fix You" by Coldplay, so that when fall arrived, they had a solid set of performance-ready songs. They have recently started work on their first album (as yet untitled), and they hope to release it in the next few months, but have released a single - Fix You - that is available for anyone who wants to get a sense of their sound. At the end of 2013 Chief of Staff won the Kafe 104.1 "Stars of Christmas" contest, and received a $1000 prize for their school's music department with a cover of "Indiana Christmas" written by the kings of a cappella, Straight No Chaser. As they continue work on their album, they are ever in search of venues to perform music at. If anyone would like to hire Chief of Staff for any event, they can reach them at bhschiefofstaff@gmail.com. Currently they are self-recording and producing, yet hope with the proceeds from concerts and music sales to soon be able to afford professional studio recording.

Aside from being members of Chief of Staff, every member of the group is a talented musician in his own right. Hunter Dunn is proficient at many instruments including piano and guitar, Ian Slater is an amazing cellist who, with his instrumental quartet, Raisin Brahms, won the State Solo and Ensemble Competition, Luke Robinson has been in lead roles in Musical Productions at the 5th Avenue Theatre in Seattle, AJ Russo is a fabulous singer/songwriter and guitar player who has released his own EP, and Aidan Glaze have been in numerous stage productions, and recently discovered talents for arranging, beat boxing, and music production. They are all members of Showstoppers, the advanced small choral ensemble from BHS.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for funds for two things:

  1. We need funds to pay for studio time to produce our music
  2. We need funds to purchase performance equipment so that we can perform in the community

The Impact

With a donation, you will be helping us foster the arts in our community. With the cuts in funding to music ed programs, the more that we can prove that the arts matter, the better. Our group has already shown people in our community the power of music, and producing an album and performing for the community will only further that. On top of that, all the members of our group are aspiring musicians, and you will be furthering their musical careers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people can't contribute financially, but you can spread the word, both about our group, and about this donation system. Please help us further a cappella music in our community, our lives, and for the rest of the world.

story:
Hey All,

Earthquakes and Butterflies. Sound like life? Yep. Heartwrenching, beautiful, epic, personal, terrifying, joyful, tender, funny, passionate and ultimately indescribable. That's why for me the vibrations of sound best capture the full spectrum of feelings that come with being human. Through all the 'Earthquakes and Butterflies' of my own life, I've done my best to be honest in the journey. In these songs, I'm sharing my fears, joys, dreams and sorrows with you. I hope that in listening to this music you will be touched deeply, and share with me the amazing experience of being fully alive.

I also know that we have the ability to 'morph our dreams' as we go, and like the butterfly symbolizes, transcend our deepest fears into the truest reality we can imagine for ourselves! That's why I'm calling this project, Morphic Dream. The symbol for my project is a human butterfly, and represents wholeness.

I have an extensive background in music composition and orchestration, performing, recording and teaching music in multiple genres..so, it' no mistake that this album is a genre-defying kaleidescope of electro-acoustic pop, rock, tantalizing beats and quirky classical orchestration. For a sample of songs that are on the album go to: www.sonicbids.com/morphicdream. The Apple and Eve video featured here in the indegogo gallery is the only all acoustic song on the EP.

I've paid alot out of pocket to record, mix and master nearly 1/2 of this album, and  $7,000 more is required to finish it, pay a graphic designer and print the CD's. Any extra funding I raise will go towards creating a top-notch website that is being constructed right now. So, THANKS FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART for your contribtions and support, in all forms and ways. In sharing this music with the world, I offer the best of my most authentic and true self and life experiences. Thank you for helping me EMPOWER this DREAM!!

 In Peace, Joy and Abundance,

 Jessa Young

story:
We are MARRY ME, a blues-punk-rock band from Vancouver, British Columbia, made up of four best friends from entirely different musical backgrounds; Danny Lovelock (the punk) sings and plays lead guitar, Natalee Fera (the musical theatre buff) sings and plays bass, Kenny Dietrich (the metal-head) plays drums, and Adam Jeal (the soul-singing model) sings and plays keys. Our music is dirty, pretty, and chic, a new sub-genre, unlike any other! We love our music and our friends and family, that is why we are coming to you to help us!

We are embarking on a summer super-tour of North America; 20 dates have been booked so far in the US and Canada, June 28-September 1, (check out our website for the up-to-date tour schedule http://www.marrymemusic.ca/shows-3/). We've done it all ourselves in order to bring our music and personalities to a whole new audience of music lovers in Canada and the US! You, our fabulous friends and family, will help us get there!

With this campaign, ALL FUNDS raised are going towards purchasing a trailer to hold all of our band gear as well as for gas money to drive us over 17,000 kilometres as we tour the continent! $2000 will buy us our trailer, while $2000 will help us with gas; whether or not we make our goal of $4000, you are helping!

With the support and love from all of you we have accomplished SO MUCH thus far in our two years together as a band: we've won a battle of the bands, played on CTV Morning Live twice, put out an EP, a Christmas song, TWO music videos, a mini BC/Alberta tour, and now an upcoming full-length album (June 24) and North American tour. For all of your support along the way, YOU are so much a part of Marry Me too! Get involved in this tour with us by donating (and getting RAD perks; check them out) or even just by sharing our website & our tunes!

story:
Introduction

It was a beautiful evening on May 30th, 2013 in Istanbul. Many people came together in the central Gezi Park. There were rumors that the park with its old trees was to be shed for a major construction of a new mall. More and more people went there in their love for the park.

On May 31st, 2013 police forces started brutally to push people out of the park. This was the start of one of the biggest protest in Turkey for peace, freedom and democracy.

Turkish pianist and composer Fazil Say was inspired by what happened and wrote a concerto for two pianos and orchestra based on the events. A piano sonata and songs about Gezi followed.

On May 30th, 2014, in the Volkstheater Wien, Ferhan & Ferzan Önder, Serenad Bagcan, Martin Grubinger, Fazil Say, the Percussive Planet Ensemble, the Würtembergische Philharmonie Reutlingen and conductor Ola Rudner come together to play the Gezi Concert. They see the concert as a celebration of democracy, liberty, and human dignity.


Where the money goes

The money raised from Indiegogo will support making the concert possible. All soloists relinquish their fees to support the Gezi victims and their families. Also all net profit of the concert will go towards the victims and their families.


Our goal

With the Gezi Concert in Vienna we want to:

  • support the victims of the Gezi unrests and their families
  • celebrate democracy, liberty, and human dignity

story:
Who We Are

We are an alternative rock band from the town of Clarks Summit Pennsylvania. Although young (ages 17 -19), we have worked hard for nearly all of our lives to perfect our abilities as musicians. For the past two years, we have brought together our diverse influences and styles to write countless original songs, nine of which appeared on our first self-produced album, Someday in 2013. Because of the incredible support we have received from our amazing fans, we have been able to perform at venues throughout PA, NJ, and NY including the Stone Pony and the Sherman Theater. 


Our mission is to create music with an eclectic, fresh, expressive, and artistic instrumental foundation that carries stories and messages we can all connect to. We want to take our music, share it with the world, and bring people together over it! 

Why We Need Your Help

Releasing our first album Someday was a huge step for us. But since then, the material we have been writing has reached a new level. So, in order to provide you these better songs at the best quality possible, we have decided to record professionally. 


We have been given an offer to record at the Cannon Found Soundation studio in NYC with the professional producer Jesse Cannon. 
http://cannonfoundsoundation.com
Unfortunately, after paying for the first album out of pocket, we are broke. So in order to bring you this new EP, we need your help to raise $3,500 which will be just enough to pay for a week in the studio. 
What's in it for You?
       1. Check out and download music from the Someday album FREE at:
                  www.reverbnation.com/masterfox
      2.New music that will BLOW YOUR MIND and MAKE YOU FEEL ALIVE!
      3. Prizes

             Even if you give just a little, we can give you a lot back. Check out the awesome perks we've listed below. The more you donate, the more we can give back to you! 

And of course, everyone who donates any amount at all will be recognized on our page in a list of all those who made this project possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that budgets may be tight in this economy. Trust us, as a band we have stretched our own budget and put a lot of funds from our own pockets into this experience just to come this far. 

If you can't afford to donate, but would still like to help out, here's what you can do:

1. Share, share, share and..... share

       Show our music to your friends, family, neighbors, or whoever. If they like   what we are doing, ask them to donate and/or share with others they know!

2. Take advantage of the indiegogo share tools on this site.

3. Write to your congressman or the president of the US, explaining our valiant cause. Who knows, it may work!

4. Organize a parade to promote the campaign! If you did that, I think we would definitely show up. 

5. Come to one of our shows, or even just get in touch through Facebook.

      We love our fans, and if you like our music, we'd love to hear from you! Become a part of this journey that may take us and our music to the ends of the Earth. Maybe Someday. 


And as always, THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!!

We couldn't have reached this point without you. Please help us continue forward in reaching this goal. 


-Master Fox

www.facebook.com/masterfoxsounds

www.reverbnation.com/masterfox

masterfoxsounds@gmail.com

story:
Who we are

Vocal Productions NYC, corp.  is  a not-for-profit organization, committed to producing the highest caliber of vocal stage experience and providing artists a place to make art! We consider it our responsibility to cultivate opportunities to perform a role, conduct an ensemble or accompany a major musical work within positive, nonjudgmental surroundings. These opportunities expose professional and emerging professional artists to the business of opera and give them a venue in which to display their talents and accomplishments.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to produce this masterpiece work of Wagner. To put on a show of this size many people have already put in hours of their time and hard work. It is a labor of love and we're all doing it for the art!!

  • The production will have a 60+ piece orchestra provided by the United Nations Orchestra as well as our own VPNYC players - ALL Volunteering their time
  • All of the soloists and chorus have volunteered their time, putting in months of preparation to bring this masterpiece of music and art to the public
  • In an effort to provide maximum opportunity three casts have been created which also means a longer rehearsal period, which means more time and money spent
  • The rehearsal spaces are being generously provided by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints for free
  • We have a talented team of high school students who are volunteering to build our set and designed costumes
  • All staff working for Vocal Productions are all volunteer - no money goes to the Artistic Director or the Administrative Staff. All proceeds go to the production.


However we still have to pay for:

  • Insurance for the hall
  • Lighting
  • Sets
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Transportation (Transport set and large orchestra instruments etc)
  • Conductor
  • Pianist fee
  • Recording crew
  • Extra rehearsal space
  • Director
  • Production Manager/Stage Crew
  • Supertitles


Please donate!

  • All donations are TAX DEDUCTABLE
  • Please see our list of donation perks
  • Whether it's $1 $5 or $5000 anything is welcome 
  • Large or small- every penny helps!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't donate, then we can still use your help!

  • Volunteer your time and expertise by reaching out to vocalproductionsnyc@gmail.com
  • get the word out by tweeting, texting, e-mailing, or sharing the short link above
  • Support the preservation of this amazing work and come see the show! :) :) :)
story_txt:
Who we areVocal Productions NYC, corp.  is  a not-for-profit organization, committed to producing the highest caliber of vocal stage experience and providing artists a place to make art! We consider it our responsibility to cultivate opportunities to perform a role, conduct an ensemble or accompany a major musical work within positive, nonjudgmental surroundings. These opportunities expose professional and emerging professional artists to the business of opera and give them a venue in which to display their talents and accomplishments.What We Need & What You GetWe need your help to produce this masterpiece work of Wagner. To put on a show of this size many people have already put in hours of their time and hard work. It is a labor of love and we're all doing it for the art!!The production will have a 60+ piece orchestra provided by the United Nations Orchestra as well as our own VPNYC players - ALL Volunteering their time
All of the soloists and chorus have volunteered their time, putting in months of preparation to bring this masterpiece of music and art to the publicIn an effort to provide maximum opportunity three casts have been created which also means a longer rehearsal period, which means more time and money spentThe rehearsal spaces are being generously provided by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints for free
We have a talented team of high school students who are volunteering to build our set and designed costumesAll staff working for Vocal Productions are all volunteer - no money goes to the Artistic Director or the Administrative Staff. All proceeds go to the production.
However we still have to pay for:
Insurance for the hall
Lighting
Sets
Costumes
Props
Transportation (Transport set and large orchestra instruments etc)
Conductor
Pianist fee
Recording crew
Extra rehearsal space
Director
Production Manager/Stage Crew
Supertitles

All donations are TAX DEDUCTABLE
Please see our list of donation perks

story:
Who are the T Sisters?

The T Sisters are three real sisters--Erika, Rachel and Chloe Tietjen.  We've been singing and making music our whole lives, but 4 or 5 years ago we began writing and playing together in earnest.  Following our first EP in 2011, we've brought together 12 of our songs, all originals except one, to create our first full-length album.  This album is our chance to take these songs and, supported by a team of talented musicians and industry professionals, craft each one into its strongest form.  

This fundraising campaign will give supporters the opportunity to bring to life a strong and vibrant collection of songs, and give shape to this sister trio's artistic visions.  We hope that this album will help to launch our careers as full-time artists, working collaboratively in our sisterhood!

We're making an album and we need help! Here's where the funds will go.

In order to transform each song into the best version of itself, we hired a tremendously talented team of musicians, a fantastic producer, super qualified engineers and a top notch graphic designer/photographer.

Here is a rough breakdown of our costs:

  1. $13,000- Recording/Production/Mixing/Mastering/CD Art and Design: Includes studio musician fees, airfare for hired musicians, recording studio rental, studio engineer fees, producer fees, mixing engineer fees, mastering engineer fees, and album artwork fees. Holy cow! 
  2. $3000- Mass production printing our first run of the CD + shipping + tax
  3. $1050- indiegogo/ Amazon fees 
  4. $300- Copyright/publishing fees 
  5. $3000- Promotion

As you can see, our total costs are more than what we're asking. If we exceed our goal, those funds will go towards additional promotion and towards making a killer vid!

For your generosity we've imagined up a host of fun rewards! 

  • Digital Download of our brand new album
  • Physical copy of the brand new CD 
  • T Sisters t-shirts--cozy, high-quality American Apparel t-shirts in various styles and colors 

   

  • Two premium tickets and two refreshments at the T Sisters' Variety show. The show takes place at the sisters' live/work space in Oakland and features performers from various media and genres. The show is always a hoot! You must make a reservation at the show of your choice and tickets are subject to availability. Don't wait to reserve your perk! More info on the Variety show Here 

                               

  • Personalized greeting in song--you’ll be the talk of the town with a T Sisters song for your answering machine!  Or you can start your day with the T Sisters on your alarm clock!

  • Afternoon tea with the T Sisters!  T Sisters will come to your home with treats and tea to serenade you and up to ten friends at an afternoon gathering.  (If over 30 miles from T Sisters base, additional payment can be arranged appropriate to travel time.  Gathering must occur at a mutually agreed upon time and date.                                          

  • T Sisters will learn and record for youtube a song of your choosing!             (T Sisters reserve the right to refuse to do a song if it’s offensive or otherwise impossible.  We will do our best to accommodate your request!)

  • T Sisters will write a personalized song that you can use for any special occasion, like a marriage proposal, an important birthday, an anniversary, etc.  We will have a conversation to get a sense of important details needed to craft the song.

  • T Sisters house concert (your house)--T Sisters will perform two 45-minute sets of music at your private party or house concert!  (Date must be mutually agreed upon and fit into T Sisters’ schedule.)

  • T Sisters concert at our theater space--T Sisters will host a house concert at their unique warehouse space for you and up to 30 guests.  (Number is slightly negotiable.)  Details to be discussed with the sisters.  (Date must be mutually agreed upon and fit into T Sisters’ schedule.) 

This is really really really really important to us!

This year, we have made a huge leap of faith in deciding to make music and performance our full-time path. Our hope is to share our music with anyone who might take some comfort or joy from our sister harmony and songs and we really appreciate your support, in whatever form it might come.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, we totally understand. Other ways you can help?

  • Come see us at one of our live shows
  • Share our campaign via email or social media
  • Share our music with your friends!

story:
I recently received a call from a radio promoter based out of Los Angeles who is responsible for radio campaigns with artists like Green Day, Cee-Lo Green and Kanye West.  His company got ahold of my latest single and believes it has strong potential for mainstream radio.  They loved it so much, they even offered their services at half the normal rate since I am an independent artist with a smaller budget.

The problem?  I still can't afford it.  Mainstream radio campaigns can run anywhere from $20,000-$100,000 for major artists.  I am being offered a once in a lifetime opportunity to secure one of these campaigns at less than $10,000.  For any independent musician, this is a life changing opportunity.

What We Need

I am needing to raise $7,200 in 15 days.  $6,500 of this would go toward a 10 week radio push.  This money pays for the staff and all materials while pitching the song. $400 would go toward a digital distribution package that would get the single in the playlists at each station.  The remaining money would cover the percentage this site takes as a fee.

Details Of The Campaign

  • Servicing to 300+ top market (TOP 40 / HOT AC) stations around the US.
  • Servicing to XM stations, Music Choice (TV), DMX (services restaurants, retails stores, gyms, etc)

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone can give money, but there are plenty ways for you to help get this campaign moving and set us up for a successful radio single.

  • Share this campaign!  Along with links to my music.  www.iamstevencooper.com
  • Call your stations and start requesting 'Drunken Nights' by Steven Cooper.
  • Send links to the single (once released), to any DJ's, nightclubs, or anyone involved with entertainment.

story:
We are singer and lyricist, Airlie Scott and pianist and composer Simon Clark and we are working together on a debut solo album of inspirational songs entitled "Skyward". 

We met in 2012 working together on music for a Church Alive conference and this was the beginning of our music making together. We sensed in each other a strong musical bond, and a combined spiritual vision.  We were invited in February 2013 to give a concert of inspirational music together in Woking and this collaboration has led directly into the preparation and plans for this album.

This is an album Airlie has been waiting to make for years and after meeting Simon she just knew he was the one to help it take wing!


The Album

Skyward will include some fresh recordings of well-loved songs as well as some newly recorded compositions by Simon Clark and a debut song co-written by Simon and Airlie for this album. An album of inspirational songs for everyday. 

The album will include some favourites such as "On Eagle's Wings" by Michael Joncas, "The Lord Bless You and Keep You" by John Rutter, "Consecration" by John Ness Beck, 'Be Not Afraid" by Craig Courtney as well as a beautiful setting of "The Lord's is my Shepherd" by Simon himself.

We are planning to keep the arrangements simple yet powerful, piano and voice with the occasional cello or oboe part counterpointing and weaving in and out of the music, rather like a gentle breeze playing across the music and enhancing the message.

We hope you will find the album inspirational, healing, uplifting and engaging…songs not out of place if heard in church but also something with a contemporary feel and a joy to listen to by oneself.

We just love working together and hope that you too will benefit from the joy of this collaboration! 

Why Skyward?

Notes on Skyward: 

We love the metaphor of a bird taking skyward flight.

The uplift. The joy. The naturalness. The power and the beauty.

The ability to soar above the earth with strength, perfect balance, and return for a safe landing.

It's good to think of prayer as skyward flight, heavenward thought, that lifts you up and out of difficulty, fear or pain to soar in divine reflection, free, rested, strong.

The bird breaking out of the egg and preening its wings for skyward flight* is the most natural and most wonderful thing. Just as nature allows for progress, upward lift and forward motion, so this is part of our natural state of being. To soar above fear and limitation and feel and know ourselves as limitless being winged by divine reflection.

Skyward seemed the perfect title for this collection of songs celebrating uplifted thought, prayerful being, healing melodies and lyrics.

Help us take flight!

Obviously, there is a cost to producing this album, but with your help we can make it a reality.  We're not in it for the money (we wish).  We're in it for the music and for the joy of bringing the inspiration of soul-filled music to others.

Here's a breakdown of the costs we still need to meet: 

Recording Engineer

£1,000.00

Studio Hire, piano tuning etc

£750.00

Additional Musician Hire

£750.00

CD Design

£500.00

CD Duplication

£1,000.00

Mechanical Licences 500 cds

£500.00

CD Artwork Printing

£400.00

TOTAL: 

£4,900.00

Please help us to enable this project to be completed, and take flight in time for our deadline. Just click on the FUND THIS CAMPAIGN BUTTON to DONATE. 

Please feel under no pressure to donate, but we'd love your help if you can. If not, we do hope you'll sample our new CD when we release it on our website.

Thank you for your generous help, please check our video above and see our perks on the right hand side.

Every little helps and with your help this new CD of inspirational songs can take flight!

Other Ways You Can Help

-Even if you can't help us financially, please do share news of this new CD with friends who you think would appreciate it. 

-Join our mailing list: Just email us at: info@skywardcd.co.uk

-Please share this page with your friends. 

More about us

For more detailed biography information, and to see photos from the recording days, please check out our website. www.skywardcd.co.uk

Airlie Scott is a singer and actress with her heart in soulful, inspirational music. 

In the inspirational music field she has been working with the Newsong Group (www.newsonggroup.co.uk) since 2005 touring, recording and singing on 4 albums to date.  She has sung solos in Church since she was a teenager and is delighted to be finally making a solo album of sacred songs, a long awaited desire and the spiritual home of her musical heart.

Simon Clark is a composer and pianist and his music is published predominantly by Kevin Mayhew Publishers in the UK and by Jackman Music in the USA. Simon is also a composer for Watchfire Music, a digital sheet music publishing outfit based in New York. He recently recorded his own album of inspirational piano compositions entitled "The Golden Days of Summer which is available through his own website: http://www.simonclark.uk.com/online-shop.html

Many thanks in advance for all your support, love and help.

Airlie Scott and Simon Clark

www.skywardcd.co.uk

SongWise Productions

*"Fixing your gaze on the realities supernal, you will rise to the spiritual consciousness of being, even as the bird which has burst from the egg and preens its wings for a skyward flight." Mary Baker Eddy 

"Those who wait on the Lord shall renew their strength;
They shall mount up with wings like eagles,
they shall run and not be weary, they shall walk and not faint." Isaiah 40: 31

story:
Du nouveau pour 2015 !

Après un premier EP "Une jeunesse à côté", auto produit, enregistré dans un garage et une soixantaine de dates dans toute la France pour venir vous faire écouter notre musique, notre groupe finit l'année 2014 en enregistrant 5 nouveaux titres, toujours plus tranchants et toujours plus rock'n roll.

Notre nouvel EP "L'Entreprise" sera enregistré cette fois-ci au studio Infernale Machine (tenu par Matteo Mannoni) dans une église d'une acoustique naturelle exceptionnelle. 

(Ci-dessous le "Front" de la pochette de "L'Entreprise", collage réalisé par le groupe. Est prévu une pochette de type Digifile avec un livret 16 pages recto/verso. )


La sortie de ce nouveau disque est prévue pour le 24 Janvier 2015 et sera disponible lors de notre premier concert de l'année, à cette date, au BlackSheep   Montpellier. CONCERT en entrée libre avec la présence des From The Basement ainsi que les lillois Jack's on Fire.

Afin de nous aider à financer sa réalisation, nous vous invitons à nous soutenir TOUT SIMPLEMENT en pré-commandant "L'Entreprise".

Nous le presserons en 1000 exemplaires (format Digifile avec un livret 16 pages) et le distribuerons sur place le 24 Janvier au Blacksheep, ou par courier pour les personnes éloignées de notre région.

Pré-commander ? Pourquoi faire ?

Grâce à cette pré-commande, vous produisez indirectement la réalisation de l'EP.

En effêt le coût total de l'enregistrement, mixage, mastering, pressage de cet EP nécessite environ 3500 €.

Avec la garantie d'une vente d'au moins 100 CDs vendus avant sa sortie nous amortissons (dans cet exemple), une partie de sa réalisation grâce à vous.

 Et vous ? Et bien vous vous régalez les oreilles à la maison ou dans votre voiture, entre amis, vous l'offrez à vos proches, et on se retrouve le 24 Janvier pour la sortie de cet EP.

Et donc vous pensez avancer grâce à ça ?

C'est justement parce que vous étiez plus de 600 à avoir acheté notre premier EP durant nos lives, que l'on souhaite aller plus loin ! 
C'est également pourquoi nous préférons cette fois-ci réaliser un disque de qualité studio pour nos nouveaux morceaux qui sont le fruit d'un travail acharné et passionné. 
Nous sommes 5 musiciens + notre ingénieur son + notre manager. 
Un nouveau clip du groupe sortira très prochainement, une tournée est prévue, des résidences dans de supers salles, nous comptons également démarcher un grand nombre de labels et presses à la sortie de l'EP.
Vous pouvez donc pré-commander cet EP grâce aux contreparties proposées sur la droite de cette page.
Nous vous remercions pour votre soutien, et travaillons dur pour vous présenter un nouveau show à la hauteur de vos attentes  !

C'est justement parce que vous étiez plus de 600 à avoir acheté notre premier EP durant nos lives, que l'on souhaite aller plus loin ! 

C'est également pourquoi nous préférons cette fois-ci réaliser un disque de qualité studio pour nos nouveaux morceaux qui sont le fruit d'un travail acharné et passionné. Nous sommes 5 musiciens + notre ingénieur son + notre manager. Un nouveau clip du groupe sortira très prochainement, une tournée est prévue, des résidences dans de supers salles, nous comptons également démarcher un grand nombre de labels et presses à la sortie de l'EP.Vous pouvez donc pré-commander cet EP grâce aux contreparties proposées sur la droite de cette page.Nous vous remercions pour votre soutien, et travaillons dur pour vous présenter un nouveau show à la hauteur de vos attentes  !

story:
Montero - A Mexican Band with a multilingual dream

Hello and thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign.

I am Rafael Montero, and I speak on behalf of my brothers to give you a general idea of what we are doing.

My brother Daniel started the whole concept for Montero. He actually is the driving force of this band. My brother David and I consider Daniel to be a musical genious, and I'll tell you why that is. When he was just a little baby kid, he would make sounds with his mouth and it suddenly hit us that he was beat boxing to the rhythm of the songs. When he was 4, my father bought us a keyboard and I would sit at it and try to play the songs that were in it, and my Daniel joined me and started to play the songs then and there. Fast forward 20 years and without any real musical training, Daniel can recreate songs, instrument by instrument just by hearing the song and he can play them on his keyboard and make musical arrangements like they were the easiest thing in the world.

But my little bro had an idea in his mind, he wanted to make something with his brothers. And he approached me for helping him write songs, since for the longest time, one of my passions has been creative writing, but working on a song with Daniel has been one of the most fun things I've ever done.

When did this all start?

Daniel became one of the judges for a musical talent show for his college last year, and there, he meet two producers, Julián Cerrillo and Bruno Barrera, heads of One Take Records. They saw what Daniel could do and offered him the chance to record music with them. When we got to the studio for the first time, we instantly clicked with Julián and Bruno and became great friends and they are very invested in our work. So much so, that they have been doing their hard work almost for free. But, in order to keep doing this we need help. Because for the completion of this project, the expenses are big.

We are from Monterrey, Mexico, and one of the things we've noticed from fellow artists here is that they seldom or never really do work in english. Some latin american artists do, but most mexican artists don't. So we thought it would be great, to launch an album that had english and spanish songs. It's an album ranging from Pop to Rock and also rock and pop ballads. But we don't want to make dumb pop songs that repeat a single verse over and over, we want to put lyrics that everyone can enjoy but also complex enough to not bore.

What you will help us accomplish with the funding
You will help us to take the first step into the world of music and help us also materialize Daniel's and our Dream, to become Artists and bring our music to everyone we can.

What we need & What You Get

Ok so what we need is $7500 dollars. This is going to go into:

  • Mixing and Master expenses $1,500
  • Physical Disc Copies $1000
  • Marketing Campaign $600
  • Music Video for the single $800
  • Production Crew wages $1300
  • Rental of Recording Studio for the duration of the project $1500
  • Special goodies for supporters $800
Now, for supporting us, you get the following stuff at different tiers:

The Impact

With your contributions you'll not only help us, but you'll also will open the door to other artists like ourselves in One Take Records who also want to fulfill their dreams and bring their music to you all.

Risks & Challenges

Now, what happens if we don't meet the goal? Well, our campaign is flexible because we have to start paying our staff. And we really need this amount. We know we will meet the goal, because there's a lot of amazing and supportive people in the indiegogo community. So we WILL fulfill the requests of the people who do support and fund us. Even if we can't reach the goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now we know that many people want to contribute but sometimes it's not possible to do so with money, so there's a bunch of ways you can help us. Promote this campaign, share it with your friends. And join our community in Facebook, Twitter and Youtube to keep in touch with us, as we want to keep in touch with you.

Join the following:

Please subscribe and follow us on our official sites:
https://www.youtube.com/user/MonteroO...
https://www.facebook.com/MonteroOfficial
https://www.twitter.com/MonteroBros

story:
Short Summary

The Mizzerables are Joe Mizzi, Adam Instefjord, Dave Vazzano, and Korey Brisendine. We have all been or are in a number of bands including Common Rider, Ten Ninety, About the Mess, Searching for Sunlight, Lights Alive, and Bottle Kids. I, Joe, also run a record label called Whoa! Records that releases independent recordings by underground acts of the punk/indie variety. Because a lot of my cashflow is tied up in releases for the label, money for my own band is tight. We are working on recording our debut full length, and are turning to our fans, friends, and family for help. Essentially this campaign allows you to pre-order a number of items related to the release, and that helps us understand the cashflow we will have on hand to get everything done. Will it get done anyway? Rest assured, it will.

So have a look around, and make a pledge if you can, we truly appreciate every dollar we get towards helping us complete this record. You can get a preview of what (may) appear on the album by going to http://themizzerables.com. You can stream some tunes or download them by joining our mailing list. If you would like to know what it really takes to get an independent record done, here is a break down of our estimated costs:

  • Tracking - $3,500
  • Mixing - $1,000
  • Mastering - $1,000
  • Equipment - $1,000
  • CD Pressing - $1,000
  • Vinyl Pressing - $2,500

Total: $10,000.

These costs are pretty low comparitively speaking because we have our own studio, and our engineer (Adam) will be doing this for a heavily discounted rate. Any money we raise will be used in the order above to help cover costs.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise as much as we can towards getting the project done. We certainly don't have the following, being so new, to raise the entire cost, but any little bit will help us avoid piling up debt to get the project done.
  • We are offering advanced copies of the album, physical copies of the ablum, t-shirts, stickers, and other items in return for pledges. We are also offering private concerts and free tickets to our shows.
  • Every penny we raise will go towards the release. The more we raise, the more we will be able to do (i.e. more t-shirt designs, better packaging, etc.).

The Impact

By making a pledge, you will help us make more music, and that makes us extremely happy and we owe a debt to everyone who has and does help us along the journey. We all have something we are passionate about, making music is ours.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot make a donation. Please consider sharing our campaign on your facebook or twitter feeds. Spreading the word can be very difficult (and costly), but with social media, we all are able to make a small dent and save each other a few bucks in spreading the word about our various endevours. There are plenty of sharing tools attached to this campaign to make it easy.

Also, you can sign up for our mailing list at http://themizzerables.com to get updates on what we are doing, where we are playing, and discount offers once the album comes out.

To everyone that has taken the time to view this campaign, THANK YOU!!!
