story:
In Chicago there is a recording studio owned by Steve Albini. The people who frequent the music forum associated with this studio (www.electricalaudio.com/phpBB3/) have been organising musical events for some years now where nice people can get together and hear brilliant bands, the sort of bands that live the punk ideal to the max and would rather die than sell out. These people are committed to quality and are all special in their own various ways. In another age they would be gods.

Chicago is not in the UK or even in Europe. Many of us cannot afford to go there and anyway there are bands more local to us that need to be heard. So what else to do other than organise an event of our own - the first of the PRF UK gigs.

"But what is this PRF thing?", i hear you cry. It is the Premier Rock Forum, a self-appointed moniker that is so accurate it makes scientific validation redundant. Some of us are scientists. Any argument will just make the protagonist seem foolish.

"Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.", says Indiegogo. Ok, i bloody will.

Helping to fund this event could change your life. It's just the first event of a giant rock-snowball that we hope to ride way into the future. Some will find marriage. Fluids and pet pics will be exchanged. No money will be made but pleasant music will be allowed to live. Your descendants may be so grateful they will cast you in bronze. That is how important this is. Creation Records once did an LP titled Doing It For The Kids aiming to boost sales. Well we are doing it for everyone and we will die in poverty smiling at the memories.

So we're asking for $600. That's not very much at all. The bulk of the funding is coming out of the organisers' bank accounts and we'll also sell a few tickets. This extra cash is really just to add security to proceedings (i.e. so we know 100% for certain we've covered all the costs) and we're hoping to end up with a small surplus which will be carried forward to next year's event. The more we get the better this and future events will be. See it as a leg-up not a make-or-break.

If we don't reach the target the event will still happen but we'll be slightly more nervous about buying off the Mafia, have to employ less dancing otters, and shelve next year's plans for doing it at Wembley Stadium for a while.

This thing is not about us. It's not about the bands either. It's about a vision we have of a world where music is made by regular people for regular people. If the majority of it just happens to be incredibly noisey and cannot be easily shoe-horned into genres then so much the better. I and my friends love and care about what enters our ears with a rare passion. Help us to help make the world a better place by letting a raggle-taggle bunch of freaks and deviants - many Welsh and Communist - enjoy themselves for one day.

Try and come along yourself. If you can't then tell people who you think might be interested. More details here https://www.facebook.com/events/263822440360523/ and here http://www.flyerbug.co.uk/flyer/63873/Bristol/29_September_2012/PRFstival_UK_2012 and here http://allevents.in/Bristol/PRFstival-UK-2012/263822440360523 and here http://prfstivaluk.com/

Thank you for your time.

Chin chin,

Rhod.

story:
Who is Tereya


    I was born and raised in St. Louis, Missouri where I grew up with my two brothers and two sisters whom I love very much.

      I moved to Chicago after High School to pursue a dancing at Columbia College.  At Columbia College I met my friend Maurice who introduced me to the lord. I’ve been on fire for God since then.  
 I began going to Life changers International Church with Pastor Gregory Dickow, who teaches the uncompromised word of God. I  changed from the inside out once I heard his words of wisdom.

   The more my relationship with god grew, I begin writing songs about what he’s done for me. I express myself through rapping, dancing and singing. It’s so much fun praising a good God who believes in me, values me, loves me and wants me. The lord gave me a vision to change the world with the good news of Jesus Christ through gospel music to touch people everywhere. I have to tell people how much God loves them, wants them, and is pleased with them when they choose to live for God it’s the best decision to make in the world.  


 I would like to leave you all with this scripture.  Psalm 70:4 Let all those that seek rejoice and be glad in thee and let such as love thy salvation say continually, let God be magnified.

I encourage you all to stay with the best which is Jesus and you will be alright. I love you all God bless!

                            -Sincerely, 

                                 Tereya Grace 

 

 

 

This campaign is vital to me because I will be not only following in god's light but I will be following my dreams. 

I want to take the time out to thank everyone that will contribute to everything that I will do in the near future. You are helping me reach my goals. 

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stapped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

 

What We Need & What You Get

-All of these funds will go into my album release party. I need money to rent a space and every dollar counts!

-All of your donations will not go unnoticed! For the first 20 people to donate $50 will receive my very first mixtape, second CD and a special thanks from me! 

-The first 10 people to donate $100 will get the best gift of all! They will receive two VIP tickets to my album release party, my fist mixtape, my second album and a personal thank you from me!

-Even the smaller donations will receive a mixtape and a special thanks from me. 

****If I do not reach my entire goal I will use the money for more studio time to record more insprational music. None of the donations will be unused.

story:
ATTENTION ROCKNROLL SUPPORTERS,

 

This just in: Julia Wild and the Healers just booked gigs at SXSW. SXSW is an awesomely huge and fantastic music festival going on right now in Austin, TX. We are headlining a venue Tuesday night at 9pm. In order to get there on time we have assembled ourselves, our gear, our merchandise and our car and dog to hit the road Sunday night at 10pm. We are going to drive through 5,000 miles of goodness to plug in and play at the biggest gathering of music lovers any of us have been apart of. We calculated our expenses and found that it will cost about $2,000 bucks for us to get there and back.

 

This is where we need your help! How this website has is all set up is that you donate X amount of dollars and in turn we send you something back! Here's the breakdown, it aint glamorous but neither are we, rockn-n-roll ladies and gentlemen.

 

5 bucks = picture text from us on the road

20 bucks = picture text, cd and a button

50 bucks = picture text, cd, button and a shirt

100 bucks = picture text, cd, button, shirt, and we'll buy you a drink in Austin.

 

We are a group of WILD psychedelic, blues rock-n-roll, gypsy livin, education lovin, good time havin, swinging low and singin in key kind a musicians.... WE ARE ROAD READY! Please help us and we will deliver the performance of our shared life times.

 

We are here to rock. Help us roll.

 

Love to you all and thank you,

Julia Wild and THE HEALERS

story:
I am writing to request $2,500.00 in sponsorship for costs associated with my participation in a performance taking place in Peterborough, Ontario. On the date of April 14, 2013, I will be opening for international award winning recording artists, Swollen Members. I’d like to make note that will this request, if you would like to employ me for future events, I would be more than happy to provide a discount for a couple events in the future.

 

My name is Adam Jack and I am from Makwa Sahgaiehcan First Nation. I’m 24 years old and a father of two. I have a daughter (Shenoa; Age 5) and a son (Valgan; Age 4). When I’m not home with my Children, I’m on the road performing, in the studio recording and rehearsing or doing other contract work in my field of work, to put food on the table. At one point I simply could not do this and was left to dead end jobs.

 

Since then, I can proudly say that my work as an Artist has provided me with the ability to support my children and myself. It was through hard work, perseverance and a “Will Do” rather than a “can do” attitude that got me to where I am; although this is only the start.

 

Because of this performance, I will be able to network and promote my music to booking agents, tour managers, and promoters and even label representatives. This is extremely difficult to do in Saskatchewan. As a striving Artist and Entertainment Professional, I must take every opportunity possible to market myself as an Artist to prominent industry people. I also have a responsibility as an Entertainment Professional to develop and exploit opportunities, and creating strong networks and contacts for those artists apart of BIGG Entertainment, on the BIGG Roster.

 

Through my experience, I have found that not only is an exemplary and professional sound require to present to the public and be recognized as a viable entertainment product and artist; Networking and contacts are among the primary driving forces that take careers to a much higher plateau.

 

Trip Expenses:

$      516.35 – Round Trip Greyhound Ticket to Peterborough Via Saskatoon

$      550.00 – 5 Night Stay in Peterborough (April 10th to 15th @ $110/Night)

$      480.00 – Meals (2 Meals per Day @ 6 Days – $80/Day)

$    1,000.00 – Album Print (Replication through CDWest)

$    2,546.35 - Total Sponsorship

 

I thank you very much for your time and consideration and I look forward to hearing from you.


Kinanaskomitin (Respectfully),

 

Adam Jack

BIGG Entertainment

www.biggentertainment.ca  | www.adamjack.ca

adam@biggentertainment.ca | info@adamjack.ca

(306) 480 - 5444

---

 

Dream BIGG. Dream Smart.

 

NOTE: With Donations of $20 Dollars, ask about Tickets to Swollen Members if you're in Peterborough, Ontario Area on April 14th; Only 50 Tickets available!!!
story_txt:
I am writing to request $2,500.00 in sponsorship for costs associated with my participation in a performance taking place in Peterborough, Ontario. On the date of April 14, 2013, I will be opening for international award winning recording artists, Swollen Members. I’d like to make note that will this request, if you would like to employ me for future events, I would be more than happy to provide a discount for a couple events in the future.
 
My name is Adam Jack and I am from Makwa Sahgaiehcan First Nation. I’m 24 years old and a father of two. I have a daughter (Shenoa; Age 5) and a son (Valgan; Age 4). When I’m not home with my Children, I’m on the road performing, in the studio recording and rehearsing or doing other contract work in my field of work, to put food on the table. At one point I simply could not do this and was left to dead end jobs.
 
Since then, I can proudly say that my work as an Artist has provided me with the ability to support my children and myself. It was through hard work, perseverance and a “Will Do” rather than a “can do” attitude that got me to where I am; although this is only the start.
 
Because of this performance, I will be able to network and promote my music to booking agents, tour managers, and promoters and even label representatives. This is extremely difficult to do in Saskatchewan. As a striving Artist and Entertainment Professional, I must take every opportunity possible to market myself as an Artist to prominent industry people. I also have a responsibility as an Entertainment Professional to develop and exploit opportunities, and creating strong networks and contacts for those artists apart of BIGG Entertainment, on the BIGG Roster.
 
Through my experience, I have found that not only is an exemplary and professional sound require to present to the public and be recognized as a viable entertainment product and artist; Networking and contacts are among the primary driving forces that take careers to a much higher plateau.

story:
Tre'Von Waters has entered a world of hope when it comes to the music scope of the things. "I've been inspired by a ton of people to push forward with a singing career and now, FINALLY, I am in a position to record my first EP and film a video of my second single "___________"! Will keep this a surprise. This brings me joy! The reason why I am reaching out is because I need your help. I will keep it short and simple. Your donation(s) will enable me cover the cost of studio time, musical production engineering, videography,, along with promotional tools i.e. flyers, a mini tour to spread myself beyond the local scene. I am trying to be as savvy as possible, therefore this EP will be available for digital download, however, I would like to have a possible 1500 cd's pressed up for A&R's, Radio Stations, Shows, Fans and DJ's. People have been asking me about an album for quite a while now, so I'm extremely excited to get to work on everything and get the final product to you.

 

If you have ANY questions about the progress, the album, or anything else message me on facebook and become apart of  team #init2win http://facebook.com/trevonsmusic

Keep track of the campaign and the album on myWebsite:http://trevonsmusic.com/

Check out campaign/recording footage on 

Youtube:http://www.youtube.com/user/trevonsmusic1

Join Me On Twitter for live conversation: https://twitter.com/treVonsMusic

I am well aware that this is not going to be an easy process. My goal is to simply live my dream. I am passionate and I believe that we can make this happen. 

 

School that I want to attend to enhance my music career http://www.juilliard.edu/

 

 

With your help I will continue to build up my own college tuition... 
 
 

All the funds raised will go directly into studio time, production expenses, and a mini tour. All other expenses will be covered out of pocket at the present time. Below is the estimated breakdown of those funds...

 

First off, it's worthy of note , I'm working with two top-notch producer/engineers on this album, both of whom are giving me phenomenal, "friendship" rates.  Still, studio work is meticulous and takes a tremendous amount of time, so I am really happy to pay these dear friends what they are worth! Both are magnificent within their own rights:  L. Sosa of Vytil Records (executive producer) - who happens to have a proven track record that provides him great credibility. In addition our new found friend John Terell (and if you've heard any of his work, you understand why he is so uniquely suited for recording, mixing, and mastering. At this time its a rare and notable opportunity and I'm thankful! 

Special Note: Would love to give you all nothing but the best for the best! Below are a few things that I am in need of assitance with. I would like to secure all the following so that I can give you all a classic & timeless album. 

  1. Studio time
  2. Engineering
  3. Videography  
  4. East Coast Tour
  5. CD Pressing

 

The reality of the matter is, the overall costs may come closer to $12,000 than $7550 all told - I have kept my minimum low in order to keep this campaign manageable. Any funds raised past the $7550 mark will be great! That said, I will keep working with whatever I am blessed with: first priority is recording and mixing.  If we run out of funds before getting to the tour phase, I will seek out another private investor or label assistance at that point.  I am hopeful to finish the album by the early portion of 2013, so know that this is my aim and I will do everything I can to achieve it.  

Thank You All In Advance Love You! 

 

 

The Boys & Girls Club

of the Northern Neck

 

 

 

10% of your gift will be used to support the youth in and

around the Northern Neck of Virginia.

story:
THE CLOSER NAME

We are an indie band from Lima, Peru. We are 3 people composing and writing the songs: Fernanda Acosta, Johann Frech and Nicolas Eddowes.

We are working on our debut album, untitled by now. Our songs are starting to being recorded, and it would take some time, everything is going great. Voice and instrument recording is covered, except drums recording. We have a producer, a mixing engineer, and a designer for cover arts. We need to pay them before any release, and also need to pay for 2 essencial things: mastering and publishing.

The idea of this project is to start recording our first 2 singles + our first music video: "Good morning" (Single) and "Street Lights" (Both single and video)

GOOD MORNING (DEMO)

STREET LIGHTS (INSTRUMENTAL DEMO)

 

WHAT WE NEED TO PAY FOR? 

DRUMS RECORDING

We will spend some hours recording drums: The estimated amount to use is US$100, it is necessary to make sure the drums are perfectly well recorded

MIXING

We are going to pay for both songs to be mixed the right way with our mixing engineer, but we also need to pay for it. This is going to be made here in our local city Lima. The idea is to spend about US$250 here.

MASTERING

The Professional Mastering Service from Universal Studios is in our sight, we want to have a powerful sound. As the plan is to release both singles we will spend US$150 to master them (US$75 for each one) 

Check the service here

PUBLISHING

To publish the singles worldwide, we have in mind using CD Baby, a service who provides everything for independent artists (let's say that Regina Spektor started her carreer on this website, you can check her first 2 releases here).

It will cost US$12.95 for publishing each song on CD Baby, for additional US$5, we get an UPC Barcode to release our songs worldwide on iTunes, Spotify, Amazon, among others. It means, we need US$35.90 only for publishing.

Check the pricing here

"STREET LIGHTS" MUSIC VIDEO

To pay the whole production to have a great quality video, a lot of things would be required: Production, Direction, Cameras, Actors, etc.

We are not sure who will be working with us for this production, but the average amount to spend here will be US$900

TOTAL AMOUNT OF MONEY

If we add the four total amounts of money, the required money would be US$1435.90. If we discount the fees we'll get $1395. Every little extra dollar obtained, is going to be for both the video and the album.

$1,500 - Fees = $1,395

 

PERKS

For people who helps with:

  • US$ 1 : Can choose between a free download of "Street Lights" or "Good Morning" the same day of the release (August-September)
  • US$ 2: Can get both singles the day of release of each one
  • US$ 5: Be part of the "special thanks" on the album
  • US$ 6: An exclusive listen to the album days before the release (2014)
  • US$ 10: Will be called to appear in "Street Lights" music video (This perk is ONLY for Lima, Peru Residents) [Up to 20 people]
  • US$ 15: A video with a personal greeting from the band [Up to 10 people]

 

You can like our Facebook page here

Every question will be answered

 

__________________________________________________________

EN ESPAÑOL:

 

THE CLOSER NAME

Somos una banda independiente de Lima, Peru. Somos 3 personas trabajando en las composiciones y letras: Fernanda Acosta, Johann Frech y Nicolas Eddowes.

Estamos trabajando en nuestro album debut, sin titulo por el momento. Nuestras canciones estan empezando a ser grabadas en un pequeño estudio, y nos va a tomar algun tiempo, todo está yendo bien. Las grabaciones de voz e instrumentos están cubiertas, salvo la parte de baterías. Tenemos una productora, un ingeniero de sonido que haría las mezclas, y una diseñadora para las portadas. Tenemos que pagar por sus servicios antes de cualquier lanzamiento, y además debemos pagar por 2 procesos esenciales: masterización y publicación.

La idea de este proyecto es empezar por grabar nuestro 2 primeros singles + nuestro primer video musical: Good Morning (single/sencillo) y Street Lights (single/sencillo + video)

 

¿QUÉ DEBEMOS PAGAR?

 

GRABACIÓN DE BATERÍAS

Tendremos que pasar algunas horas en el estudio grabando las pistas de batería: La cantidad estimada a gastar es de US$100 para asegurar que todo este perfectamente bien grabado

MEZCLAS

Pagaremos para que ambas canciones se mezclen como es debido con nuestro ingeniero musical. Esto nos saldra aproximadamente US$250.

MASTERIZACIÓN

l servicio de masterización profesional de Universal Studios está en nuestra mira, queremos un sonido potente. Como el plan es lanzar ambos singles usaremos US$150 para masterizarlas (US$75 por cada cancion) 

Revisa el servicio aquí

PUBLICACIÓN

Para poder publicar los sencillos a nivel mundial, tenemos en mente utilizar CD Baby, un servicio que brinda todo lo necesario a un artista independiente (digamos que Regina Spektor empezo su carrera en este sitio, puedes chequear sus 2 primeros lanzamientos aquí).

Va a costar US$12.95 por cancion, y por US$5 más conseguimos nuestro codigo de barras UPC, que nos permitira lanzarnos en iTunes, Spotify, Amazon, entre otros. Es decir, necesitaremos US$35.90 solo para publicar.

Revisa los precios de publicación aquí

VIDEO MUSICAL DE "STREET LIGHTS"

Para un videoclip se deben pagar por toda una producción para tener la calidad de video deseada, así como dirección, actores, etc

Aún no decidimos con quien trabajar, pero calculamos usar unos US$900 en el primer videoclip

CANTIDAD TOTAL DE DINERO

Si sumamos los 4 totales, llegamos a un requerimiento de US$1435.90. Si descontamos las tasas. Cada dolar adicional que recibamos irá al disco y al videoclip

 $1,500 - Fees = $1,395

 

RECOMPENSAS

Para la gente que contribuya con:

  • US$ 1 : Puede elegir descargar entre "Street Lights" o "Good Morning" el día de su lanzamiento (Agosto-Septiembre)
  • US$ 2 : Podrá tener ambos singles el día de su lanzamiento
  • US$ 5: Saldrá en los "agradecimientos especiales" del disco
  • US$ 6 : Escuchará exclusivamente el album dias antes de su lanzamiento (2014)
  • US$ 10 : Extra en el video de Street Lights [SOLO RESIDENTES DE LIMA, PERU]
  • US$ 15 : Saludo personal en un video colgado en nuestro canal de Youtube

 

Puedes poner like a nuestra página de Facebook aquí

Cualquier duda será respondida

story:
Hi, I'm Jonas Woods former lead singer for nationally released band Farewell June.  I currently tour as a solo artist coast to coast and overseas.  

I started recording a new album project 7 months ago with Paul Colman from the Paul Colman Trio and The Newsboys.  I spent roughly a week in Nashville writing with Paul what I was expecting to be a killer record.  

I was blindsided by my wife's diagnosis with stage 4 non Hodgkin’s lymphoma not long after our writing sessions.  It was a terrible and scary time for my entire family as you could imagine.  That put everything in our lives on hold.  I stopped the recording process and stopped working altogether and stayed home to watch my two boys Hunter (5) and Liam (18mo) while helping Becky get through her chemo sessions.  It was a long 7 months of dealing with all the different issues that came up due to the cancer.  So many prayers, so many messages of encouragement gave us such hope.  We're just barely out of the woods now.  She was given the diagnosis that she was 99% cancer free!  We're over the moon!  

I’m here asking for help because of the obvious lack of work during that down time.  I toured very little and not anywhere far from home.  I’ve made barely enough to pay the bills.  That is how I find myself here asking for help.

This record oddly enough has a song on it about a woman dying of cancer called "I'm not Falling Apart."  It was written before Becky's diagnosis!  Amazing stuff.  I recently got done with recording the band at the world famous Dark Horse Studios in TN with amazing musicians such as:  Ken Lewis from The Civil Wars, Bones Hillman from the band Midnight Oil, George Cocchini, and Jeff Roach!  So amazing!!!!  Of course I have my friend Paul Colman and Jeremy Michael producing and engineering everything.  

I'm so blessed to have these friends working along side me.

 

Helping me finish this record would send me back into the music industry full time.  It will go straight to radio and put me back into the mix.  This will help my family get back on our feet again.

 Thank you for your consideration!

 

This money will go to:

STUDIO TIME AT DARK HORSE 

PAYING PRODUCERS AND ENGINEER

PAYING STUDIO MUSICIANS

FLIGHTS TO NASHVILLE 

RENTAL CAR

DIGITAL EDITING THE RECORD

MIXING THE RECORD

MASTERING THE RECORD

WRITING SESSIONS

GEAR RENTAL FOR STUDIO

CD ART

PRINTING THE CD

RADIO AND TV PROMOTION

WEB DESIGN FOR NEW RECORD

story:
Video: LUCY'S ASHES 
Performed at Club Babylon Show
edited by: Amanda Rostykus

The Who and the What

Spirit Descending is a Melodic Metal band from Central California, USA. They are trying to help put together enough funding to get the band going for their second studio album.  Influenced by many acts such as: Drain STH, L7, In This Moment and so on, Spirit Descending hopes to bring their act out of the Central Valley and go global with their new project.  After producing their album with a private studio in 2010, they are in the works of polishing up new music for a brand new outcome this year.

The Facts

Our goal is $2000.

"There are five of us that make up this metal machine, but we live five very individual lives in five different cities doing our day-to-day thing.  Our passion lies within our music but because of "real life" getting in the way, we have postponed tours, shows, and recording." - Krys (vocals)  "We want to bring what we have to the table, and shine a light on this genre that has been overshadowed in this area."

There are many benefits for helping towards this project, each adding on an extra bit of flair as you climb the donation ladder, including future perks that will be shipped out once the project is funded and completed this year. T-Shirts, Stickers, CD's, Oh My!

Even if our goal is not met, the earned funding will be available for the band to add to their savings, in hopes to continue on with our musical conquests.  Not making our goal can't and won't stop us from doing what we love to do!

How you can make an Impact

Times have changed but living the life of a "Starving Artist" has remained the same.  A lot of musicians are still struggling to showcase their art, but it is a well-known fact that with the power of networking and support from the community, it can happen.  Our locale is not quite in touch with the type of music we are creating, and with a new album, we are hoping to expand our reach.  With your help, our band can fulfill our dream.  

Other ways to Help

Promote this campaign! Get the word out to everyone as far as this message can stretch. Every little bit helps, not just monetary support. 

Big thank you to those who have taken the time to review this campaign and also to those generous hearts who have contributed to this project.

Keep on rockin.

SPIRIT DESCENDING

story:
Halifax Rebel Girl Rock Camp is a new day camp for girls in Halifax who want to play music and start a band. With your support the camp will be able to run it's first session from August 19-23, 2013. Successful funding ensures that we can provide campers an opportunity to engage with local musicians, take part in empowerment and skill building workshops, learn an instrument, form a band and participate in a live showcase.

We need your support to ensure that camp fees stay low for participants. Your donation will also cover rehearsal space rentals, gear rentals, workshops materials and much more!

We are also looking for instrument and gear donations for the duration of camp, please email us if you can help out! rebelgirlhalifax[at]gmail.com

More more information and to register check out rebelgirhalifax.org

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
All Things Are Possible

This project is proof that with God, ALL things are possible.  Over three years ago, God gave me a dream to record a concert of original praise and worship songs and release it.  Sounds simple enough, doesn't it?

Well, if you don't already know, recording is NOT inexpensive.  Finding talented instrumentalists, singers, a venue, an engineer, lighting, cameras, microphones and all the other things needed is difficult, and can also be expensive.

I believe God orchestrated a series of events and relationships which allowed me to have wonderfully talented folks, including a Latin Grammy Award winning engineer, a wonderful group of skilled instrumentalists and singers, a venue, lights, cameras and recording gear to all be available at the right time.  The funds needed to secure the services of these superbly talented people were also provided in His timing for the recording to go on without a hitch!

Fast forward two and a half years.  The project is now 95 percent complete!  The mixing and mastering process is all that remains before we can replicate copies and have the project ready to release digitally.  Five songs have already been mixed!  My mix engineer, one of the worlds finest, is waiting to help me finish the project. 

The great thing is, the hardest work is behind us!  What lies ahead has already been planned.  The only remaining hurdle is a financial one, and with your help, we will make it over the top!

$6,750 is really the bare minimum it will take to complete the project.  Beyond that, there are marketing and promotion costs which will help spread the good news contained in the songs of this project.  Please help spread the word and accelerate the fruitfulness of this album through your giving, and by sharing the story with your friends.

There are some "perks" or as I like to call them, "thank you gifts" I would love to send you for your participation in making this dream come true!  Be sure to check them out!  You are not buying anything with your contribution, but I would love to give them to you as a reminder of my gratitude!

story:
One of my twin daughters is a natural Blue's singer.

Her sister is her biggest fan cheering for her at the end of the song.  

With some professional singing lessons she can be the next Tina Turner.

The title of this song is "No wannu wantoo, I don wannu"

 

 

If anyone out there know's Tina Turner maybe you can ask her to teach Lilly how to sing.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Tiffany Ireland. I have always had the passion to bring filmmaking and music together to create a cinematic experience. With As Artifacts, I want to show you the passion and I have for both film and music. Help me make my vision come to life.

"Bilbo Swaggins" will tell the story of betrayal. We will explore the dark side of relationships and human nature. 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to make to make the best music video we can. In order to do so, we need help raising money to pay for production costs. This includes equipment rental, camera rental, production design, food, crew, transportation, insurance, permits, marketing, distribution and so much more. 

Every dollar counts and we would really appreciate if you could help us make this happen. Every person that donates will get to see this idea come to life. Check out all of our awesome perks as well! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word!

We know that with your help we can make this happen. Please share our link on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, LinkedIn and blogs! Tell you friends, tell you family, and tell your cats too.

story:
Our Story

Off The Wall studios, formerly located in Franklin, TN, has relocated to downtown Nashville, the heart of Music City.  Along with the move comes some renovations that are necessary to look good, and more importantly, sound good.  


We pride ourselves in the high quality music we produce, and you are probably familiar with many of the projects we have worked on.  Collectively, we have worked with:  Kutless, Scott Stapp (Creed), Disciple, Pillar, Neal McCoy, Brian "Head" Welch, Building 429, FUZED, Stars Go Dim, Me In Motion, Seventh Day Slumber, Tamia, Megadeth, INXS, Bartek Krolik, Nine Lashes, and more.  


Oops, looks like we dropped a few names, we'll pick them up.


About Us

Off The Wall Recording Studio is: Lester Estelle Jr, Robert Venable, and Joshua Gleave.  


Lester Estelle Jr:  drummer (Neal McCoy, Pillar, Stars Go Dim, more.), producer, and engineer.  

Robert Venable:  producer/engineer/mixer (Kutless, Disciple, INXS, Megadeth, more.)

Joshua Gleave:  guitarist, bassist, producer, engineer, and keyboardist (Pillar, Stars Go Dim, Aaron Shust, more).


The Impact

The money we raise through this fundraiser will help us continue to produce the stellar music we are known for.  Without it, we won't be able to build the studio the way it needs to be built, and you, the listener, will be forced to listen to old Nickelback albums.  Nobody wants that.  


What We Need & What You Get

We have saved thousands of dollars for the renovations we need to make to the studio, but we are a little short.  We need $7500 to get us to our goal, every dollar helps.  


Here's where your money will go:  ripping down existing walls, building new walls, raising and building new ceilings, sound proofing, insulating, painting, new floors, and a new vocal booth and guitar room.


Here's what you get:  anything from your name on the wall at the studio, to having your songs produced by us, to meet&greets with celebrities.  Additionally, you get to say you helped us.  You will help us continue to make the music you listen to on the treadmill, while driving to school or work, or the music you practice your accordion to.  (Don't act like you don't).  Oh, and free high-fives anytime you see us around.


Don't worry, even if we don't make our goal, we will still get the money that was donated, the renovations will just take longer to finish while we continue to save the necessary money. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Well, unless you want to donate your time to helping use physically build the new walls, you can help by spreading the word.  Post the donate link on your Facebook, Twitter, Myspace, or personal pages.  Your help is important to us.

story:
My Story

The arts are in trouble in this country. The economy is bad, and so orchestras, ballets, arts programs, and opera houses, all run mainly by patron donations, are closing down all over the country. An already small pool of jobs for opera singers are diminishing, and in order to stand out in one of the most competitive industries in the arts, one has to get creative. 


During the summer, most American singers attend summer music festivals or training programs either in the United States or Europe. Some programs are highly educational and provide great opportunities to their students. Some, are not. All of them are expensive. A few years ago, I attended a summer festival in Belgium. Many false promises were made, and for the most part, I felt that my money had been wasted. The one positive gain from that experience was my work with Stephanie Friede, an American soprano who now has her life and career in Europe. My experience got me thinking about how to create my own "summer program" in Europe. 


Therefore this project was born. The main components of my program are

  1. Have voice lessons with Stephanie Friede to improve my singing technique
  2. Spend time in French, German, and Italian speaking countries in order to improve my language skills by means of language immersion. I plan to spend time in the rural areas of these countries where they are less likely to speak English.
  3. Attend as many operas and classical concerts as I can, in order to learn from the performances and observe the ways in which they differ from those here in the U.S.
  4. Meet, talk to, and interview European singers, especially American singers who have made their careers in Europe, in order to learn the advantages of pursuing a career across the pond.
  5. If possible, organize opera outreach programs in schools or rural areas.

The benefits of this program are huge, and I can accomplish more alone than I could in an organized summer festival with less money. I will save money by couchsurfing, traveling by train on a pre-paid train pass, buying "standing room" opera tickets, and strictly budgeting for food and additional travel costs. 


The Impact

The primary purpose for this project, is to craft a unique educational opportunity, however I truly believe that my project will make me a better artist, colleague, teacher, and human being. I will be able to come back and share what I have discovered about the arts in Europe, and embark upon new projects with the intention of raising the same awareness and value for the arts here at home. 

What We Need & What You Get


My goal is $2500, and truly, every dollar helps.

The breakdown of how the money will be spent is as follows:


$150: Plane Ticket Fees (the rest is paid for already)
â‚¬75 (approx. $100): each voice lesson (Hoping for at least 5 lessons) 
$600: Eurrail Train pass
$250: Additional travel costs (public transportation within cities, extra train fees, bike rentals)
$200: Emergency Lodging Cash (Money for hostels if I can't find a couchsurfing host)
$300: Concert Tickets
$1500 Estimated food costs for 3 months abroad

Most of these numbers are rough estimates, but as you can see, they total considerably more than $2500. I am setting my goal at this number, however, because it will cover most of my costs. If I raise more than my goal, 100% of the money will still go towards the project.

If I don't reach my goal, the project will still occur, but it will need to be cut short. I will return to the states earlier. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to support my excursion, or want to help out even more, the most important (and easiest) way to help is to help me get the word out! Post a link to my indiegogo page on your facebook, twitter, or blog. E-mail it to family and friends who are art/language lovers and might be interested in supporting. And (perhaps even easier) I graciously accept positive energy, prayers, meditations, and general well wishes.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Sage Reynolds. I lead an Independent Rock band (with Folk influences) from Montreal, Quebec, Canada, called Life in Winter.

I've been working very hard with my colaborators for the past 2 years to fund, produce, perform, and record our debut self-titled album, but unfortunately I have hit a financial wall very close to the end of the project.

The 9 song (~40 min) album is recorded and mixed (and I've almost completed the eco-pack jacket design), but I need to raise enough money for the last 2 phases of the process:

  • Mastering ($600)
  • Printing/Pressing of the CD ($1000)

I am hoping to raise these funds over the next 45 days through pre-sales of the CD in this Indiegogo campaigne. I want to released the CD on October 29, 2012... it's getting down to the wire! 

You can hear a 4 song preview of the album (pre-mastered mix) on our Bandcamp page (lifeinwinter.bandcamp.com) and on our Facebook page (www.facebook.com/LifeinWinter.) You can get more info at our Official Band Website (www.lifeinwinter.ca), as well as links to various forms of social media. I've put more info about the band and the album at the end of this message.


I am asking you to check-out our music and, if you like it, to tell your friends about it...  and, if you really like it, to make a pre-purchse of the CD! If you really, really like it, you could pre-purchase several of the CDs and give them to friends, family, lovers, neighbours, and/or strangers!!!

I will ship the CDs when they are finished being manufactured and depending on where you live, you will recieve your CD(s) as close to the release date (Oct. 29, 2012) as possible. If you live in Montreal I'll bring your CD(s) to a coffee shop of your choosing. If you live out of town I will mail you the CD(s)...  please include your mailing address an a few extra dollars for shipping.

This music means a lot too me. It was written from light and dark places within, in hot and cold places without. I think it deserves to be heard and given life by being played in your homes, at your places of work, at your places of leisure, on your road-trips, during your work-outs, at your cottages, or wherever you happen to be living life, during any of the four seasons!

Thanks for your time and interest. I appreciate it.

 

- Sage

 

 

More info...

Life in Winter is an independent rock band (with folk influences) from Montreal. The project was started in the winter of 2007 by bassist/singer Sage Reynolds as a vehicle for his songwriting.

Life in Winter have completed recording their debut self-titled album and will be releasing it this Fall.

Instrumentation

Sage Reynolds – Lead Vocals, Bass, Guitar, and Keys
Rich White – Guitar and Bass (and Harmony Vocals)
Liam Killen – Drums
The Cloud – a floating and protean group of excellent musicians who perform with Life in Winter on Guitars, Banjos, Keys, and with their voices.

Discography

Life in Winter’s self titled debut album will be out this October (2012.)

Recording Credits:

Recorded by Marcus Paquin on July 9, 10, 11, 2011
and Dec. 8, 9, 10, 2011 at Mixart Studios and on Feb. 20, 2012 at The Bridge. Mixed by Marcus Paquin on Mar. 3-11, 2012 at Mixart Studios. Montreal, QC. All songs written, composed, arranged, and produced by Sage Reynolds. Co-production by Marcus Paquin.

Sage Reynolds- lead vocals, harmony vocals, bass, acoustic guitar (1, 4), electric guitar (3), percussion, piano, hand-claps.
Rich White- electric guitar, bass (3).

Session Musicians:
Brad Barr- electric guitar, ac. guitar (2, 7, 9).
Andrew Barr- drums, percussion.
Laurel Sprengelmeyer- harmony vocals.
Marcus Paquin- harmony vocals, hand-claps.
Gab Lambert- banjo (2), electric guitar (5).

We also have 3 demo recordings to date. The first demo was recorded in May 2008 by Vid Cousins at Monkey Puzzle Sound Studio (www.monkeypuzzle.ca), the second demo was recorded in November 2008 by Stephen Lilly at McGill Studio A, and the third was recorded in November 2009 at McGill Studio A by Brian Losch & Chris Johns. We also did a recording session with George Massenburg (www.massenburg.com) at McGill Studio A, focusing on the song Betty & Joyce (mixed by Stephen Lilly.)

If you really, really like it, you could pre-purchase several of the CDs and give them to friends, family, lovers, neighbours, and/or strangers!!!I will ship the CDs when they are finished being manufactured and depending on where you live, you will recieve your CD(s) as close to the release date (Oct. 29, 2012) as possible. If you live in Montreal I'll bring your CD(s) to a coffee shop of your choosing. If you live out of town I will mail you the CD(s)...  please include your mailing address an a few extra dollars for shipping.
This music means a lot too me. It was written from light and dark places within, in hot and cold places without. I think it deserves to be heard and given life by being played in your homes, at your places of work, at your places of leisure, on your road-trips, during your work-outs, at your cottages, or wherever you happen to be living life, during any of the four seasons!Thanks for your time and interest. I appreciate it.
 
- Sage
 
 
More info...



Life in Winter is an independent rock band (with folk influences) from Montreal. The project was started in the winter of 2007 by bassist/singer Sage Reynolds as a vehicle for his songwriting.
Life in Winter have completed recording their debut self-titled album and will be releasing it this Fall.
Instrumentation
Sage Reynolds – Lead Vocals, Bass, Guitar, and KeysRich White – Guitar and Bass (and Harmony Vocals)Liam Killen – DrumsThe Cloud – a floating and protean group of excellent musicians who perform with Life in Winter on Guitars, Banjos, Keys, and with their voices.
Discography
Life in Winter’s self titled debut album will be out this October (2012.)
Recording Credits:
Recorded by Marcus Paquin on July 9, 10, 11, 2011and Dec. 8, 9, 10, 2011 at Mixart Studios and on Feb. 20, 2012 at The Bridge. Mixed by Marcus Paquin on Mar. 3-11, 2012 at Mixart Studios. Montreal, QC. All songs written, composed, arranged, and produced by Sage Reynolds. Co-production by Marcus Paquin.
Sage Reynolds- lead vocals, harmony vocals, bass, acoustic guitar (1, 4), electric guitar (3), percussion, piano, hand-claps.Rich White- electric guitar, bass (3).
Session Musicians:Brad Barr- electric guitar, ac. guitar (2, 7, 9).Andrew Barr- drums, percussion.Laurel Sprengelmeyer- harmony vocals.Marcus Paquin- harmony vocals, hand-claps.Gab Lambert- banjo (2), electric guitar (5).
We also have 3 demo recordings to date. The first demo was recorded in May 2008 by Vid Cousins at Monkey Puzzle Sound Studio (www.monkeypuzzle.ca), the second demo was recorded in November 2008 by Stephen Lilly at McGill Studio A, and the third was recorded in November 2009 at McGill Studio A by Brian Losch & Chris Johns. We also did a recording session with George Massenburg (www.massenburg.com) at McGill Studio A, focusing on the song Betty & Joyce (mixed by Stephen Lilly.)

story:
The Story:

We (Dylan and Kristina) met almost two years ago and became fast friends. We began playing some shows together, then playing some songs together, then recording half Kristina's EP in Dyl's parents' house. When we started talking about a potential tour in the summer, it seemed like a lofty dream. But we thought we've gotten this far, why not take it to the next level and commit. So now we're doing it, and we're lucky enough to be joined by some of our closest friends on a tour through the midwest and around the west coast to explore new cities, spread our music, and revisit homes of our past. 

 The Goal:

Now we need your help. We crunched the numbers and tried for a goal we thought would be the most appropriate to ask, as well as enough to get us to where we need to be. Our tour will be incredibly expensive, especially with two cars so we can fit the millions of instruments Where Are All the Buffalo requires at every show. We're risking a lot going to cities we've never been before without any guarantee as to how much we'll walk away with per show and where we'll be sleeping that night. We know it will be long, exhausting, and sorta scary. But in the end, this is our dream. We've never wanted anything more than to tour the country and play music. We're asking for a little help from family, friends and caring strangers to help us fulfill this dream. 

 Perks and stuff!

The coolest part about donating is you get some cool perks yourself! We spent a night brainstorming really neat stuff, from unreleased songs to private shows to home-cooked meals! It means so much to us that you would take the time to help us out, so we want to give back to you. If we can make this goal and go on tour, we'd be accomplishing so much. We would be able to share our music with about 17 cities across the country as well as gain exposure. But most importantly, we would be living out an aspiration we've had since we were kids. Who doesn't want to be able to do that?

 

Thanks so much for your time. We love you and you're awesome. We could never thank you enough.

 

Kristina Moore and Dylan Pratt + Dominic Armstrong, Janna McCluskey, Chris Cosmas

story:
I am auditioning in St. Louis for The Voice on 7/21/13. I'll sing songs they haven't heard and wow them! I think I have an advantage in that I'm not 12 years old and I know the meaning of singing on key. I am not letting age or disability stop me from following my dream anymore!!!

I need help with the basics - gas, a car rental, and a motel room with a little food thrown in. That's it. Nothing fancy. I'll drive out and stay with friends for two days, and stay at a motel for one. I'll sleep, get up, drink some hot apple juice (it always works) and go sing. Then, I'll drive home and go back to work. And wait for word.

I'm singing:

  1. "Ill Wind" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f9nOjTbdPKQ) and
  2. "Dimming of the Day" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s6kjCd7QRbw) as my a capella pieces, and
  3. "God Give Me Strength" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ese5A8Y-Sdg), 
  4. "So Far Away" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8UM249-WfP4) and
  5. "Landslide" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=syCbmRizzZ4) or
  6. "Coming Home" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DzGxnRz_Ldg) accompanied. But I can't decide until the pianist and I hang out!

I am preparing my 2 a capella and 3 accompanied songs for the July 21st audition.

I have been performing since age 4 and singing since then too. I am now disabled and have NO money for extras like this, but I believe that if I can just be heard at the audition, I can make a career for myself, however modest, in music AND take care of my health. I would be so happy if I could get back-up work in Nashville!!! How great would that be - doing what you love for a pay check. Wow!!

story:
The art we create is not only a reflection of God, but a response to the overwhelming beauty of Jesus and His grace towards us. We can't help but create as image bearers of Christ, who is the ultimate Creator. The church has a responsibility to create good art and pour into culture, not just imitate what is already there or throw together something just to have it. Our aim is not a sub-culture, but to pour art that speaks of Jesus into an existing one. 

We Need Your Help!

The Paradox Church is still a young and growing church, so there are often more practical uses of the church's money than making a record, a film, or even hosting a concert or art & film showing. This does not mean that the arts are not important or necessary for the church to do or take part in. They are an integral part of us loving and serving our city, but often set aside or forgotten. We want to make great art and don't have the budget, so we are getting creative! We have industry professionals who are donating their time and services to make this a great record. We want to honor their efforts as well as begin to invest in our future impact in culture, but we need your help!

Here some of the ways your donation will help:

  • Studio Time
  • Production 
  • Mixing 
  • Mastering  
  • Packaging and Distribution
  • Digital Distribution
  • Radio Servicing
  • Design Work
  • Videos
  • Venue Rentals for Event Hosting
  • Gear and Accessories
  • Website
  • Marketing and Promotional Items

       *This list is not exhaustive

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute monetarily , but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram using #thegloryarchives @PdxMusicandArts 

Tell people about the record and any events

Pray for creativity and the art we create to be used by God for His glory

This is super exciting for us and we can't wait to see what we can all do together to pour into our culture through Paradox Music and Arts.

story:
SCROLL ALL THE WAY DOWN to see all the perks! They are really awesome and took us a long time to think up! Don't miss out on them! 

 

 

We will be on tour August 2nd - 11th in the following cities: 

Friday, August 2nd - Cypress, TX 

Saturday, August 3rd - Dallas/Forth Worth, TX

Sunday, August 4th - Norman, OK

Monday, August 5th - Springfield, MO 

Tuesday, August 6th - St Louis, MO

Wednesday, August 7th - Cincinnati, OH

Thursday, August 8th - Nashville, TN 

Friday, August 9th - Tupelo, MS  

Saturday, August 10th - Fort Worth, TX 

Sunday, August 11th - Beaumont, TX 

Venues will be posted soon :) 

 

So...here we are. 

Not as a band, but as three men (well...basically.) looking to our fans, not for a plea or begging, but for honest help. We need to be able to go on tour. We also really need to prepare for recording our next album. Finally, we REALLY want to release our sophomore EP, "Faith, Fear, and Hope" early. And physically, at that. 

Being in a band isn't as glamorous as MTV and YouTube makes it out to be. (Are bands even on MTV anymore?) 

It costs a LOT of money to deliver the music we want to deliver to our fans. We have spent, and I literally tallied this, ~$21,000 out of our own pockets to fund the band from 2010 until this day, in the year 2013. That is a lot of money for broke musicians. We have pulled a lot of sacrifices to make this band reach incredibly far heights, places we never dreamed of reaching. We have played on the Vans Warped Tour. Twice. We are very close to being able to play for a third time! This is something we dreamed about as 14 year olds writing music and singing together. We never thought we'd have the chance. 

We've booked our own tours. Filmed our own music videos (to great fan response, might I add. (Our last video got 21,000 views in, like, THREE days!!) We have played music with some of our idols, and gotten to share a song with one of the best vocalists out there today. AJ, we're looking at you my friend! 

I could continue, but you understand by now. This is a dream that has been realized in a way that just wasn't fathomable to us. Ever. Even now, we thank everyone daily, via texting, Twitter, Facebook, or whatever else, for the incredible opportunity it is to play in this band for all of our fans. But now, we are coming to you with the need for help. We don't want to ask you to fund our tour and our next recording project for nothing, so we are including awesome perks for every backer. From $1 to $3000, you'll be getting something we have put a lot of thought into. 


We are feverishly and viciously taking the next step to making Dear You the next big thing. We love the amount of fans we have now, but we want to be on your TV, your iPods, your computer screens, and on that weird billboard the city installed thats really big and fancy. Basically, we need to grow bigger. 

We really need your help here. If you can find the time to throw anything down for this band, you will be greatly rewarded. Drop your cell number in when you pay for your perk, we will send you a text message and personally thank you. This is really THAT important. Thank you so much for reading this, you are all beautiful. Just by taking a look, you've already helped.

Love always,

Chris, Mason, and Louis

story:
**~~**The album is now only $1!**~~**


I can't do this alone! I need your help! You are all instrumental (pun intended) to this project.


Short Summary

Hey everyone my name is Scott Johnson! I'm an indie rock musician in Boston who's going to record an album this spring. It'll all be done on tape using an old reel-to-reel recorder just like they used to! I started writing songs a few years ago and have been enthralled by it ever since. There's something very honest about a melody to me - something words alone can't always capture.
Though $4,000 seems like a lot, it'll help get all of the major costs out of the way. It will:
  • Pay musicians
  • Pay the engineer
  • Get CDs, Posters, and T-Shirts
  • Get The tape to record on
  • And a lot more!
Some of the costs will be dependent on a lot of factors such as how much mixing and mastering has to be done by the engineer to each song or how many musicians I have to find and how many tracks they'll play on etc.


What YOU Get!

Like I said, the $4,000 will help cover the costs of recording. Even if you can only donate $1 it's still very much appreciated!
So as you can see on the right side of this page, you get perks for how much you donate!

Like for $5 you'll get a digital download. For $50 you'll get an autographed CD, autographed poster, t-shirt, and a hand-knit hat. For $150 you get a Skype session. And so on!


Other Ways You Can Help!

I understand how tight money can be these days, especially around the holiday season, so even if you can't contribute $1 there's still a lot you can help with very easily! You can:
  • Post/share it on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Vine, or any other social media you might be on (Indiegogo has a super handy, "share," button)!
  • Text/message your friends about it!


To hear some of the music I wrote in the past click this link: http://theaglets.bandcamp.com/

However, this next album I'm wanting to be more honest and earnest in it's writing.

story:
IIIATIYA

SINGER/SONGWRITER/DANCER

IIIATIYA is an international artist who goes beyond the box; she is not only a phenomenal singer and dancer, but she Wows us with her unique edgy, rocker vintage, flirty, classy fashion sense. Alternative soul best describes the musical style of this artist who aims to inspire the world, changing one life at a time, through music with a message that can touch people from all parts of the world. 

Join us on this journey to creating IIIATIYA's first music video for her song "Light the Fire"; which poses the questions 'what is your purpose, dreams, aspirations?' 'And are you moving forward on your journey fearlessly?'" This song ignites the fire within you to claim and take your destiny! With this music video, people from all over the world will be able to experience the fullness of what this music and song is all about, and be Inspired. With your help, we can accomplish this mission.

"My mission is to ignite a flame of change in all who listen to my music and see me dance..to inspire all to follow there dreams with perseverance and purpose...and to bring healing, joy, and laughter that will transform generations to follow!" ~IIIATIYA

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $3,000 in 49 days 
  • Your generous donations will enable us to create a music video that will inspire the world to ignite the light inside of them! The donations will specifically fund: videographer, crew, choreographer, wardrobe stylist, make-up artist, dancers, and actors.
  • We have come up with some great perks in return for your donations! Check them out and spread the word.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers via social media, email, word of mouth, etc! Thank you!!!
  • Check out IIIATIYA's new single "Light The Fire " on SoundCloud: http://m.soundcloud.com/iiiatiya

story:
CLASSIC. OPERA. HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO CONQUER THE GAME?

 

"You are born an artist or you are not. And you stay an artist, dear, even if your voice is less of a fireworks. The artist is always there."

                                                                                                          -Maria Callas
story_txt: CLASSIC. OPERA. HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO CONQUER THE GAME? "You are born an artist or you are not. And you stay an artist, dear, even if your voice is less of a fireworks. The artist is always there."                                                                                                          -Maria Callas

story:
UPDATE

Thank you all so much for your support! There is just a week to go and we're looking forward to getting even closer to our goal. We are determined to get this EP made, and are as excited to as ever to share it with you!

Also, we are going on a 2 week tour at the end of October to help promote and fund the rest of this EP ( < awesome!). Unfortunately, this will push back some of the perks into November. Those who are expecting to get the EP early will still get it before the release date. We apologize, but promise it will be worth it! 

Continue to share this with everybody! Send some personal messages, tweet it, tell your grandma it's a link to cat videos, anything and everything you can think of! (make sure to include a link!)

Much love, and so happy for all of you to be on this adventure with us every step of the way. Let's do this!


What Are We Doing!?

We (Jake, Steven, Matthew, Andrew) have been playing music together for 9 years. This is our first official release as a band, and we want it to sound AMAZING.

What Do We Need!? & What Do You Get!?

We need $5200 for mixing, mastering and printing physical CD's. Here is the cost breakdown:

Mixing - $500/song x5 = $2500
Mastering - $125/song x5 = $625
Printing CD's - $4/CD x300 = $1200
Leeway/Indiegogo fee's - $875

We also have some AWESOME perks that you should GO CHECK OUT NOW. They range from an early EP download, to a 60 second personalized song in the genre of your choice, to a full blown show in your living room! We will do everything we can to ship, send links, perform, etc. AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

If we do not reach our goal, any funds raised will still go towards getting this project into all of your ears!!

What's The Point!?

Rikavista is not just a band. We want our music to make MANY differences in this world. We have partnered with multiple non-profit organizations, including Wounded Warrior Project, Blue Santa, and Stand For Freedom. Right now we are starting a social movement called Bands Serving Bands. It's dedicated to encouraging artists to support other artists in their creative community, instead of treating each other as competition, or a threat. We all love our art, and should have the same respect for others that want to pursue this adventure.

How Else Can You Help!?

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE. Use the indiegogo share tools to get the word out about our campaign. Tell your friends and family, your dogs and cats, and any other inanimate objects in your surrounding area!
story_txt:
UPDATE
Thank you all so much for your support! There is just a week to go and we're looking forward to getting even closer to our goal. We are determined to get this EP made, and are as excited to as ever to share it with you!
Also, we are going on a 2 week tour at the end of October to help promote and fund the rest of this EP ( < awesome!). Unfortunately, this will push back some of the perks into November. Those who are expecting to get the EP early will still get it before the release date. We apologize, but promise it will be worth it! 
Continue to share this with everybody! Send some personal messages, tweet it, tell your grandma it's a link to cat videos, anything and everything you can think of! (make sure to include a link!)
Much love, and so happy for all of you to be on this adventure with us every step of the way. Let's do this!

story:
Someday Girl's Story

Thank you for taking the time to consider Someday Girl as one of your music contributions. We are a songwriting duo headed by myself, songwriter and vocalist Amanda Abizaid and songwriter and musician Lindsay Gillis. I partnered with Lindsay to form Someday Girl earlier this year in order to reach my goal of becoming self sufficient in this expensive and changing music industry. Magically, Lindsay and I have a musical chemistry that has come together so naturally that within the first couple of months writing together, we scored an end theme song to a British film now in Pre-production. We hope this will give us a leg up with our initial exposure when we begin to shop our new CD around in January 2014. Further information on the present score is on IMDB: Welcome To Purgatory http://pro.imdb.com/title/tt1643249/ Now our goal is to distribute music to fans and clients through our website, which is currently under construction, and begin long term relationships with music supervisors and publishers around the world. With this exposure we hope to accomplish our mission to inspire youth around the world to be empowered and believe in their dreams. To go for what's really in their hearts no matter how difficult it may seem.

Personal Fan Experience

I've had a lot success reaching and building my fan base through several TV/Film placements in the past 10 years. I've been able to inspire a lot of people around the world in a positive way. One experience I want to share with you that really captured my heart was an email that I received from a fan. She stated that she was contemplating suicide. This really concerned me. She reached out to me again and said that she had changed her mind when she heard the song I sang, "Dreams In Ashes". This made me realize how important my message through my voice and songs is to others. I wrote her back with encouraging words and was so glad to hear that she was moving forward with hope and strength in her life. 

What We Do, What We Need & What You Get

Because the cost of touring is high, our goal is to stay engaged with our fans through social media sites and gain exposure through future licensing and placement opportunities. This way we can continue to reach our audience on a global level. Through your contribution we can get our music to the industry putting our best foot forward and compete on a professional level. We will perform live Nationally and Internationally through an online concert source called Stageit.com and through live performances locally in Los Angeles where we currently reside. 

Our first online show is November 14th 7pm PST http://www.stageit.com/amanda_abizaid_and_lindsay_gillis/introducing_someday_girl/29336  

Los Angeles Show, MBar -  Hollywood December 12th 7pm PST http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/496977  

We've already paid for a little studio time and a drummer that we've hired to play on the tracks. We are borrowing a studio that we can continue to use at very low cost. We have already received a contribution for our mixing costs which was greatly appreciated. 

We need the mastering, CD duplication and initial building of our website cost. As a contributor you will receive your company and/or name on our website as an Angel and on the CD's if they are made. You will also receive signed complimentary CD's for you and your friends depending on the amount you contribute. We will also announce your name in the middle of our show at MBar - Hollywood, thanking you publicly for your contribution. With your help we can achieve our goal. 

Vol 1 Someday Girl consists of 18 tracks in total 

9 tracks complete with vocals and music and 9 instrumental tracks

The mastering cost per track is  $100 x 9 tracks = $900

The mastering cost per instrumental track is $25 x 9 tracks = $225

Making a total Mastering cost of $1125

CD duplication cost of 100 CD's. The rest will be a digital download on the website for fans and industry. 

CD duplication is $200

Initial Cost of building our website $700

If we don't reach our entire goal, the money we receive will go first to the mastering and then website development. It will only be a digital release if we don't get the funds for the CD's to be duplicated. As far as our website, we will build it as soon as we can but that won't stop us from having the songs available to fans and hitting the pavement in January for prospective clients.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you don't have the financial ability to contribute, we appreciate any exposure opportunities you can send our way online through social networking or through a video we might be able to do for you if requested. We can exchange exposure to help each other. Spread the word of our new ventures as a co-sponsor. 
  • Indiegogo has share tools that can help us do this!

story:
Hip hop is dull nowadays. Whatever happened to the origin of hip hop? The days when you actually anticipated watching your favorite rapper's video?  When it was all about fun? Expressing yourself and enjoying friends? Well I am here to bring all that back into a clearer focus. I know many of you have seen the movie Project X and for those who haven't go do it now. It's about the party of a lifetime. I decided that that would be the best theme for my next video:the party of a life time. From the extras to the audience in front of their computer screen i want everyone to have a sense of euphoria after the video is over. The title of the song is "No Time For Relaxin"" and it's definitely no time for that while swimming in a kiddy pool full of jello or doing shots of a Ron Jeremy look alike. 

The breakdown of the $1100 is $600 will be paid to the videographer/producer for his services. $200 will be spent to rent out the warehouse, which will be the venue for the shoot. $150 will be spent to hire a dj for the event/shoot.The remaining $150 will be used to purchase props, such as a kiddie pool, lots of jello, glow sticks for the partygoers, body paint, etc. Currently, I am working on a new project and have completely devoted my time and energy to my talent as a hip hop artist so every donation is greatly appreciated to make my dream become a visual explosion for myself and my fan. For those of you who can not make a donation, keep the positive energy going and spread the word. Let's bring art back to music. I'll love you forever plus infinity.

story:
Short Summary

An unfortunate amount of our time recently has been going in to writing and preparing to record a new 10 song album by Travis James & the Acrimonious Assembly of Arsonists. I've always managed to pull off some way of managing to record, put on shows, make patches and shirts, and other similar garbage without much request for funding... so, this time, after some deliberation, we have decided to just come out and ask for help.

Any contributions will be incredibly helpful. With enough luck to be gifted the bare minimum being aimed for, we will be able to record and release CDs of a new 10 song album. Watch the video for more information of what you'll be contributing to.

What We Need & What You Get

Recording, CD sleeves, and album inserts will be entirely covered by what we're asking for. I sincerely promise that every cent will go towards making the album possible. We'll be recording with the amazing Matt Braman, who did the "Let's Debt Free" e.p., which is still up for free on bandcamp.

If you contribute, I have copies of my first album, 2nd album, plugged-in E.P., and some patches to throw your way... however, everything I've recorded thus far is already available for free download, so keep that in mind either way when considering your donation!

Sellout?!?!?

We've never really asked for much, let alone this much, and never in this format. I have no idea what to expect, and hope for the best... which, in this case, is already essentially the bare minimum.

Other Ways You Can Help

Post this fundraiser and the video wherever you can to help out!!!!!

story:
What We're Doing:

To celebrate the release of SIGNED Magazine’s third issue, we’re doing our part to amplify Bellingham’s all-ages arts community by organizing a non-profit music festival the weekend of April 25-27. Over the course of seven shows, an eclectic blend of local and regional artists from the Pacific Northwest will play Make.Shift, The Alternative Library, and two local living rooms.

How We Came To Be:

Helmed by three Western Washington University students, SIGNED is a small, independent publication headquartered in the nook of a Bellingham apartment. SIGNED offers informative, interview-driven content about the music industry and features bands including Wild Throne, Rose Windows, Built to Spill, Death Cab for Cutie, Mudhoney, and many more.

SIGNED Magazine debuted at Yellingham in 2013.



The Impact:

With a focus on showcasing regional record labels, SIGNED Fest puts a unique spin on musical perspective in the Northwest while still drawing from Yellingham's all-ages atmosphere and intimate house show tradition. No jerks, drugs, or booze allowed. As several of our organizers volunteered with Yellingham, we understand what it takes to make an event like this successful.  

Central to SIGNED Fest’s mission is to inspire attendees to pursue their own artistic projects and foster future collaborative relationships. In our transitory college town, it’s important to provide each new generation with the tools to enliven the music community. Bellingham is a destination—not a town to bypass—and we need to keep it that way.

What We Need:

Sixty percent of the money fund-raised is funneled into paying the cost of gas for performing artists, and approximately thirty percent is reserved to rent out Make.Shift. All other donations are used to create screen-printed lineup posters, t-shirts, and hand-made buttons. If we exceed our goal, artists and fans should know that the extra money benefits them and not SIGNED.

NOTE: In exchange for their services, Indiegogo keeps four percent and third party payment processors tack on an additional three percent. This means that when our campaign ends we'll have $897.

Risks & Challenges:

SIGNED is unique among music festivals in the Northwest because it's organized by a handful of full-time college students. We don’t have large or corporate sponsors so we depend upon every dollar raised to secure safe all-ages spaces; to fairly compensate artists; and to guarantee a great weekend. While we'll emphasize donations at every show, it’s difficult to predict door revenue weeks in advance.

As it stands, you can see our lineup below - feel free to ask us any related questions, or simply message us to say hello : ). Thanks for reading, and we look forward to seeing you at the end of April!

With love,

The SIGNED Staff


SIGNED Fest:

Friday night: Make.Shift
-------Mixed------- 
Special Explosion
Gonzo
Leatherdaddy
Tummy
Heavy Petting

Saturday afternoon: Alt. Library 
-------K Records + Beating A Dead Horse------- 
Generifus
Posse

Saturday evening: House
-------Help Yourself Records------- 
Dude York
Wimps
Chastity Belt

Saturday night: Make.Shift
-------Hardly Art Records------- 
Grave Babies 
Unnatural Helpers 
Broken Water

Sunday afternoon: House 
-------Oligopolist Records------- 
Studenets
Big Sigh
Taylor M.

Sunday evening: Alt. Library 
-------Barsuk Records + Sub Pop------- 
Laura Gibson
The Rose and The Window [ft. Chris & Rabia of Rose Windows]

Sunday night: Make.Shift
-------Mixed------- 
The Hague
Grizzled Mighty
Chunky Wonder
Iska Dhaaf
Noise Toys

story:
Creating an Arts Festival

  • Are you passionate about Deep Ellum and Dallas? What about music, film, art, beer, food, theater or comedy? We're passionate about all of those things and have spent the last five years planning an event that celebrates all of it, but we need your help! Deep Ellum Block Party is an indoor and outdoor walkable arts and culture festival taking place on April 17-19, 2015. There will be over 1,000 bands, visual artists, film makers, brewers, actors, dancers, comedians, authors, food vendors and more. There will be over 300 bands on more than 20 stages. All outdoor activities are free to the public, including: Brewtopia Beer Garden, The Marketplace, Kids Town, Grub Hub and a lot more! A paid wristband gives you access to all outdoor and indoor venues and showcasing artists.
  • Who we are: A group of creatives and small business owners from the worlds of music, film, art, theater, comedy and other areas. Our founder has been working in the music industry for 14 years, booked and promoted over 100 shows in Dallas last year, and was nominated for "Best Talent Buyer" by Dallas Observer.
  • Who we are not: We're not a large corporate booking or ticketing entity. We're just regular people with a big idea. We don't have millions of dollars for something like this, so we want to partner with you to make it happen. 

The Impact of Your Donation

  • Research tells us that the economic impact for this first year on Deep Ellum and Dallas will be over $5 million. You're helping us build something that will become a staple event locally and even nationally.

    What We Need & What You Get

    • We need at least $50,000.
    • Most of the money will go toward putting down a deposit for our biggest headlining band. We need the money for the deposit to secure the band. Once we do this, we can sign a contract, announce the band (and other bands booked) and start selling tickets. This is the biggest hurdle we have!
    • Where else will your money go? Some of your donation will go toward other initial expenses: Logos, website design, video production, marketing and fulfillment of your rewards (like merch costs, for instance).
    • You'll receive some really cool rewards in exchange for your kindness. Here are a few visuals for some of the merch rewards:

      One of the buttons in the pack:

      An inverted color sticker:

      Limited edition t-shirt:


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We realize that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some ways:

    • Keep up with festival happenings by liking us on Facebook, following us on Twitter and signing up for our online newsletter (through our website).
    • Spread the word about the festival and this fundraiser too. Share our pages and links on your own social networks.
    • Sponsorships are key for us, so if you know of a business you think may be interested, please have them get in touch by emailing us at sponsor@deepellumblockparty.com.

    Risks & Challenges

    We value transparency, so please know that we will do our very best to meet your expectations and to fulfill your rewards quickly. Please realize that a lot of rewards will take a little time to ship out. For instance, if you order a shirt, we'll actually have to order those and wait for them to print and ship to us. Then we can ship them to you. This takes a little time, but we'll try to make it as easy for you as possible. Thanks for your patience and understanding!

Risks & Challenges  We value transparency, so please 
know that we will do our very best to meet your expectations and to 
fulfill your rewards quickly. Please realize that a lot of rewards will 
take a little time to ship out. For instance, if you order a shirt, 
we'll actually have to order those and wait for them to print and ship 
to us. Then we can ship them to you. This takes a little time, but we'll
 try to make it as easy for you as possible. Thanks for your patience 
and understanding!

story:
Hello there!

We have recorded, mixed and mastered a mini album called ‘Names And Pictures’ – we are needing your help in the next stage.

By funding our project we will be able to get the album out in the shops, we are needing £1,500 to pay for album production and a photo shoot.

You will get the chance to have a signed copy of the album and we will send you a digital copy as soon as you have funded the album, so you will be first to hear it!

Also have a look at the exclusive packages you can fund. Includes a bonus package of an unreleased song, plus the full back catalogue in one beautiful bundle.

I hope you can help us out

Warm wishes – Sophie’s Pigeons
