story:
Thanks so much for your contribution!!! We were able to make our goal to raise $5,000!!!! Thank you very very much!!!

 

*We would like to share our sympathy with the victims of the tragic Connecticut Elementary School shooting by donating a percentage of our campaign proceeds!

 

*** Last Minute Deals! ***

*A Song About You             $1,000->$500->$350
*It’s An Open Invitation    $2,000->$1,000->$500
*Entourage Package          $4,000->$2,000->$1000

 

 

ABOUT SOULFUL OBSESSION'S IndieGOGO CAMPAIGN

This fundraising campaign is vital to the completion of our 5-song EP product, which we will be releasing in late January or early February to the public, online, and on iTunes. Your contributions will help us significantly in finishing the recording and mixing process of the music and bringing to the life an extravagant release event that signifies the official launch of our exclusive music to the masses. From there, we will embark on a tour to promote the EP and aim to gain more exposure and increase our fanbase beyond the Bay Area of California. Your contributions will greatly help us achieve and execute this plan of our sharing our creativity that we have worked at and perfected for months on end.

 

OUR IndieGoGo TARGET GOAL


Soulful Obsession's target financial goal is $5,000. The funds raised will help us finance our studio hours, where we will put the final touches on instrumental and vocal recording, mixing, and mastering. Once that is completed, we will be mass producing the EP and paying for its mass distribution to make it available online and in hard copy form. We have also scheduled a huge EP release event in which we will perform live and feature top performers from both San Jose and Los Angeles. Depending on how much you contribute, you could receive a digital download of the EP, a signed copy of the EP, tickets or VIP passes to the EP release party, a chance to spend a day with us in the recording studio, opportunities for your name to appear on our EP thanking you or making a cameo in a video of ours, private house concerts, and even the chance to have a song written and performed about YOU! With your assistance, we know we can bring to you a thrilling product of
music and a release party that you will not soon forget!


HOW YOU CAN HELP US


As a performing band, we have appeared at numerous festivals, in online shows and YouTube podcasts, and have been recognized as thriving artists in Silicon Valley and celebrated by our community. Our next step is bringing our talents to the forefront of the contemporary music society. This EP, release, and tour will be the catalyst to establishing our group as a mainstay in the music industry. Even if you cannot financially contribute, that doesn't mean your help is not important to us. By getting the word out about our campaign on Facebook and Twitter, calling or texting or e-mailing your friends, and sharing it in your social circles, you have already helped us immensely. Use the IndieGoGo share tools too! It can be that easy. Thank you so much!

story:
Let's Jam!

For years, I have loved sharing music with children and families through storytimes, concerts, and music jams.  One of my big dreams is to record a CD to share the joy of song with kids (and parents!) any time.  With your support, we can make this dream a reality!


The Details!

We need to raise $5000.00 to make this project possible.  

This will include all the costs of recording 15-25 super fun songs, compensating fantastic guest musicians, mixing and mastering the recording, artwork for the album, videos, CD pressing, posters, and shipping goodies to you!   

If we raise more than the goal amount, that money will go to making an even better album, and move along production for a second CD.  I have SO MUCH music to share!

Cool Stuff for You!

To meet our goal, every little bit helps.  I've thought of some cool stuff to offer as thanks for your support.  Sticker sheets, mp3 downloads of the album, signed copies of my CD with album art for kids to color, and handcrafted instruments are just some of the perks you can receive as thanks for your contribution. If we make our goal, I'll throw a big CD release party for everyone, and donors at the $30 level or higher will receive a VIP goodie bag for the special event. Check out my full list of THANK YOU! perks on the right side of this page, and here are some pics of some of them!
Handmade wooden shakers- one that jingles, and one that clacks! (Ruler for size reference)


Handmade wooden tone drums


Handmade cigar-box ukulele


Other Ways You Can Help!

Help me share this campaign and my future music by posting this to your Facebook Pages, your websites, Tweet about it, Instagram, Blog... whatever you can do to help is greatly appreciated!

You can follow me on: 

Facebook: Rebecca Sunshine Music

YouTube: Rebecca Sunshine Music

Instagram: miss_rebecca_sunshine

My website! http://www.rebeccasunshinemusic.com

Is there some other unique perk you're interested in? Have a cool idea and want us to offer it? Just ask!

story:
If you live outside the US please ad $5 shipping to your order

I started out strumming a guitar in the early 90's, booked several bands in the northwest, gave some a chance to prove themselves (which many did) and have been involved in producing indy films for about 8 years. Music has always been a salvation for me and I have turned to it when searching for something in life. After writing songs for the award winning soundtrack to "A Perfect Life", I am again inspired to create music. It has taken quite a bit of searching and growing to write these songs and do this (with the help of amazing friends) This is where the spirit of the music comes from, growth, rebirth, healing, belief and finding beauty. The cd was recorded in candle lit rooms and a theatre in Tacoma, WA. The music is intimate,organic, acoustic and recorded with very few overdubs. Please check out the gallery section for videos etc. or  http://www.musicxray.com/xrays/search?q=joe+rosati&x=0&y=0 (these tracks do not play on mobile devices) and https://soundcloud.com/joerosati for direct links to hear music! Int'l press http://www.eyesin.com/music/2013/the-candelabra-light-... Also on twitter @joerosatimusic. I am not looking to raise a large amount of money as the most expensive part is completed. It is, in a way, a pre sale/exposure of the project to get the word out in advance of just selling CDs at shows. The exciting news is since networking in Park City, UT and at Sundance, I have met two people with direct connections to the industry who will be personally delivering the project. "The hardest thing for an aspiring musician is to get their songs heard by the right people" ~ Greg Wells, multi Grammy nominated producer.

 

What we need, a little background and what you get:

I have broken the costs down of what the funding is going to. It is a flexible funding campaign so whatever is donated will go towards the project and it will be put out even if I have to do it on my own. With the network I have from booking bands and producing Indy films, the goal should be attainable. I have been in the entertainment industry in one form or another for roughly 14 years and want to build on something and have that foundation of baby stepping to success. It is not easy putting yourself all the way out there like this. The perks are to get the music out there whether recorded, playing live or both and to have you be a part of the process. The inlfluences range from Joy Division and Echo and the Bunnymen to Led Zeppelin, Peter Gabriel,Lou Reed and Leonard Cohen. I am ready to begin the next chapter in my life of continuing to pursue my dreams. If you go to the gallery section there are two videos to get a taste of the music.

Please spread the word and thank you! ~ Joe Rosati and the team who is helping me do this, Ben Fuller, Jeremy Silas and Ted Fuller.

Funding $900 cd replication and digital distribution.

$450 promotion, building website, design concept, signing up for cd baby and other sites to promote music. Many of these are around $10 a month to run at the highest levels of promotion.

$300 Mastering to get the sound to optimal levels.

$200 mixing 

$150 fees for indiegogo

story:
We are a small group of dedicated gothic scene promoters from Tx and La looking to bring you a Halloween event like no other hosted in one of America's most beautiful cities: New Orleans, LA.

The Event:

The event will be a one day gothic/deathrock mini festival, a lavish Gothic Halloween Costumed Masquerade Ball.

The Ball will take place Oct 27th 2013, and will round off a weekend of fun Spooky new orleans events. We purposely put the ball on Sunday so we will not compete with any of the other halloween events and balls in the city. This way you can have a WHOLE WEEKEND of events in the city Friday- Sunday.

We tentatively have reserved the historical music venue Tipitina's for our Sunday venue.  This will be a lovely costumed gothic masquerade ball in the true spirit of Halloween and the celebrating the spooky decadence of New orleans. Goths Ghosts and Ghouls are welcome! Ticket price point we are aiming for is $29.99 there will be a full bar at the venue.

At the moment there is no halloween event dedicated soley to the gothic scene going on in New Orleans on Halloween weekend, we have our friends at the vampire and witches balls but no event ESPECIALLY for Gothic/Deathrock music. We are aiming to change that!

 

Our Talent:


Headlining our line-up is Gothic/Deathrock legends Ex Voto. Ex Voto come straight out of the 80s Californa deathrock scene, have lived in New Orleans, and now call Texas their home.

 

2nd Headliner:

Fangs on Fur (Los Angeles, CA)

 

Supporting acts are:

Gothic rock band Ending the Vicious Cycle (Fort worth Texas)

 

POST RAPTURE PARTY (SEATTLE, WA)

 

and Post Punk band The Secret Post (Oklahoma).

 

Our Guest Dj is Dj Jose, of Arkham Brooklyn NYC.

Also Dj Hex (Lake Charles/Nola)

 

Spooky Burlesque by:

Siouxsie Monroe

and Dark Songstress Lemme Addams

Plus vendors will be selling spooky wares for you to peruse and purchase!

 

The City:

New Orleans, La is a gothy tourist destination within it's own right. With it's long history and haunted reputation it is one of the most truly "goth" cities in the United States. New Orleans offers many lovely attractions to visit, many stores catering to the odd and macabre, and many haunted tours are available. Plus there is that added attraction of selling Alcohol 24-7!

Accommodations:


We are working to secure a hotel for you located in the French Quarter. Stay tuned for updates.

What We Need & What You Get

 As everyone knows starting a new event/festival is tough. It is even tougher to start a event catering to a specific subculture, especially the Gothic/Deathrock scenes here in the USA. We are looking to give something awesome to the scenes we love and we need your help! We want this to be more than a small festival but a memorable event that we can continue to host each year. In order to hold this event at a quality venue and to insure our talent is paid we need funding. Each and every one of us is digging into our own pockets for this event, but that's just not enough! We need you YOU the gothic scene to help give us your support so we can give you something worth everyone's time and efforts!

Our venue alone will cost of the $3500 goal we have, we are prepared to pay the talent out of our own pockets. However if we go over our goal we will use all funds to pay talent, book more talent, and put back into the festival to make it even better and more decadent. We do not plan to do this half-way. When we do a Gothic Ball we do it right. Cobwebs, Candles, Dripping lace? We've got it and more!

What will you get for helping us? We are prepared to offer our eternal thanks along with some really nifty rewards for backing our project. This includes thank yous on our event page, t-shirts, free tickets to the event, VIP packages etc.

The gothic scene in the USA is budding again and it is time to start having some extravagant and fun events again. We want to bring back events in the spirit of the popular gothic festivals of years past. We can do this with your help!! Even one dollar will help!
 
Intresting Facts:
 
Did you know that our tentative venue Tipitina’s is a non profit? All proceeds they make at events after covering venue rental goes to there Tipitina’s foundation which supports local musicians and the music history of New Orleans. We thought by doing our event here we would help give back to the music community in a city we love!

Well who are these spooky folk exactly?


We know you don't wanna fork over your hard earned cash to just any noobs that say the are putting on a event. But we have a talented group of well seasoned spooky people behind our event and we want to tell you a bit about us.

Tracy Robertson AKA "Batty": Batty has been a part of the gothic scene since about 1996. She is the force behind the popular brand Azrael's Accomplice Designs, a former alt.model, and A scene Promoter and Dj in Dallas, Texas. Batty's group the Shadow Society produce events locally in DFW with much success and are ready to expand to New Orleans to help bring you this event. She has also attended, vended, and done just about everything in between at many gothic festivals across north america for more years then she would care to mention.

Kris Prudhomme aka Dj Hex: Kris is a Dj and event promoter who now hails from Lake Charles but works often in new orleans and formly Houston Tx. His group Unholy Burial Productions will be working in context with Shadow Society productions to bring you this event. Kris is also a founder of the Age of Decay festival which was also successfully funded last year!

Toby Rider: Toby will be in charge of the financial and business management side of the festival. He has a MBA from the University of Dallas. Aside from being great with managing projects Toby is a old school goth rocker hailing originally from LA, CA. Growing up in the hey-day of 80's deathrock and goth. He is the front man of ENDING THE VICIOUS CYCLE and now calls Fort Worth Texas his home. He is well versed in the ins and outs of booking bands and venues, as he has been doing this since the 80's!

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Genevieve Heyward and I'm a singer-songwriter residing in Door County, Wisconsin. I have been playing music my entire life and I have been a professional musician for the last year and a half, playing shows all over the United States. I recently released my sophomore Ep "The River", which AmericanaUK said: "shines with lilting vocals, sharply clever lyrics, and a distinctly country hued musicality that should be able to win over both traditional and more modern fans of the genre alike.”

The record was produced, engineered and mixed by Norwegian multi-instrumentalist, Marcus Trana, who is based in Sturgeon Bay, Wisconsin. There are also a handful of both Norwegian and American musicians featured on the record, making it a true Trans-Atlantic collaboration! 

In October, I am headed to Scandinavia for my very first tour abroad with my band, The North, which features Nick Hoover (Deathfolk) on guitar and Marcus Trana on drums. We will play 13 shows in 16 days starting in Oslo, Norway, then off to Sweden before traveling West to Bergen for our final performance. All told, we'll put on 2000+ miles through mountain passes, endless Norwegian tollways and fjords.

Even more exciting, I'm going to record a 3 song EP 'The Norway Session' at Nylenda Vev & Dur, a small barn that has been retrofitted as a recording studio in Arendal, Norway. 

This tour will be an important step in my musical career, helping me to not only expand my audience and enhance my live playing skills, but to also introduce me to new musical friends and collaborators. 

Fun fact: I have Swedish roots and will be meeting a distant cousin at one of my shows <3 

  

What We Need & What You Get

Plane tickets have been booked and lodging is secured, but I do need help covering expenses for tour van rental, ga$, tollways, as well as 2 days recording at Nygrenda Vev & Dur. 

It means the world to me and to my band to experience this tour with reduced financial stress. It's because of your continued support that I have even made it this far, and for that I say THANK YOU.

The Impact

I am super proud to represent Wisconsin and to bring greater awareness of Door County's music scene abroad. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily you can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and also by letting people in Scandinavia know that I am on my way: let's do this!
story_txt:
Who Am I?
My name is Genevieve Heyward and I'm a singer-songwriter residing in Door County, Wisconsin. I have been playing music my entire life and I have been a professional musician for the last year and a half, playing shows all over the United States. I recently released my sophomore Ep "The River", which AmericanaUK said: "shines with lilting vocals, sharply clever lyrics, and a distinctly country hued musicality that should be able to win over both traditional and more modern fans of the genre alike.”
The record was produced, engineered and mixed by Norwegian multi-instrumentalist, Marcus Trana, who is based in Sturgeon Bay, Wisconsin. There are also a handful of both Norwegian and American musicians featured on the record, making it a true Trans-Atlantic collaboration! 

In October, I am headed to Scandinavia for my very first tour abroad with my band, The North, which features Nick Hoover (Deathfolk) on guitar and Marcus Trana on drums. We will play 13 shows in 16 days starting in Oslo, Norway, then off to Sweden before traveling West to Bergen for our final performance. All told, we'll put on 2000+ miles through mountain passes, endless Norwegian tollways and fjords.

Even more exciting, I'm going to record a 3 song EP 'The Norway Session' at Nylenda Vev & Dur, a small barn that has been retrofitted as a recording studio in Arendal, Norway. 
This tour will be an important step in my musical career, helping me to not only expand my audience and enhance my live playing skills, but to also introduce me to new musical friends and collaborators. 
Fun fact: I have Swedish roots and will be meeting a distant cousin at one of my shows <3 
  

What We Need & What You Get
Plane tickets have been booked and lodging is secured, but I do need help covering expenses for tour van rental, ga$, tollways, as well as 2 days recording at Nygrenda Vev & Dur. 
It means the world to me and to my band to experience this tour with reduced financial stress. It's because of your continued support that I have even made it this far, and for that I say THANK YOU.

The Impact
I am super proud to represent Wisconsin and to bring greater awareness of Door County's music scene abroad. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help monetarily you can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and also by letting people in Scandinavia know that I am on my way: let's do this!

story:
This is our first professionally recorded album and we did it right here at home in Maine with the incredibly talented Jon Wyman of The Halo Studio.  We tracked for 12 days in the studio with Jon then proceeded to get the album mastered with Adam Ayan at the legendary Gateway Mastering.


 

We’ve been a band for going on four years now, and have spent that time really honing our sound into something that we believe is unique and powerful.  After having self-recorded and produced our first two EPs, we wanted to take it to the next level. So we decided to give our songs what they deserved: professional quality recording to bring them to life just like we had always imagined!!   

Writing and recording the album is only one part of the battle...enter the next phase of the project.  By pre-ordering the album along with exclusive merch only available through this campaign, you are sending us love and support that will help propel us onto bigger stages at better venues where we can play our tunes for larger audiences!

 

 

Exclusive Merchandise

As a bonus to getting in on the ground level we've added some limited run merchandise only available through this campaign.  The poster and T-shirts designs will never be made again!  We're also including signed photos and one-of-a-kind polaroid pictures from our time in the studio with select packages. 

Get the polaroid by ordering the "I WANT EVERYTHING" bundle!  Limited polaroids exist, make sure to check the updates incase they sell out. 



 

Live Rehearsal Stream or Live Show

For those of you who are craving the one-of-a-kind experience of a private and intimate interaction with us guys in FOTE, the last two pre-order bundles are for you!  With these packages you will get every single item we have to offer shipped right to your door step.  In addition, we will drive our asses anywhere in New England to give you a private show AND live stream one of our rehearsals so you can get a behind-the-scenes look at us doing our thing at Grime Studios right here in Portland, ME.  Both will involve us playing the album in its entirety for your viewing and listening pleasure!  

 

Now that you know what you're in for, we hope you know even the smallest purchase really means the world to us! Even if you can't afford any of the packages, we understand, but you can still help! Please spread the word and SHARE this campaign EVERYWHERE!

So, to all of our family, friends and fans that are helping (and have helped) this dream become a reality, we want to say THANK YOU. We wouldn't be where we are without you. 

As Pete so eloquently said: "it shows us that our BULLSHIT does not go unnoticed." So...much obliged. :)

 

Thank you! We love you!

-Tim, Darrell, Pete, Ned and Tom

story:
Savage Beginnings 

In 2015, a group of us lovers of high octane rock n roll paid attention to the fact that our region had great bands and a dying economy, so the obvious thing to do was put our money where the music was and go old school.  We found a local club willing to host it, and thus was born the Savage Mountain Punk Festival. Our goal: keep ticket prices low so as not to price out the local music fans while simultaneously bringing in acts that would attract some tourism.

Fast forward five years and Savage Mountain Punk Fest has gotten local business sponsors to help house, feed, and support the bands; joined forces with the county tourism board to advertise the festival; hosted national and international acts (The Queers, The Undead, Argyle Goolsby); added a third day to the Festival; and attracted punks from over 20 states coast to coast.  

Our goal remains to keep ticket prices low while bringing in name acts in an intimate venue. It provides all the support of a club show with all the closeness of a house show.  That's the Savage Mountain Punk Fest experience.

DIY

Our funds go to artists. That's it. Let's keep ticket prices affordable, put a show on in an intimate venue, and bring in name acts. We've increased the band budget by 500% since the first Festival, and support from music lovers helps make it happen. Our goal of $2000 goes to paying the bands, including a major internationally known punk act (to be announced April 3) who's already agreed to join us.

  • Support live music and help a small Appalachian town with tourism and economic development.
  • Get music, tickets, limited edition t-shirts, locally-roasted Savage Mountain Punk Roast coffee, and special other perks.
  • Develop an audience for smaller regional bands who get the exposure of playing in a Festival: bands have networked for shows, met with label executives, and grown their prestige by playing the festival. 

The Impact

Your support helps touring musicians, many of whom make a living by playing rock n roll, and helps a small town. The Festival happens in the heart of Frostburg, Maryland's A&E district; it helps support coffeeshops, restaurants, indie book stores and record stores, and other small business as well as area hotels.

  • Over 50 local and regional businesses of all sorts (from coffeeshops and tattoo parlors to doctor's offices; from regional radio stations to the City of Frostburg and Allegany County Tourism) support what we do because they see the results.
  • After five years, the Festival continues to grow its audience and reputation, and we've been fortunate to have support from funders from all over the country.
  • We hear from bands from all over the world that want to be a part of the Savage Mountain Festival, we hear from bands from all over the region who want to play. That's why this year we're starting a day earlier than previously. Continued growth. That's success.

Challenges

The Festival gets bigger that means more logistics, more audience members, and more things that might go wrong for a small group of volunteers who all work full-time jobs. It also means getting more hands on deck. Fortunately, when bands have canceled in the past, we've been able to replace them as more bands want to play the Festival than we have slots available. Other past problems included a band caterer cancelling last minute (a friend of the Festival made food for the bands instead) and a hotel closing (the audience was moved to another close by).  The good thing is the Festival has a lot of support from the Frostburg community at large, whether they like the music or not. 

Spread the word

Don't have the money to help out? Don't like punk rock?  That's cool.  Tell your friends who do they should come out to Frostburg this August. And please spread the word about this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

   We have begun work on our 3rd studio album and we could use your help completing it! We have been playing together for 8 years, over 800 shows in 35 states and have loved every minute of it (well maybe not every minute). There have been many sacrifices made in our personal lives to keep the band together and the show on the road. With the current state of the music industry and the large expenses that come with making a record we find ourselves in need of little help from our friends.  

   Ken Coomer (formerly of Wilco and Uncle Tupelo) is going producing our new batch of songs in his studio in Nashville and we are very excited about working with him. Recording is expensive and we have put thousands of dollars of our own money into this project already. Your contribution will help with the recording, production and promotional costs that come with making a record. We have schemed up some great perks to accompany your contribution with some unique opportunities available.

   Chamomile and Whiskey has always been a family, we've had so much help to get us where we are now and we are very grateful for it. This feels like an important time for us, we have a lot riding on this record and want to do it right. Your consideration and support mean so much to us... we give you our most sincere "Thank You."

Chamomile and Whiskey

What We Need & What You Get

   What we need is pretty simple... to make and unveil this record in the best way possible. We have an amazing opportunity to work with acclaimed producer Ken Coomer in his analog studio in Nashville. The work as already begun and your contributions will go towards completing the album (tracking, mixing, mastering and production) as well as the promotional campaign for the record release. 

   We had a lot of fun coming up with the list of perks. The easiest thing we can ask of you is to consider "pre-ordering" the album. But if you'd like to go for something more unique we've got some great options... flowers from Marie, jewelry from Marsh, postcards from the road, custom song from Koda, VIP parties and our favorite, have the band play a party at your house! 

  $12,000 is the lowest number we could come up with to make the full record and promote it the way we feel is necessary, We've already put in thousands of dollars of our own money but the bank account is running low. Any contribution or help sharing the campaign is most appreciated. 

The Impact

   We are so excited about this batch of songs! We feel very lucky to have the following that we do, especially in Virginia, but for the band to continue on we really need to be able to grow our fanbase nationally. Releasing Wandering Boots and Sweet Afton, we learned so much about making and putting out records... we feel that we finally have the right plan to make this album and help bring the band to a wider audience. 

   The opportunity we have right now to work in Nashville with a great producer is something we do not want to waste. 

Risks & Challenges

    The current state of the music industry makes it very tough for bands to make a big impact. People are not buying nearly as many records and streaming services do not make most bands a significant amount of money. We have seen many other acts have a lot of success doing it on their own. 8 years ago we probably wouldn't have been able to put this money to the best use... but our years of experience leave us with a lot of confidence to execute our plan. Most importantly, we feel like we can make the album that we want to make... the best possible recording and representation of what we are right now. 

Other Ways You Can Help

    Sadly, none of us have a trust fund to dip into and we understand that many people simply cannot afford a financial contribution. Sharing our campaign is a huge help to us, if you've enjoyed a show or like a song please use social media to let people know that we aren't too bad and we could use a little help. 

Thank You all.

story:
The Journey So Far...
I have always been a questioner, curious to discover, to explore what lies beyond, to dig, to embark on new adventures. It is now time for a new adventure, a second album, and I invite you to be part of that journey with me...

My young niece was the initial spark. I sat and contemplated how her life was changing as she herself changed, stepping away from girlhood and into adolescence; what life might bring as she eventually danced her way into womanhood. I thought of all the changes and challenges that she may encounter. 

A song emerged for her, bubbling its way into existence. I found myself remembering the multitude of stories and lives of girls and women that have moved me and inspired me over time - people I have known and loved, those I have met on my travels and during my work as a photographer, women appearing in folk tales or those whose lives I have read about and re-imagined. 

Their lives form the canvas on which my album is painted. With their stories, I trace an arc from ancestry, through girlhood and womanhood, into (and beyond) death, imagining a continuity of humanity over place and time. In the humblest of ways, I hope that this new body of work is able to reflect some of the explosion of colour and nuance that is femalehood. That is, at the end of the day, being human. 

 
Nine Olimba will be recorded as part of the second album
 

Who We Are...
Some incredible musicians have come to form the bedrock of my six-piece band, and they will be in the studio with me in May, adding their stardust to my music. Percussionist Mamadou Sarr who tours the word with Senegalese star Baaba Maal, Mercury-nominated saxophonist Chris Williams, fabulous drummer Yuval Wetzler, versatile guitarist Phil Dawson, and of course, on bass and the producer behind the last and forthcoming albums, Mercury-nominated Liran Donin.

Beyond anything I had expected, the first album we recorded received great reviews (including being amongst the Sunday Times Top 100 Albums of 2014), and we began touring. For two years, we took my music as far and wide as we could, playing up and down the UK, heading to Europe, the States, southern Africa. Whether the audiences were thousand-strong or intimate living-room sized, they came and clapped, they sang along, they danced. Some laughed, others were moved to tears. They journeyed with us and with the music, and were the ones who kept us going and growing. 

I could not ask for a better band of brothers to have accompanied me through the high and low cards that this industry deals you, and I can't wait to make this second record with them!

 

Now, this is how you come in....
I was reminded of the butterfly effect the other day, that concept that a single occurrence, no matter how small, can change the course of the universe. I have come to you, to ask you to be my butterfly effect. To be part of the team. To show that support exists for indie artists making music out of the mainstream. To be a dreamer and a believer. To help make this new record possible. 

Grab a perk or two, and shout out about the campaign on social media (remember: butterfly effect!). However you feel you are able to help, I will be enormously grateful. Journeys are always more beautiful when made with others. I look forward to making this one with you!

 

The Perks (We all love Perks!)
Purchasing a perk is what will make the album possible, so feel free to have a rummage around the goodie bag and grab one! You can also simply back the campaign if you prefer. Here are some of the gifts on offer for joining the team:

  • The new CD!

    (This is a sample of the first album)

 

  • The new beautifully designed, hand-printed t-shirt for the second album
    (This is a sample of the first album t-shirt) ​

​

  •  A unique postcard set 
    (Sample images)

 

  • A limited edition album art print
    (Sample image from the album cover photoshoot)​

​

 

  • A “dweeb session” with us in the recording studio
    (Spend time with these cool dudes!)​

 

  • Private gigs! 

 

Check out the perks list to see the fullness of the goodie bag, there are plenty of others in there!

 

Where your contribution goes...
Funds raised will pay for the following expenses:

•    Studio time (rehearsals & recording) : Rehearsals start full swing mid-April, and we hit the studio May 15th - 18th to lay the record live
•    Musicians’ session fees : the full six-piece band recording live over 4 days
•    Producer fees : producer Liran Donin is again helping forge the next album
•    Mixing : Soda Studios hire to mix the album 
•    Mixing engineer : Sonny, who mixed our first record, will be working his magic
•    Mastering : the final touches to the album
•    Artwork : so it all looks beautifully packaged!

If your support amazingly helps us to tip above and beyond the target, any additional funds will be put towards the other costs of releasing the album: the album manufacture, PR costs (national and international), and the launch show. 

Even if we don’t quite manage to reach the goal, the project will still move forwards: resourcefulness as an indie artist is part of the game, and we keep moving onwards and upwards no matter the challenges! Funds will go towards the essential first phase of the recording: the studio time, musicians’ session fees and producer fees, and roll out from there to the mixing, mastering and manufacture.

Either and any which way, I thank you for your support and your belief!

To help make this new record possible. Grab a perk or two, and shout out about the campaign on social media (remember: butterfly effect!). However you feel you are able to help, I will be enormously grateful. Journeys are always more beautiful when made with others. I look forward to making this one with you! The Perks (We all love Perks!)Purchasing a perk is what will make the album possible, so feel free to have a rummage around the goodie bag and grab one! You can also simply back the campaign if you prefer. Here are some of the gifts on offer for joining the team:
The new CD! (This is a sample of the first album)
 
The new beautifully designed, hand-printed t-shirt for the second album(This is a sample of the first album t-shirt) ​
​
 A unique postcard set (Sample images) 
A limited edition album art print(Sample image from the album cover photoshoot)​
​ 
A “dweeb session” with us in the recording studio(Spend time with these cool dudes!)​
 
Private gigs!  Check out the perks list to see the fullness of the goodie bag, there are plenty of others in there! Where your contribution goes...Funds raised will pay for the following expenses:•    Studio time (rehearsals & recording) : Rehearsals start full swing mid-April, and we hit the studio May 15th - 18th to lay the record live•    Musicians’ session fees : the full six-piece band recording live over 4 days•    Producer fees : producer Liran Donin is again helping forge the next album•    Mixing : Soda Studios hire to mix the album •    Mixing engineer : Sonny, who mixed our first record, will be working his magic•    Mastering : the final touches to the album•    Artwork : so it all looks beautifully packaged!If your support amazingly helps us to tip above and beyond the target, any additional funds will be put towards the other costs of releasing the album: the album manufacture, PR costs (national and international), and the launch show. Even if we don’t quite manage to reach the goal, the project will still move forwards: resourcefulness as an indie artist is part of the game, and we keep moving onwards and upwards no matter the challenges! Funds will go towards the essential first phase of the recording: the studio time, musicians’ session fees and producer fees, and roll out from there to the mixing, mastering and manufacture.Either and any which way, I thank you for your support and your belief!

story:
Here's Whats Up

The Village Geniuses are Ecstatic! Over the Moon! Leaping with Unbridled Joy! Running, Screaming with Glee, Through the City Streets, Why?

They have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to record with legendary producer Daniel Smith (Danielson Famile, mewithoutYou, Sufjan Stevens).

It took 6 years to write the lyrics, and 2 more to arrange the melodies— and their songs are ready to be shared with the world.

With your contribution, their satchel full of songs will finally become an album: professionally recorded and produced by one of the most creative minds in music.

What We Need & What You Get

Every dollar gets Village Geniuses closer to their  goal. Your contribution helps them:

  • Travel safely to and from the Danielson Familie Studio in New Jersey
  • Secure the studio space
  • Complete album production (mixing, mastering, printing, pressing, and packaging)

In return, you’ll get:

  • First dibs on the new album!
  • T-shirts and swag!
  • Art! Customized for You!

Even if Village Geniuses don’t reach their campaign goal, you’ll still get your rewards. You’ve got nothing to lose, and a lifetime of love, gratitude, and birthday party invitations to gain.

Ready to help make an album? Donate here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating is one way you can help, but it's not the only way. You can also:

  • Tattoo the link to this campaign on your dominant arm!
  • Spread the word! Share this campaign with a friend!
  • Paint the Village Geniuses logo on the side of your panel van!
  • Throw your spare change at Craig, Taylor, or Jonni when you see them in person!

Whatever you can do, the Village Geniuses love you. Thank you for bringing this album to life.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, this is Sam Erickson, frontman of We Are Not a Glum Lot. We've been a band for 8 years now, and have accomplished and experienced things I would have never in my wildest dreams imagined. This newest record is my favorite yet, and the three of us would love to get it in the hands of as many people as possible. This can only be achieved if it has a strong physical presence. We believe we can distribute it most effectively through having it pressed onto cassette tapes, and compact discs. This way, there are multiple mediums you could listen to the new record way. While I make music solely for myself, hearing people's reactions to my songs is incredibly touching, and inspiring. It is a great feeling when people can bond over the general experience of being human. By donating to this campaign, you are supporting artists pursuing what they love. You are contributing to the distribution of sincere music, which will hopefully be enjoyed and related to by many.

 

What We Need & What You Get

All of our funds went into the actual production of the record. Raising the aforementioned funds took time, and now that the record is done, we simply do not have the resources we need to get it mastered and physically produced. To press the Cassette Tapes, we will be going through duplication.ca which specializes in tape duplication. We plan for the production of 150 cassettes to cost roughly $250. For the cd's, we will use discmakers.com, a very reliable, professional company. We plan for 150 CD's to also roughly be $250. The remaining 250$ will be going to Marc Benning, producer at HideAway Studios, to master the 7 track album. Mastering, in laymen's terms, balances the sonic qualities of music to optimize the quality of playback across all mediums of music listening. In exchange for your financial support, you will be able to preorder the record on tape and CD. You will be able to buy We Are Not a Glum Lot t-shirts (new and old) and even pay for a performance by us at a time and place of your choosing, within reason, of course. If you are interested in attending our Record Release celebration, we even have album/ticket bundles in exchange for your support. In the event that we don't meet or goal, we will still use the funds we have for the aforementioned needs of pressing and mastering the record.

The Impact

We have poured our hearts and souls into this record, and we really think it shows. In a world full of technology and synthetic sounds and images, we wanted to make something that was very human and genuine. It is obvious that this record is important to us, and as a result we are confident that others will enjoy it as well, and we aim to get it in the hands of as many people as we possibly can. Back in 2010, we did a crowdfunding campaign to raise double of what we're asking now, $1500, to record our first EP. The campaign was very successful and helped us become more in touch with the community that supports us. Again, it is time for us to reach out to our incredibly kind, caring, community and ask for their help, which is always greatly, greatly appreciated.

Risks & Challenges

A difficult part of this campaign will simply be drumming up enough attention to it. We will need the help others to spread it around. Through trial and error, I have become a bit accustomed to promoting, both digitally and physically. We will tirelessly work to garner attention to this page. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're reading this, we ask that you simply share this page via social media, email it to your family, friends, or anyone that would even be remotely interested, or just tell someone about it in person. The share tools on Indiegogo page are very easy to use, just click and share :) Any contribution is greatly, greatly, appreciated. Wether it be simply sharing this page or contributing financially, we genuinely are ecstatic for your help. Thank you for reading and checking out our page! That's all folks! 

- Love, Sam Erickson, Zac Blum, and Reggie Thompson.

story:
All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them. - Walt Disney

 

I am a 15 year old singer/songwriter from St.John’s, Newfoundland. I have been singing since the age of two and started performing at 5. Last year I played over 40 stages, recorded a demo, worked with many amazing artists and attended many workshops and seminars. This is a path I have chosen as a career and I work very hard to make that happen.

This next step with my EP has been a dream for a while. You could all have a huge hand in making that happen. 

I will be working with a fantastic producer Chris Ledrew and some amazing musicians. As you  can imagine this type of production will be costly.

I have some amazing perks listed for those of you  wishing to get involved.

Pick the perk that you  want to be a part of.

Would you  like me to come to your home/business and perform or a Skype performance,  would you  like to come to the studio and be a part of the recording process, would you  like signed CD’s or merchandise, would you  like to be a part of an exclusive launch party? 

 

All the funds raised from this campaign will go to the album. It will help cover the cost of:

-Studio Space

-Recording

-Mixing & Mastering

-Production

-Graphic Design/Artwork

-Distribution

-Marketing

I am so very excited to get this started and more excited to get into the studio and start recording those songs. I appreciate everyone of you who will help in any way they can. If you  are unable to contribute financially please share the campaign with friends or family, talk about it and create some noise around it.

This will not be possible without your support. 

Thanks so much and hope to see & meet many of you  on this journey!

Rachel

When the troubles of the day become too much I know that there is always another song to write and another performance to give. This isn’t just my dream; this is me. ~Rachel Cousins

story:
Short Summary

This is a very exciting project for Beth, it will be her second full length release. The intention is to have this album launch Beth onto the national stage in Canada. The album will be recorded in Toronto at The Hive with award winning producer, Timothy Abraham. Through extensive pre-production and tracking of over 40 demos the album has been narrowed down to 10 songs that show off the best of Beth’s music. A lot of great Canadian musicians have already signed on to be a part of the recordings such as Adam Warner (Jill Barber, Drummer) , Mark McIntyre (Emma-Lee, Bass), Bryden Baird (Feist, Horns). Recently, the CBC Radio 1 show Bandwidth did a live interview with Beth that will feature her song ‘Love Now’ (one of the demos for this album). On Canada Day Beth performed on Major’s Hill in Ottawa, as well as participated in the CBC Canada Day songwriter’s circle. These performances were aired coast to coast and will help give her the momentum needed to launch this album on a National platform. Three Songs off of Beth’s previous album found success with film and television placement, including features in internationally distributed documentary ‘ A Second Knock at the Door’. Her song ‘Love Now’ which will be on this album have already been featured on the hit show Degrassi. Requests have already been made from music supervisors at MTV and CHOP SHOP (Grey’s Anatomy, Mad Men, Private Practice, etc.) We are confident that this album will be successful in several areas: film and tv placement, online and physical sales, social media fan base expansion, etc. Beth is already beginning to step onto the national stage and and believes that this album is going to help her step through already open doors.

What Beth Needs & What You Get

This is a very ambitious project for Beth.  The total cost of the album is around $24,000, not including marketing and production.  All money raised for the album will go to the cost of recording and production and all extra funds will go towards touring and marketing the album.  Beth has put together a very unique perk package so that everyone gets something in return for their generous support.  

There are many options for you to help Beth out. 

You can purchase a ‘fan-package’ which is for fans who just want some product and some other great gifts!

There are ‘corporate sponsorship packages’ for small business owners who need graphic design work and other things alike.  Beth is a freelance designer and has gotten some very talented friends to jump on board to reach all of your design and marketing needs.

If you are not a business but a musician or entrepreneur, Beth has put together a more modest ‘design-package’ for you! 

You can pre-order the album for just $15 and receive a free download of ‘Love Now’ which was featured on hit show Degrassi. 

Wherever you are at, we have something for you! Every little bit helps! 

 ALL INFO AT http://www.bethmooremusic.com/support

The Impact

Beth started playing music only 6 short years ago, and has come a long way since.  With her roots in Port Colborne, Ontario she has had to work for every step.  She hopes to effect people with some good honest music.  

“I believe it’s possible for us to do everything we hope to, our circumstances never determine our capabilities.  There is no reason I should be able to fund and pull of an album like this as an independent artist from a small town.  I can’t do it alone, but i’d rather go on this adventure with as many people as possible anyways.  We can do amazing things when we help each other with the little we have. I will not forget the generosity of every listener and supporter that have walked with me through this great journey.” - Beth Moore

 

Other Ways You Can Help

- share on facebook, twitter, email, instagram

- tell your friends and family

- anything you can do to get the word out, helps! 

 

CHECK OUT www.bethmooremusic.com/support

story:
THE CAMPAIGN IS NOW FINISHED!

You can't donate, but you can buy an Elephant Gods album at:
elephantgods.bandcamp.com
Download only at the moment, we're currently getting the vinyl pressed and it will be available soon!
thanks to all who contributed, 
Doctor J.

THE CAMPAIGN IS NOW FINISHED!
You can't donate, but you can buy an Elephant Gods album at:
elephantgods.bandcamp.com
Download only at the moment, we're currently getting the vinyl pressed and it will be available soon!
thanks to all who contributed, 
Doctor J.

story:
“Quietly she woke, dream songs of love and loss echoing and fading till she sleepily sang a reply.

At first her paper-thin sweet skin melodies almost broke through the dawn’s desire but the bird song promised adventure and the river of her poured out of her mouth rushing over rock ancient and worn.

Gently whispering tired embers awake until wild flamed tresses danced defiant against the cold black hearth, she put the kettle on.”

So just like the first cup of tea on a winter’s morning, Ilona Harker’s music will sigh into your depths and awaken what is sleeping still.

 

 

ABOUT ME

Hi, My name is Ilona Harker and…

I am a singer/songwriter and storyteller.

I swim through dark spaces and walk blindly in deeper places.

I flounder in pools of words desperate to find the perfect dance.

I also like to sleep and play dress ups but mostly.....

I am a songwriter and as such, have a tendency to fall into the depths.

I like to think my music takes people into those ancient wilds and depths, humming through worn bones and softly singing life back.

 

In the last 15 years I have shared the stage with the likes of Butterfingers, Mama Kin, John Butler, Jordie Lane, The Black Birds, Lucie Thorne, Sara Tindley, Jimmy Dowling and played at some of Australia’s biggest festivals such as Big Day Out, The East Coast Blues and Roots Festival, Byron Bay Blues Festival, Mullum Music Festival and Tamworth Country Music festival and toured Europe.

 

 

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP!

I have been working on this independent double album, ‘Stories The Sea Told Me, Lies I Told The Sea’,  for over 3 years now - re-writing and rearranging the tracks, cutting and editing, composing and curating, all whilst working a few jobs to bring that dream to fruition.

 

So there I was, on track, to release this album in May 2013 and then…

I fell down into a deep dark hole of depression.

 

Yup, due to exhaustion (from work, touring and lack of R’n’R), I got the burn-out blues pretty bad.

So I had to let it all go and look after myself.

Luckily, I have an amazing network of friends and professionals who helped me get better. And I did.

So now I’m back and unfortunately as I wasn’t able to work whilst sick, I used the rest of my savings.

So if you can help me out, I would not only be sincerely grateful, I will give you something in return, apart from the great rewards I have on offer.

 

I am also donating 5% of my end goal to beyondblue; an organisation that is dedicated to reducing the impact of depression and anxiety on individuals, families, carers and society as a whole.

 

 

MY GOAL

My goal is to reach $10,000 (and hopefully beyond). These funds will go towards assisting me to finish the recording process of my album, as well as mixing, mastering and pressing of the album.  The funds will allow me to share my art with people who appreciate music and relate to my story.  It is also such an honour to be supporting an organisation that has helped so many shake off their black clouds.

 

 If by chance I don’t make my goal, any funds raised will still go towards finishing the album, and beyondblue will still receive well-needed and deserved funds.

 

REWARD GOODIES

We have some incredible rewards for anyone who cares to pledge.  These goodies range from song downloads, to having a song written about you and recorded, to a flight over Byron Bay in a Tigermoth plane.  Have a look on the pledge list to the right to find out more great items that could be yours.

 

** PLEASE NOTE -

PLEDGE AMOUNT DOES NOT INCLUDE POSTAGE AND HANDLING COSTS.  YOU WILL BE NOTIFIED ABOUT THESE ADDITIONAL COSTS PRIOR TO SHIPPING GOODS.**

 

 

 

WHAT ELSE YOU CAN DO

I understand that some people may not be able to contribute financially, and if that may be the case, you can still assist in other ways:

  • Spread the word on social media by facebook-ing, twitter-ing, youtube-ing, linkedIn-ing, instagram-ing, pinterest-ing, blogging, emailing, texting etc etc…

  • Use your voice – word of mouth is one of the most effective form of ‘spreading the word’.

  • Email the link to your friends and family

  • Buy my music on Itunes

  • even send me a note of encouragement (every bit helps)

So now I’m back and unfortunately as I wasn’t able to work whilst sick, I used the rest of my savings.
So if you can help me out, I would not only be sincerely grateful, I will give you something in return, apart from the great rewards I have on offer.
 
I am also donating 5% of my end goal to beyondblue; an organisation that is dedicated to reducing the impact of depression and anxiety on individuals, families, carers and society as a whole.
 

 

MY GOAL

My goal is to reach $10,000 (and hopefully beyond). These funds will go towards assisting me to finish the recording process of my album, as well as mixing, mastering and pressing of the album.  The funds will allow me to share my art with people who appreciate music and relate to my story.  It is also such an honour to be supporting an organisation that has helped so many shake off their black clouds.
 
 If by chance I don’t make my goal, any funds raised will still go towards finishing the album, and beyondblue will still receive well-needed and deserved funds.
 
REWARD GOODIES
We have some incredible rewards for anyone who cares to pledge.  These goodies range from song downloads, to having a song written about you and recorded, to a flight over Byron Bay in a Tigermoth plane.  Have a look on the pledge list to the right to find out more great items that could be yours.
 
** PLEASE NOTE - 
PLEDGE AMOUNT DOES NOT INCLUDE POSTAGE AND HANDLING COSTS.  YOU WILL BE NOTIFIED ABOUT THESE ADDITIONAL COSTS PRIOR TO SHIPPING GOODS.**
 

 
 

WHAT ELSE YOU CAN DO

I understand that some people may not be able to contribute financially, and if that may be the case, you can still assist in other ways:


Spread the word on social media by facebook-ing, twitter-ing, youtube-ing, linkedIn-ing, instagram-ing, pinterest-ing, blogging, emailing, texting etc etc…


Use your voice – word of mouth is one of the most effective form of ‘spreading the word’.


Email the link to your friends and family


Buy my music on Itunes


even send me a note of encouragement (every bit helps)

story:
Hey! We are Elenora, an unsigned band from Oregon.  We are crowd funding money to go record our debut full-length record this Spring. Recording a full-length isn't cheap nowadays. We will be in the studio for one month to create the best record we possibly can. Without label support bands like us struggle to put out records and keep our heads above water. This is a huge step in our career and we want you to be a part of it.

 

Our goal is $7,000.

Where it’s going: The $7,000 will cover our studio time, mastering, producer expenses and packaging. We will be taking on the responsibility of everything else such as food, lodging, gear, and travel, all out of pocket. In a perfect world, we could pay for it all ourselves. Unfortunately we cannot, so we are asking for your help!

For every tier of pledge we have awesome incentives, like Skype sessions with the members, a day in the studio, music lessons or even guest vocals on your bands upon record. For all of the incentives please check out the right ride of the page.

 

Other ways to help:


If you can't help us financially, there are other ways.

 

     - Share this page!  You can share it directly to your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc! 

 

     - Tell your friends about us!  Word of mouth is a powerful thing. Show your friends, family or anyone our music!

 

     We are so grateful to have fans as supportive and amazing as you. Thank you for all the support--let’s make this campaign a great one!

story:
Hi everyone! 

My name is Josh.  I've been dj'ing professionally in the San Francisco bay area for about 18 years now.  I play for all types of events ranging from weddings to clubs.  Yesterday morning I received a voicemail from my dad saying that my van was gone.  My van contains all of my dj equipment so I can play at these parties for my clients and their guests.  

Before this occured I was already in $10,000 debt, now we can call it $40,000.  I figure every little bit counts and one of my friends from facebook suggested that I try out a campiagn and he would even contribute.  So, here I am.  I usually am not the type of person to ask for help, I like to do things on my own... But, at this moment in time I really need help.  Basically, I'm starting from the ground up again (equipment wise), and I could use all the help I could get.

To get me going again, I would need to allocate $3000 for my sound system including my brand new pioneer DDJSX mixing system that was $1,100 that I used once before my van was taken.  Lighting with a truss system needs replacing which is going to cost me in upwards of $1,500 including a haze machine that was also in the vehicle.  

Here are some perks that my friend came up with $25 - big hug from Josh, $100 - 1 hour session with Josh, $750 - 3 hour private party set.

story:
Vous avez toujours rêvé d'être le mécène d'une artiste à croquer? Musique, poésie et coquetterie vous interpellent? Vous êtes au bon endroit:

 

  Je suis Odile Dupont

 

    

 

Description:

C’est à Québec, sur le pont de la rue du Pont que j’ai composé, en 2009, la majeure partie de mon répertoire. À chanter seule, la tête au vent, mes chansons prenaient des envols de chute libre.

Puis, la rencontre d’un talentueux guitariste, Éric Savard, m’a fait descendre de la structure de métal. Je me suis enfin posée au sol. Agrippée à sa guitare magique, j'ai solidifié et arrangé mes mélodies perdues.

Et les chansons au vent ont pris leur sens…

Du blogue 'Cris sur le pont, j'en suis venue à faire des spectacles!

 

        

 

Le projet: 

Aujourd'hui, j’ai enfin le profond désir (miaou...) de partager cette expérience artistique avec le public. Il me faut donc des fonds pour fixer ces mots qui ont la bougeotte sur un ALBUM!

  • Je serai entourée de plusieurs chaleureux musiciens (grrrr)… du contrebassiste au joueur de cor français;
  • Je ferai plusieurs heures de studio (ouffff) et il faudra mixer et masteriser l’enregistrement;
  • Je ferai presser (ouch!) les albums;
  • Il y aura un gros travail (hishhhh) de graphisme pour l’album et le site Internet;
  • Du matériel de promotion (ouaf) sera produit;
  • La séance d’enregistrement sera filmée (ouh la la) et photographiée;
  • Un lancement de disque aura lieu... (Youpi)

 

Voilà voilà!

Évidemment, quelques récompenses accompagneront vos dons géréreux! Du bisou à la chanson inédite. Vous trouverez votre compte dans la liste des contreparties -->

 

Donc...

Partagez, investissez, chantez, aimez ou détestez... Puis... flattez votre chat, faites la fiesta et ... revenez!

 

Remerciements:

CHRISTIAN BARON

ALEXIS PIÉPLU

ÉRIC SAVARD

ET

LES AMIS

story:
Short Summary

Hi, there and thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign! We are “A New Challenger Approaches”, a local band based in San Diego, California. We have been working hard and making a name for ourselves since 2008. As a band we have given up everything including leaving our hometown of Yuma, Arizona to pursue this dream and we will continue to work towards achieving it. With that being said, we also want to help encourage others to follow their dreams no matter what the stakes may be. We believe we can successfully do both by making and properly executing this music video.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Any amount donated will make a difference. Your contribution will cover costs such as locations, props, make-up, equipment, and promotions.
  • We tried to think of perks that are special and that show we appreciate the help. We will personally email you a special thank you along with a digital download. If that isn’t grand enough we would like to recognize your help on one of our Behind the scene videos. Also we included our T-shirts. Come on who doesn’t love merch? Last, but certainly not least, you can say you played a big role in this exciting project as an executive producer!

The Impact

For this music video we are teaming up with various up and coming artists from Los Angeles. So not only will this video help promote us, but also it’s the perfect chance for them to show case their skills and talents. Any amount donated is truly appreciated and going toward the production of this collaboration.

Concept

Our story revolves around a young girl whom has grown in a world where there is only one socially accepted type of person; a perfect person. She was set up to believe that she is flawed and she is doing anything and everything to be that ideal person. Her journey is a tough one, but she finds her true antagonist is herself and the way she views herself.

Our video is deeply meaningful and set to inspire others to have hope. We all have that light that guides us and no matter how dim it may seem we want to remind people that this light never goes out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not only are we grateful that you are interested in our project, but we would appreciate it even more if you helped spread the word. So go out tell your friends, your classmates, your co-workers, and even your mom! Just help spread the word with the link:

story:
Welcome to the Third Season of Blues Routes

Your Daily Trip to the Delta


Blues Routes Season Three is a 12 week series of 5 - 10 minute daily radio shows / podcasts heard on NPR (through PRX) and on podcast at iTunes.

 

You can hear some of our previous shows at http://bluesroutes.com

 

We Need Your Help!

To put out this next series of 60 shows, and to get matching funds from stations and sponsors to do so, we need to raise $6000 ($100/show) to research, write, record, and produce the series.

 

What You Get

You get the satisfaction of helping to promote the amazing legacy of Blues music and musicians, AND you get some pretty darn cool stuff (just take a look at the list over there on the right).

Please Join Now!

Bring Back the Blues Routes!

Shows/Podcasts will begin January 2013

story:
KARABEARA'S CAMPAIGN STORY: 

 

My name is Kara Evelyn - AKA  KaraBeara - and I am asking for support in my quest to make GREAT music for kids! My aim is to put together a high-quality Music Demo meant to inspire and teach imagination, creativity, a love of play, and to support the healthy development of children’s socialization skills. The money raised through this campaign will accomplish the following: 

  1. It will go towards Recording, Mixing, Mastering and the Arrangement of the songs I’ve written with a professional producer. 
  2. This upon completion will help me to submit myself for full-length album funding from government and other music funding organizations like Factor, Ontario Arts Council and Toronto Arts Council. 
  3. It will start me in building a repertoire with which I can then submit for performances in community concerts, grade schools, festivals, competitions and media reviews. 
  4. It will show my skills off to possible other collaborators looking for talent to work on their music and bring in talent for my projects. 
  5. It will allow me to submit my music for licensing opportunities like Children’s TV Shows, Satellite Radio Stations and Galaxie Radio Stations geared toward kids. 

This funding is also meant to contribute towards website creation, marketing, promotion, distribution, and overall will start me off on the independent career path of musical artistry I’ve longed to be apart of all my life. 

I have been singing since I was 12 years old. In the past I have been a backup singer for a groovy funk band, headlined for a full, big-band jazz orchestra, been a diva for a burlesque troupe, brought tears to some eyes, smiles to some faces, and audiences to their feet -- But there is NOTHING like the feeling I get from inspiring a child to dance and sing along to something I have created. It is a truly magical feeling, so I hope you will help me to perpetuate the magic.

(Get to know KaraBeara Here)  Listen to some KaraBeara Favourites: 

 

https://soundcloud.com/the-karabeara-band/karabearas-kazoo-song

https://soundcloud.com/the-karabeara-band/piggy-bank

 

I am offering up my vocal and song-writing talents in a bunch of crazy and creative ways as perks to those willing to help support my dream.

From a Good Morning Wake Up Call (check out this link from Friends)  to a Sining Telegram, a customized ring tone to a $5 donation to Autism Speaks Canada -- an organization near and dear to my heart -- I want to bring music into your life in the little ways that count. 

I have enlisted the help of a professional producer willing to curb some of his cost for an independent artist whose project he digs and whose potential for success he believes in. If I do not raise the full amount, I will use whatever funds are raised towards recording, song-by-song, and licensing the compositions out individually in order to raise the money to complete this project. 

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, that's okay! -- thank you for reading my story, and I would really appreciate it if you could share it with your friends on facebook, you twitter followers, your neighbors with kids, your extended family, your co-workers, or anyone else who might like to purchase one of the perks in my campaign! 

For some samples of my song writing capabilities -- both instrumental and vocal -- visit the following links: 

Instrumental:  https://soundcloud.com/the-karabeara-band/mobile-phone-ad

Vocals Included: https://soundcloud.com/the-karabeara-band/karabearas-zoo-party

Thank you very much, in advance, for your help, and I hope you have a Kidtastic, Musical Day!

 

 -- Please Note: All music in the campaign video is original, created by none other than KaraBeara. --

story:
Who is My Captain My Sea?

My Captain My Sea is a Post-Rock band from Pittsburgh, Pa.

We first started out as a three-piece band in the summer of 2010. Back then, we were mostly just a high school band. But once we hit college, however, we started to get serious. We changed drummers and added a bassist to the band. We’ve gone on two tours since then and we’ve played with some noticeable bands, like And So I Watch You From Afar, The End Of The Ocean, Empire Empire (I Was a Lonely Estate), Modern Baseball, Trophy Scars, and many others.

 https://www.facebook.com/mycaptainmysea

http://mycaptainmysea.bandcamp.com/album/merry-christmas-new-album-teaser

Both Songs from that teaser are the demo version of the tracks that will be released on our latest album  Grow Up or Die Alone

Why Crowd Sourcing?

I believe that our music, and this album, should be produced on vinyl.  Due to the amount of hard work and effort we put into creating this, we want to show our work in the best form of art and sound quality possible. Plus, Brianne Camesi has done an amazing job on this album cover. We’d honestly love to fund this whole thing ourselves, but due to the cost of creating vinyl, we need your help. We are not asking for help paying for CDs, recording, touring, and anything else. We just want to create a pre-order type of investment so that we can make the vinyl possible.

Where is your money going?

100% of it is going to the production of putting this album on vinyl.

What will you get in return?

The Digital Download, as soon as we get it back. It’ll be months in advance from our release date.
Physical CD

An exclusive color of the vinyl, saved for anyone who contributes.

T-shirts in sizes (S-XL)

A painting from Brianne Camesi
http://sunderingseas.tumblr.com/

Test Print

 

*If you are not from the US please add 4 dollars to the cd, 5 dollars for the vinyl and 6 dollars for anything above that.. (sorry shipping costs sucks)

Thanks for contributing, or at least reading this. If you can’t contribute, please consider sharing this page by any source of social media or word-of-mouth possible. We appreciate your help and consideration.

story:
My Story

I am recording my second studio album and I need your help funding it to make it the best it can possibly be.This is your chance to get in on the ground floor of making my next album. Being an independant artist it can be intimidating to take on a project of this size. But I know with your help I will make an album that not only I, but all of you will be proud of aswell. Any funding raised above the goal will go towards tour support, music videos and more.

 

What Your Money Is Going Towards

Dan Brodbeck         

Dan Brodbeck is a Juno award winning engineer who will be Producing, Engineering and Mixing the album. This is a large portion of the cost of making an album. It is also the most vital part of the process.

Studio Time   

This is the other big cost. We Will be spending roughly 15-20 days at Emac in London recording all drums, bass, guitars, keyboards, vocals and other instrumentation.

 

Studio Musicians                                                                                                      

To pull off this project, I will need to hire other musicians to play on the album. Including drummer, bass player, piano/keyboards and other instrumentation.

Mastering                                                                                                                 

This is the final step before printing and after Dan has done all his hard work.
Mastering is where they make sure all the tracks flow and that they stand up to industry standards.

Printing

This is the final step between the recording process and getting the cd out to you. This is when they duplicate the cds, print the booklets, pack them
in the cases and get them ready to be delivered to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

After you donate make sure to share the page with your friends. Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help. Share the campaign with your friends and ask them to pass it along.

Every little bit counts!
story_txt: My StoryI am recording my second studio album and I need your help funding it to make it the best it can possibly be.This is your chance to get in on the ground floor of making my next album. Being an independant artist it can be intimidating to take on a project of this size. But I know with your help I will make an album that not only I, but all of you will be proud of aswell. Any funding raised above the goal will go towards tour support, music videos and more. What Your Money Is Going TowardsDan Brodbeck         Dan Brodbeck is a Juno award winning engineer who will be Producing, Engineering and Mixing the album. This is a large portion of the cost of making an album. It is also the most vital part of the process.Studio Time   This is the other big cost. We Will be spending roughly 15-20 days at Emac in London recording all drums, bass, guitars, keyboards, vocals and other instrumentation. Studio Musicians                                                                                                       To pull off this project, I will need to hire other musicians to play on the album. Including drummer, bass player, piano/keyboards and other instrumentation.Mastering                                                                                                                  This is the final step before printing and after Dan has done all his hard work.Mastering is where they make sure all the tracks flow and that they stand up to industry standards.Printing This is the final step between the recording process and getting the cd out to you. This is when they duplicate the cds, print the booklets, pack them in the cases and get them ready to be delivered to you.Other Ways You Can HelpAfter you donate make sure to share the page with your friends. Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help. Share the campaign with your friends and ask them to pass it along. Every little bit counts!

story:
SHADING NEW ALBUM!

Ci lamentiamo sempre che nessun gruppo riesce ad emergere a causa del contesto sociale dove ci troviamo, ma ora avete la possibilità di cambiare le regole del gioco donandoci la possibilità di provarci, di provare a far vedere a tutti chi siamo!

Chi ci conosce sa bene che noi tre siamo studenti, quindi le nostre risorse economiche non ci permettono in questo momento di entrare in studio ed è questo il motivo principale per il quale stiamo tardando così tanto con l'uscita del disco.
Per cercare di risolvere il nostro problema abbiamo deciso di COINVOLGERE TUTTI VOI!  Ognuno di voi potrà SCEGLIERE LIBERAMENTE di supportarci economicamente con una piccola donazione così facendo, saremo in grado finalmente di produrre il nostro disco e quindi di realizzare il nostro sogno, un sogno che ci sta costando davvero molta fatica.

"PERCHÈ FARE LA DONAZIONE? CHE RITORNO NE HO?" 

Noi non possiamo regalarvi la luna certo, ma possiamo regalarvi il nostro talento, la nostra attitudine, la nostra musica. Chiunque scelga di aiutarci sarà parte integrante di questo nuovo capitolo della nostra carriera. Oltre ai regali che vi offriamo (vedi sezione dedicata), c'è la consapevolezza di aver aiutato qualcuno, un aiuto prezioso il cui valore è inestimabile!
Sappiamo bene che sarà difficile ottenere la vostra approvazione, però noi ci crediamo davvero. Vogliamo bene ad ognuno di noi per averci sostenuto in questi anni perciò vi chiediamo di darci ancora una volta una mano perchè la vera band siamo tutti noi assieme! Non c'è gruppo senza un pubblico! 

Le donazioni, sono libere. È bene che sappiate che anche se non riusciremo a raggiungere la quota di 500 euro, utilizzeremo lo stesso i soldi guadagnati per questo progetto perciò non c'è modo che vi ritornino.

IL DISCO

Stiamo parlando di un nuovo inizio. Questo disco è in tutto e per tutto diverso dai nostri lavori passati. Sostanzialmente c'è stato un cambio di stile. Le canzoni non appartengono ad un solo genere, abbiamo creato un mix di Progressive metal, Ambient e Rock. 

IL CONCEPT

Il nostro primo album è di fatto la nostra interpretazione dell'uomo. Crediamo che un uomo non possa definirsi completo se non riesce a fare esperienza e tesoro di tutte le sensazioni possibili. Perciò le nostre canzoni, dalla prima all'ultima, parleranno di quelle sensazioni, indipendentemente dal fatto che possano essere piacevoli o meno, che ogni persona dovrebbe poter provare per definirsi completo. In questo viaggio, noi e voi, insieme, cercheremo di arrivare il più vicino possibile alla completezza dell'anima e dello spirito.

- SHADING -

story:
About Jamaika's project

I have been selected to attended an invite-only vocal workshop in LA where I will be working with the likes of Beyonce's vocal coach and producers who worked with Michael Jackson.

My family has sold everything so they can get me there.. but I need your help.

Why I need your help

  • We need $10,000 to fund the trip so that I can work with some huge names in the music industry.
  • The funds will assist with flights for my parents and myself (I am only 14) and, accommodation and general expenses for the trip.
  • I would love you to share in my journey... to be with me at the begin of my career all the way to my ultimate dream... to become a world class recording artist.

Your small contribution will make a huge impact

  • My family believes in my talent so much that they have literally packed up everything to get me to LA  - The biggest challenge for us is just to get there, to get to the invite only workshop and to demonstrate why I am worthy of the huge break they are offering.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make an investment in my career then there are other ways that you might be able to help: 

  • Tell your friends about my campaign.
  • Share my story on social media with anyone that might be interested in helping.

story:
Who, What & Why?

     
  • We are a young band from Luxembourg playing Space Rock, a mix of indie, stoner and psychedelic. The band formed in 2014 and is always trying to explore new musical directions.
  •  Since then, we played a bunch of concerts and recorded a 4-Song Demo Tape.
    •  
  • The recording of a real EP seems like the next logical step in our adventure, but to realize this project, we need YOUR financial help!
    •  
 
 
 

What we give & What you get

  
  • Sadly the production of an EP isn't gifted, the costs are much higher as one would think. The overall costs will reach about 2000€ if you calculate the production costs of the recording, the packaging, merch, distribution etc. 
    •  
  • Speaking of it, every funder will receive a signed EP and maybe more awesome stuff, depending on your donation.
    •  
 
 
 

The Challenge

 We have a small starting budget, but it will be difficult for us to cover all costs even with crowdfunding. We try to cover most of our costs with playing concerts, but it is difficult to get the needed exposure as a young band.
HELP THE PEACHES GROW
     
 

Other ways to help

 

We as poor students understand that not everybody can donate money, so if you want to support us nonetheless, you can do this by LIKING and SHARING our content on Facebook / Youtube / Souncloud / Instagram

https://www.facebook.com/thechoppybumpypeaches/

https://soundcloud.com/thechoppybumpypeaches

https://www.instagram.com/thechoppybumpypeaches/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LW693UYyJWo (so you know what we want to record)


     
 
The Peaches say THANK YOU for your help!
