story:
Why am I doing this?

April 14, 2014 is a day that I will never forget. It is the day that with God I overcame a life of drug and alcohol addiction. April 14, 2014 is the day that I was reborn.

REBORN is important to me because I believe that through music, I can make a difference.  If I can help just one person overcome their addiction it is all worth it.  REBORN is so much more than just an album, it is an opportunity to give a message of hope.  It is an opportunity to share my story of recovery and hopefully inspire someone else to seek out a clean life. 

What we need & what you get

My goal is $6,000.  Making a quality record is not an easy or cheap task.  The $6000 covers the cost of studio time, mixing, mastering and CD printing.  When we reach that goal lets not stop there, because at $8,000 I will be able get my story out to more people through events, performances and more promotional materials.  The whole reason I'm doing this is to help as many people as I can.  At $10,000 I can start working towards making more music. 

Why is this important?

Addiction is a problem that is destroying lives all over the world.  It is an epidemic that is taking too many lives way too soon.  I believe that if I can help just one person overcome addiction I have fulfilled my purpose.  With your support I know that we can touch lives and we can save lives. 

 

Challenges

  • The challenge I face in my mission through this campaign is helping people fight the disease of addiction! This is especially difficult considering the large heroin epidemic in Ohio, but I overcame it! Knowing that gives me hope for others, and I believe that it gives others hope of their own.

 

Thank you so much for supporting me.  I appreciate each and every one of you.  Please, take the time to share my project.  The more people that know what I am trying to accomplish the better.  Thank you so much!

story:
About this project

CASM (www.casmmusic.org) is proud to present its newest partner: The B Project! 

THE B PROJECT is a creative collaborative between Flutist Brandon LePage, Harp Duo Beyond Pluck, and Percussionist Zac Brunell (of the Detroit Bureau of Sound). 

We invite YOU to join us in creating exciting, never-heard-before, new music!

We set it all up for you, all you have to say is yes.

THE DETAILS:

The B Project has commissioned three brand new works from young, up-and-coming, talented composers. Michael Lanci, Nina Shekhar, and Nathan Campbell are currently writing three pieces celebrating the unique sounds of the flute, harp and wide range of percussive instruments. Your sponsorship of this project would be used to help fund:

1) Professional Recording and editing of the three new works with "Bass Note Productions" during the week of May 9, 2016. These recordings will be given to the composers for their professional use (which rarely is ever done for newly composed music).

2) All business materials associated with the premiere performance including advertising, compensation to the composers for their hard work, compensation to the performers for rehearsing, practicing, and premiering the works, and any fees associated with the venue where the performance will take place.

3) The security that these works will be heard time and time again (rather than performed once and then never be presented again outside of that first performance). We commissioned these works with the idea that they will be circulated within the musical circles we run and then will be performed and heard by a wide range of people.

The pieces will be premiered on May 15, 2016 in Detroit, MI.

The pieces will further be shared in Detroit-area schools, to encourage and inspire young students!

HOW TO GET INVOLVED:

Check out the different backing levels here on our Indiegogo campaign. We've created a couple different packages for you to choose from. Of course, you can support us at any level, but we think you'll enjoy some of the perks of being involved in this project.

CASM is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts organization. Contributions for the charitable purpose of CASM must be made payable to "Fractured Atlas" only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the fullest extent permitted by law. 

When you team up with CASM and The B Project, you're creating. You're creating something new, alive, and tangible. 

Thank you for joining this wild and joyful ride of making music, 

and thank you for your support!

See you May 15th.

Risks and challenges

Side-effects include, but are not limited to: sheer joy upon experiencing a group of artists making art. And you get to see it, and feel it. LIVE.

story:
About the EP and Vinyl

The Feed is a rock band formed just outside of Washington, DC.  We went to the studio almost a year ago, in October 2015, and recorded six songs covering the breadth of what we do. After a long mixing and mastering process, we're finally ready to share it with the world, and need your help to get it out there!  The EP is named Dwelling, and we have decided to release this batch of music in two ways: the full six-song EP as a digital download for listening on a variety of devices, and a 7-inch vinyl record for those who like to get physical.  The 7-inch features "Weeds", "No Brain" and "Pound it Out".

You can listen to two tracks from the 7-inch vinyl streaming right now: 
Weeds - https://soundcloud.com/thefeeddc/weeds
Pound It Out - https://soundcloud.com/thefeeddc/pound-it-out!
Be sure to follow us on Soundcloud for more!
 

What We're Asking For

We think of this campaign as a pre-order with a few special bonuses! Every single contributor will get some music. The funds will go towards final costs associated with mastering and pressing our vinyl.  Rewards include:

  • Digital Download of the full EP (included with all other rewards)
  • 7-inch Vinyl Record
  • Tote Bags
  • Entry to one of our live shows
  • We will bake you a delicious pie!
  • We will write a brand new song for you!

What's the Risk?

Recording and Mixing of this record is completely 100% done, so you will absolutely be getting a copy of the EP in digital form the moment it's ready for release.

We have sent masters to the vinyl manufacturer, and expect to have them in our hands in December 2016 or shortly thereafter.  Vinyl pressing takes time, so while we can't guarantee a delivery date right now, we can guarantee it is coming.

As for the special rewards - live shows, home-baked pies, and custom songs - we live to write and play music (and eat!), so we will reach out to you directly and work with you to make these things happen in the months after the end of the campaign.

Help Us Reach An Audience!

If you like our music, but are not able to throw in for one of the bigger rewards, you can help us out by following us on social media and sharing our music and campaign:

  • Tell anyone you know who likes music about this campaign!
  • Like and share on Facebook - follow us at https://www.facebook.com/thefeeddc
  • Follow, Favorite, and Share our tracks on Soundcloud as they're released at https://soundcloud.com/thefeeddc
  • Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/thefeeddc

Thanks everyone, and we look forward to sharing the finished music with you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello Beautiful Humans of planet earth!

My name is Ny Oh and i'm a world traveling / hitchhiking musician spreading a message of love and unity from the heart. I'm getting ready to release my second EP - Lovely and Honest and i need your help! 

My life as a traveller is all about actioning my words, living from the heart and sharing that with everyone i meet... i trust in life and am blessed to be on this journey.

I've worked so hard on this new EP, i've poured my soul into it, toiled with the up's and downs of the recording process and have finally come to a place where i'm happy with them and ready to master the tracks!

This is where you come in..! 

I would love to get these tracks mastered in a great studio so that they may reach a wider audience with better audio quality... on a buskers budget.. it's a little hard! 

What I Need & What You Get:

  • The EP is going to need 300pounds to be mastered (audio stereo quality) so that i am able to submit it to be played on radio stations (and all that Jazz).
  • Your donation means that i'm able to release this music online, for donation, or for free. That way music is available to anyone and everyone to listen to and download. Think of it as going for a coffee and paying for two.. just in case someone can't afford it doesn't mean they shouldn't have it. Music is medicine, and who am i to deny anyone the medicine they need.
  • If the goal isn't reached the funds will still go towards mastering, maybe just not the studio i have in mind.. that's ok, it is how it is, always! The funds will go towards making this EP as special as possible.

The Impact

This is my second EP and i'm so blessed to have this gift to share with the world. The music industry as an entity can make it pretty hard for passionate creative people to follow their dream outside if it's glow. But thanks to the power of the individual (with a little magic from the internet), we are able to change the way that art is created and shared. Thank you for supporting the people you love.

Risks & Challenges

It's never easy asking for help.. and i'm the type of person who's always worked very hard to make sure i'm a position where i don't have to, but music is for everyone, so why shouldn't it be made by everyone? You may not be musical yourself but the most important thing about music is that it's for sharing and i would love to have you as a part of the music process, so you can see just how it is to be a musician in this day and age (more than just the creative process), all the work that goes into it and the rewards that come out of it! 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't donate? No worries! If you'd love to help me, help yourself, because we are one. It would be a blessing (a giant thank you to mother earth) to the world if you could walk to the mirror right now, look into your own eyes and tell yourself how amazing you are. Keep being inspired, keep on inspiring and don't forget that it's for love that you're alive.

Thank you, Love you, Bless you

There are a few people that i'd love to highlight as angels that believe in the music and the magic of life...

Takatsuna Mukai

Jesse Sheehan

The Lyrical Nomads

Matthew Swain

Leon Philipson
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello Beautiful Humans of planet earth!
My name is Ny Oh and i'm a world traveling / hitchhiking musician spreading a message of love and unity from the heart. I'm getting ready to release my second EP - Lovely and Honest and i need your help! 
My life as a traveller is all about actioning my words, living from the heart and sharing that with everyone i meet... i trust in life and am blessed to be on this journey.
I've worked so hard on this new EP, i've poured my soul into it, toiled with the up's and downs of the recording process and have finally come to a place where i'm happy with them and ready to master the tracks!
This is where you come in..! 
I would love to get these tracks mastered in a great studio so that they may reach a wider audience with better audio quality... on a buskers budget.. it's a little hard! 
What I Need & What You Get:
  The EP is going to need 300pounds to be mastered (audio stereo quality) so that i am able to submit it to be played on radio stations (and all that Jazz). Your donation means that i'm able to release this music online, for donation, or for free. That way music is available to anyone and everyone to listen to and download. Think of it as going for a coffee and paying for two.. just in case someone can't afford it doesn't mean they shouldn't have it. Music is medicine, and who am i to deny anyone the medicine they need.
 If the goal isn't reached the funds will still go towards mastering, maybe just not the studio i have in mind.. that's ok, it is how it is, always! The funds will go towards making this EP as special as possible.    The Impact This is my second EP and i'm so blessed to have this gift to share with the world. The music industry as an entity can make it pretty hard for passionate creative people to follow their dream outside if it's glow. But thanks to the power of the individual (with a little magic from the internet), we are able to change the way that art is created and shared. Thank you for supporting the people you love.
    Risks & Challenges It's never easy asking for help.. and i'm the type of person who's always worked very hard to make sure i'm a position where i don't have to, but music is for everyone, so why shouldn't it be made by everyone? story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone!

We're Jeffrey and "Machine Gun" Kristin Howard, also known as, Hot Hands! We're a noisy garage rock duo from Orlando Florida. We've decided to drop out of society, (like in Albert Brooks'  1983 film, "Lost In America") and go on tour permanently (or at least for as long as we can). 

What We Need & What You Get

We'll need some help along the way with the usual traveling expenses that come with being on the road. 

  • Gas
  • Food
  • Car repair/tires
  • Bills
  • etc.

We'll be leaving our jobs, putting our stuff in storage and boon docking in our van for the most part (hopefully we can crash with new and old friends along the way as well!). So, our only source of income will be from playing shows around the country and beyond. 

As far as "perks" go, we can offer you guys:

  • buttons/pins (Kristin's been making them for about 10 years!)
  • handmade collages
  • thrift store finds
  • maybe limited edition merch such as t-shirts
  • Hot Hands stickers
  • fun pen pal type care packages with mix CDs and hand written letters and other funny stuff

Not sure what else we can offer at the moment, but you're more than welcome to make a suggestion. :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us with expenses, there's other ways you can pitch in! 

  • Help us promote this page
  • Promote our Tour Event page on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/events/148495448691691/
  • Tell your friends about Hot Hands
  • We need contacts and help with booking shows

Thank you!!

<3 Kristin and Jeffrey

story:
Okonda, 

I  was born in Congo. I came to America in my teen years. I have been singing since I was 5 years old. I am really looking forward to release a music album. This will truly be a dream come true . I have been trying  my best to find people to  sponsorize this longtime dream of mine, but I have not been successful. 

 

This fund will definitily go straight to my music project and I will most definitily keep in touch with the contributors letting them know how the project is proceeding. I believe that is the best way they get informed about what I have done with their money. 

 

The Impact

I strongly believe in giving back to the community. Once I am done with this project, I will make sure that every dollar I make from my album I will give 10%  to any organization that i fights for child hunger around the world.

 

 

Share this link to your friends and family.  Thank you so much for you help.

story:
Dan Currie

Hey there folks, my name is Dan Currie and I'm a musician from Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island. I'm getting set to release my third solo recording, "Heartache"! Alright! It has been seven years and a lotta heart aches since my last solo project was released and I feel that it's time to get these songs out into the world.

 In the last year I've been a part of a few other projects that have landed me two Music PEI nominations. One is for Musician of the Year and the other for Producer of the Year. The projects I was involved in were Katie McGarry's "Waiting On" album, which received four Music PEI nominations; and Spencer Soloduka & the Tearaways EP, which received two Music PEI nominations. I co-produced both of these albums, as well as engineering and mixing Spencer's EP.

"HEARTACHE"

I've spent the last two years in two different studios recording what I consider to be eight of my strongest songs. I've worked really hard on this project, producing it myself as well as playing most of the instruments on it. It's something I'm really proud of and really looking forward to sharing it with everyone.

I've been super busy getting things finalized for this project. Slugging away roofing, playing in a cover band, and any other gigs that I can find, has allowed me to fund the recording, mixing, and artwork of the album. The trouble is I'm short on money for mastering and manufacturing costs. 

Based on quotes I've been given, after taxes, currency exchange, and shipping, it will cost about $900 for mastering and $1100 for manufacturing. So, I've decided to pre-sell the album in order to raise the $2000.

What this means:

1)You purchase my sweet awesome CD today 

2)When my CDs arrive I will send you a copy ASAP!

I can't express enough, how much it would mean to me to have your support on this new venture of mine. Even if you can't purchase a copy or donate to my campaign, I'd really appreciate if you can spread the word about it! I'm really excited to share these songs with you!

story:
Compassion Mobile Fund:

Compassion Fatigue needs a dadwagon to get to and from shows. HELP!


We're setting the bar fairly low. A P.O.S. dadwagon will make getting to regional shows possible without pissing off our three friends with cars big enough to haul gear.

YOUR REWARD:

A feeling of community and connectedness. Also some cool shit.

story:
-->English below<--

[FR]


Formé en 2010, Perpetual Escape se révèle rapidement en se produisant sur de nombreuses scènes, tremplins et festivals. Leurs compos, mélange de rock US, de refrains accrocheurs, de dévellopement progressifs et d'énergie typiquement metal, touchent un public de plus en plus large.

Après avoir marqué les esprits et accroché le public avec un premier EP en 2010 nommé Heavy Face suivi du mélodique In Search Of Light en 2012, le groupe souhaite maintenant aller encore plus loin en sortant un tout nouvel album !





Cette année 2016 sera celle du retour de Perpetual Escape en studio, pour l'enregistrement d'un nouvel album ! Ce disque est d'autant plus attendu qu'il sera le premier enregistré à 2 voix !


Pourquoi nous aider ?

Nous souhaitons vous offrir un album de qualité  et pour cela nous avons besoin de 1000€ de budget !

Enregistrement batteries : 400€

Enregistrements voix : 400€

Mixage et Mastering : 200€

Si la somme n'est pas atteinte, nous ferons notre possible pour réaliser cet album avec nos moyens, mais si elle est dépassée nous pourrons vous offrir plus (merchandising en plus, voir clip vidéo...)


Comment faire ?

    1.Choisissez la somme que vous souhaitez apporter au projet

    2. Choisissez également la/les contrepartie(s) disponible(s) (album, merchandising, exclusivité...)*

    3.Vous ne pouvez pas participer d'une manière ou d'une autre ? Vous pouvez tout de même nous aider ! Parlez autour de vous de ce projet partagez-le! Toute aide est la bienvenue !

    *Les frais de ports sont inclus dans les contre-parties (hors Union Européenne prévoir éventuellement un surplus). L'envoi se fait par lettre ou colissimo selon la demande. 

    --------------------------------------------------------

    Nous vous remercions vraiment de nous suivre dans cette aventure et de nous soutenir pour que notre projet puisse se concrétiser, chaque aide est précieuse !




    -->Pour toute question vous pouvez nous écrire via Facebook ou encore à l'adresse suivante : perpetualescape@gmail.com<--

     

    Retrouvez-nous aussi via les réseaux sociaux et notre site internet 

    http://www.perpetual-escape.com/

    https://www.facebook.com/PerpetualEscape/

    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-7BGOQ9RbwJhdoUWGN7ynw

    https://soundcloud.com/perpetualescape


    Perpetual Escape de 2010 à aujourd'hui , c'est


    1) Des Actualités 2015 : Arrivée d’Anaïs
    Écriture d’un nouvel album (sortie prévue en 2016)
    Nouveau site web (en cours de construction)
    Date : Le Tigre - Sélestat – 26 Novembre 2015, Strasbourg - Salon du Tourisme, Wacken (janvier)


    De 2010 à 2014 : 2 EPs et 1 clip officiel



    2) Plus de 100 scènes: Caf Conc’, Grillen, Blue Notes (Allemagne), Millenium, Tanzmatten, etc.
    3) Des Premières parties: Freedom Call (Heavy Metal - Allemagne),
    Elmer Food Beat (Rock - France)
    Andreas et Nicolas (Rock/Metal humoristique – France)
    4) Des Publications presse: RockHard (diffusion nationale), DNA, Rép. Lorrain
    5) Des Apparitions TV: France 3, TV7, No Life


    --------------------------------------------ENGLISH---------------------------------------------------

    [ENG]




    Formed in 2010, Perpetual Escape play on many scenes and festivals. Their compositions, mixes US rock'n'roll, catchy refrains and energy typically metal, touch an increasingly large audience. After having touched the spirits and having hung the public with a first EP named in 2010 "Heavy Face" followed by  "In Search Of Light" in 2012, the band prepares a very new album now!

    Why help us?


    We want to offer you a good album  and for this reason we need 1000€ of budget!

    Recording drumss: 400€
    Recordings voice: 400€
    Mixing and Mastering: 200€

    If the sum is not reached, we will make our possible for this album, but if we have more, we will be able to offer more gifts (merchandising, appearance in the clip etc..)


    How to take part?

    1.Choose the sum

    2.Also choose the gift(s)  available(s) (album, merchandising, exclusiveness…)*

    3.You can't take part in one way or another? You can help us all the same! Speak around you about this project with your friends, family and share it! Any help is  welcome!

    *The shipping costs are included in the counterparts (except European Union to envisage a surplus !). The sending is done by letter or colissimo according to the request.

      --------------------------------------------------------
    Thank you for following us in this adventure and for you support !

story:
Hey Folks!

We're The Faints, an independent rock band from Portland, OR. You may know us from our previous incarnation "The My Oh My's" which produced such Northwest rock classics as "Baxter Eyeballs Your Lunch",  "I'm Gonna Be 15 Minutes Late to Practice" and "The Sound Of One Man Napping". 
A lot has changed in the last year. We've added a brand new member to the band! Ladies and gentlemen, meet Ms. Michael Jodell! She's an amazing singer songwriter and we're really happy to have her. 
With a new album's worth of material under our belts we've enlisted Portland legend Larry Crane to produce our new record, an endeavor that will take place during the first few months of 2016. With Larry at the helm we have no doubt that this record will surpass the lofty standards set by our debut record which was after all voted a finalist for "2014's best things to avoid sticking in any of your holes."

What We Need  

We are planning to raise $8,000 dollars towards the cost of 10-12 days of recording and mixing with Larry Crane at Jackpot Studios right here in Portland, OR. Assuming we can accomplish that goal within our timeline the rest of the money will be enough to cover mastering and manufacturing costs. If we fail to reach our goal whatever we do raise will be applied to our recording and mixing budget and the rest will be raised through manual labor/organ donation/underground lint racing. 

What You Get

On top of a cache of good Karma we're offering some cool perks including signed CD's, house concerts, T-shirts and more.

The Bottom Line

We believe we have a great record to make but we need your help to get it done. The opportunity to work with Larry Crane is something we are all really excited about and we believe this record will be a huge step forward for us in many ways. Thank you for your time and thank you in advance for any contribution you see fit to make. 


-The Faints

story:
The Steve Dunn Band is recording a new album


SDB: Vando, Steve, The Other Steve, Kevin

Our goal for this project is to raise $5000.  We will use 100% of funds raised to record and promote a new album that we are very excited about. Perks for those who choose to participate in this campaign include:

  • Early downloads of new music
  • Signed copies of CDs
  • New, exclusive SDB T-shirts
  • Live intimate acoustic shows or full band concerts in your home or choice of venue!
  • Everyone who donates at least $10 will be thanked by name in the album's liner notes!

The cost involved in the recording and printing of CDs, traveling to shows and promoting music now is greater than ever.  Your participation in this campaign gives us the resources to produce our work independently, on our terms, and provide you with the best quality music we can. With your help, we will have the ability to pay for studio time and engineers for recording, mixing and mastering, manufacture CDs, and engage campaigns to market our new music. 

Important: Please note that if you intend to receive a "Perk" such as a CD or T-Shirt, you will need to select the "Perk" rather than choose the "Contribute Now" option, which is intended for donations only .

Thanks for taking the time and stop by, we can't wait to get our new music to you. Until then, enjoy the first single from our last album, "Have A Little Fun"

story:
Thank You for putting us InDemand!

Our amazing supporters came through for us and we raised all the money we needed to complete our album! We're almost ready to share it with you, and you can be one of the very first people to hear it!

Now, we're getting ready to promote the heck out of this album - you can help us do that by pre-purchasing your copy of the CD or a digital download, and we will put all the proceeds towards CD release parties, touring, and promotions for the band and the album, "I Want Love"!

The Story So Far...

JPJQ was recording what we thought was going to be a demo/EP - we had a nice selection of tunes, and thought we were ready. But sometimes life takes you in another direction... and that happened to us.

My mom, Joyce Pinckney – composer, teacher, musician and inspiration – passed away this past summer. During the last week I had with her, I sat by her bedside the way she'd done for me so many times, talking to her, stroking her hair, and singing to her.

Those songs – the ones that made me want to sing… that made me able to sing during that last week with my mom – live in the part of my soul that makes me who I am. And almost none of them were on the album. We needed to change that. So we reached out to you, and you came through. 6 days before the end of our campaign, we achieved our goal.

Where Do We Stand?

The photos are being Photoshopped, the album is mixed and being mastered, the album art is being designed, we've applied for our licences, and paid for the manufacturing. 

What's the Next Step?

Once the licenses, album art and master recording are in hand, we send the whole shebang to the manufacturer, they make the album, and then we send it to you! (And have a bunch of great shows!)

Right here, on our OnDemand page, you can pre-purchase your download and/or cd and we will send it out within hours of it being in our hands! Just click on the option you want, and Indiegogo will take care of the rest!
Remember, if you've already purchased a perk that included a download or CD, you don't need to buy another one (but you can if you want)!

I Don't Have Any Money - Can I Still Help??

Of course you can! You can pass on the information about our campaign to your friends, family, contacts - even strangers! Here's how:

At the bottom of this page, there are a bunch of icons for Facebook and YouTube etc. You can share our campaign through those websites, and if you’re logged into your (free and easy to get if you don’t already have one) Indiegogo account, we can see that you’ve shared it! 

So There You Have It!

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign, and thank you in advance for anything you can do to help us out! We look forward to hearing from you!

"I Want Love" will be released in April 2016! Celebrate with us, and help us make that celebration a Show Stopper!

-JPJQ

PS. Canadian Fans of JPJQ - contact me to access your SECRET PERK!

story:
Website: psycheopera.com

Acknowledgements

We would like to thank the following individuals and entities for helping us launch this campaign: 

Revelstock Soap Company

Polaris Studios

CMN Arts

Coaching for Life Goals

Brigette Cormier, dancer/choreographer

Lissette Jimenez, contralto

LWM Music

Kendall Sound Art Subscribers & Contributors

Short Summary

Imagine if opera, dance, & drama merged with interactive multimedia technology? You don't have to imagine any longer! This vision has been made a reality by Psyche Electro-Acoustic Opera Company, LLC--Miami's new and independent performance art company!

Passionate about creating sophisticated and inspiring experiences for our audiences, we pledge to exclusively feature and commission the work of the most innovative electro-acoustic composers, performers, choreographers, and multimedia artists based in South Florida!

However, we need your help to stay independent! So as to  preserve the integrity of our artistic visions, we are avoiding government grants and corporate sponsorship, and are seeking the voluntary patronage of art-lovers like you!

What We Need

Your Indiegogo contributions will go towards:
1. purchasing insurance for our performances
2. venue rental costs
3.  AND offering our artists fair fees, while keeping our ticket prices low

What You Get / See Our Perks Tab

Contributors will receive perks from "Revelstock Soap Company," another creative Miami-based start-up, which hand-crafts beautiful artisan soaps (including vegan products) with natural ingredients! Please see the "Perks" tab on our Indiegogo page for details on our Perks packages!


No Money? There Are Other Ways You Can Help

Can't Contribute with Money? There are other ways that you can support Psyche Electro-Acoustic Opera Company:
1. Share our Indiegogo page with friends OR
2. Subscribe to our mailing list at psycheopera.com via our contacts page!

THANK YOU!

story:
The Residents' God in 3 Persons
Written and Performed by the Residents
in Collaboration with John Sanborn

The Residents, in collaboration with media artist John Sanborn, are creating an extraordinary live video/theater version of their legendary 1988 album God in 3 Persons - the story of a disgraced evangelist and his twisted obsession with a pair of gender fluid conjoined twins. This innovative LIVE work will premiere  January 24 and 25, 2020.

A Tale of Faith, Confusion and Lust

God in 3 Persons is a journey into the darkest reaches of the human soul. Beginning with a series of flashbacks, our unreliable narrator, Mr. X, tells us of his discovery of a pair of conjoined twins he believes to be miracle workers. 

As they tour the revival tent circuit, the relationship between the twins and Mr. X shifts from paternal to something more sinister, as he becomes convinced one of the twins desires him.

Framed by folksy memories, Mr. X pretends that his lurid obsession was simply a regard for the health and safety of these faith healing twins, until his libido bursts like a flood swollen dam, causing a dire release and realignment of the twins’ connection. 

It does not end well.

Creating a LIVE Work

God in 3 Persons is a raucous musical composition, fashioned as a propulsive hard rock oratorio with a deep Southern twang. It is sung in a rhythmic spoken word style, similar to the talking blues, and driven by a bombastic and dynamic score derived, in large part, from the first few bars of the hymn “Holy, Holy, Holy.” The character of Mr. X narrates and is accompanied throughout by a chorus of voices, singing in high, nasal, “outsider­ country” harmonies. 

This staged version centers on a live vocalist (one of The Residents performing as the evangelist, Mr. X) shadowed by an onstage double. They perform inside an innovative series of video projections that depict the thoughts and desires of Mr. X and draws the audience inside his collapsing mental state. Oscillating in style from animated cartoon to film noir, the media staging seduces the viewer as it takes us on a kaleidoscopic journey into the darkest corners of human desire.

For this production, noted visual artist Leigh Barbier has produced miniature sets, puppets, and props featuring her eclectic collage style, that will be transformed in the media mix. The music has been newly orchestrated by Musical Director Joshua Raoul Brody specifically to support the live performance.

We Need Your Support

Bringing God in 3 Persons to the stage will involve a six-month period of creation and rehearsal. In October, we will be creating a brand new version of this classic album, complete with new orchestrations by long time Residents music director, Joshua Raoul Brody and a method to perform the work in sync with three video projections. 

At the same time, celebrated artist Leigh Barbier will be designing and rendering a range of props and costumes for both video recording and on stage use. We’ve cast noted performer, filmmaker, author and activist Jiz Lee as the twins, and they will need a fee to give us a week of their time and talent.

In early November, Sanborn and his crew will record for 5 days in his studio – and then spend 2 months creating the animations and layers of video needed to create the virtual world for the live show. The production is pleased to have cast gender queer artist Jiz Lee as the Twins.

In early January, stage director Travis Chamberlain steps in to begin blocking the actors. Staging rehearsals with the whole team, Sanborn will lead the coordination of media, live band, vocals and stage effects to take to New York for the premiere performances in late January 2020.

THE ARTISTS

THE RESIDENTS
composers and performers 

The Residents are an American art collective that has been creating avant-garde music and multimedia works for over 40 years. Since their first official release, Meet the Residents (1974), the group has released over sixty albums, numerous music videos and short films, three CD-ROM projects, and ten DVDs. They have undertaken ten major tours and scored multiple films. Pioneers in exploring the potential of CD-ROM and similar technologies, the Residents have won several awards for their multimedia projects. Ralph Records, a record label focusing on avant-garde music, was started by the band.

Throughout the group's existence, the individual members have ostensibly attempted to operate anonymously, preferring to have all attention focused on their output. Much outside speculation and rumor has focused on this aspect of the group. In public, the group appears silent and costumed, often wearing eyeball helmets, top hats and tails—a long-lasting costume now recognized as its signature iconography.

In addition to their groundbreaking work in the areas of trance, world fusion, electronica, punk, industrial and lounge music, the group has also been credited with being among the originators of performance art and music video. Two of their videos are in the permanent collection of the Museum of Modern Art and their Freak Show CD-ROM were featured in  “Looking at Music 3.0” exhibition.

A film documentary about The Residents, “The Theory of Obscurity”, premiered at SXSW in 2015.

JOHN SANBORN
media artist and director

John Sanborn is an award-winning, world-renowned media artist whose body of work ranges from the technological stone age of the 1970’s to the digital bleeding edge of today. The Cahiers du Cinema has called him “unparalleled master of the video medium, the most outstanding artist working in media today”, and “the acknowledged genius in the field” by Vogue. 

Sanborn’s works have been shown at almost every contemporary art museum in the world, including the Whitney Museum;  New York; the Prado, Madrid; the Centre Pompidou, Paris; the Tate Gallery, London; and the Seibu Museum, Tokyo. His video works have been broadcast world-wide (BBC, Channel Four, A2, RTBF, Sky), including 16 programs for PBS featuring works with Robert Ashley, Bill T. Jones, Laurie Anderson, Philip Glass, Nam June Paik, Twyla Tharp, the Residents, and David Gordon. 

In 2019 Sanborn debuted Alchemy, commissioned by the National Museum of Qatar, installed in a remarkable building designed by Jean Nouvel. The work was hailed as “…Art with a capital “A”” by Artweek.

John Sanborn holds an honorary Master of Cinema degree from ESEC, in Paris, and was recently named a Chevalier des Arts et des Lettresby the Minister of Culture of the Republic of France. The Mill Valley Film Festival honored him with a lifetime achievement award in 2017.

story:
Story Of the Arteest:

I, DJ Prime Minister a.k.a. "The Scratch Painter" is ready to spearhead a new frontier in turntablism. While other turntablists are out only to display their scratch skills, I use my techniques to express myself artistically. 


I coined this art form:

‘Scratchtracknology’- The fine art of scratch arrangements over Music.


I truly believe in the turntables as a musical/artistic instrument.   and have been greatly inspired by the inventors of modern day Turntablism: GrandWizzard  Theodore & Grand Master Flash(inventors of Scratch),and Kool Herc & Afrika Baambata(fathers of Electronic Music & the Modern DJ)  and the Greats: Magic Mike, Terminator X, DJ Q-Bert, Babu, Pete Rock, & DJ Premier.  I have also been influenced by the inspiration of the Great Painters like Kahlo, Joseph Ntensibe, Van Gogh, & Dali.  Turntablism is becoming a lost art, and I am an ambassador for this great art form. My mission is to display this Craft as one that transcends mere Scratching into one of Artistic Expression....   i want to release a project and film creative Videos that portray this.....


The Impact

If DJ Prime Minister the Scratch Dali Flourishes, in releasing his 'Scratchtracknology' to the world and in creating visual examples thru video that represent his art, he will inspire millions and gazillions of Human beings.  Respect for the Turntable as an instrument will Flower throughout the Land.....  Men will be proud, Kids will jump for joy, and Women will have a twinkle in their eyes.... :-p  I can see this being a positive influence on the Electronic Music Industry, music of all Genres(so many collaborations: imagine Prime performing his unique surreal scratch touch on a Kanye West track then turning around to work with Cut Copy, & Linkin Park then along side a Symphony orchestra to Scratching on a Coca Cola commercial.), The Visual Arts industry, as well as the Electronic Music Equipment industry (Turntables, Mixers, Software etc.) If the Sacred art of 'Scratchtracknology' remains Hidden from the world, Multitudes will suffer artistic boredom....


What I Need & What You Get

What The Scratch Dali Needs - 

The Bare Minimum:

 -Video Work:  $2,000

  Create 3 Videos to start that Truly express my Scratching as Art.

  1. Scratch Tunin -  $500 for Videographer, Lighting and Editing.  

  2. Ode 2 Detroit(in Scratchsong) - $375 for Videographer, Basic Lighting and Editing. 

  3. Lightening Powered Aristocratic Scratches - $1000 for Videographer, 

      Special Lighting and advanced Editing. 

       (i have a really exciting vision)

                                  

 -Mixing & Mastering: $1125

 -CD Duplication: $1000

 -Marketing/Publicity:$1000


Whether i exceed or fall short of the Goal, all the funds will go toward the completion of this project. Videos and Audio Engineering for Mass mp3 and  CD Release.


                         Help the Crusade for Artestry and Turntablism.......

 

           

                          

a lil' History:

DJ Prime Minister began rubbing records in high school in the late nineties.  After listening to famous DJ's like Premier and Jazzy Jeff growing up, he caught the Turntable bug. and had to get his hands on DJ equipment. So he took a Summer Job,saved his money some. He would play around with the art of Mixing Old recordings with new ones, and then scratching on top of that.  fascinated with creating his own symphony out of Symphonies, he realized the attention he would draw while performing his scratches. He would bring his turntables to High School Talent Shows and Suprise his fellow students with his odd talent.  He knew from these moments that he had to share and communicate to the world through this Art Form. In 2004 his career kicked off when a friend called him to DJ this big event which consisted of bands and Rappers and Singers.  He rocked it, and was hooked to performing ever since.  And to this Day has come a long way, even performing as an Opening Act for some of the Inventors and Greats that he grew up listening to. (http://www.flickr.com/photos/primemin/sets/7215...) Such as: Grandwizzard Theodore(inventor of scratch), DJ Premier(of Gangstarr fame), DJ Babu and Rhettmatic (of the Beat Junkies....look em up ;-)



Interview Sample:

- Detroit Underground: (http://www.detroitunderground.com/2011/03/20/dj...)

- 808 Magazine: (http://www.flickr.com/photos/primemin/588206034...)



Yes i was a Speaker @ TED x:

My Artistic Quest and God Given Talents have led me to be a Speaker at the TED x Event.  TED x Detroit 2010@The Detroit Institute of Arts:  (http://www.youtube.com/user/DJPrimeMinister#p/u...)


               

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me Spread the 'Scratchtrack' butter around the world.  Flitter it!! Facespace it!!!  all day long.lol

Let's keep ART Alive......!!!!!!

story:
Hey friends!! 

 

I know it looks like we crossed the finish line already, but there's still so much you can do to help and I would love to have you as a part of this project. 

 

Please Keep Donating: The actual budget for the record is much closer to 15k before I'm done. I just never thought it was realistic to even make it to the $9500, but I guess I underestimated the generosity of the music lovers of the internet! :) 

So please keep donating and rest assured that every single dollar will be put right into the project and make a huge difference!

 

Claim Perks: I've prepared all these fun rewards, like an instrumental album of my favorite old Danish Christmas hymns I recorded just for this (Check out a sample here!), one-on-one guitar lessons, handwritten lyrics, studio time and much much more. 

 

Tell Your Friends: More than anything I just want people to be involved in this project! That's why I included a $1 perk and no one should be ashamed to pick that option if you just want to hear the music and follow the process. I'll be grateful for any new backer- regardless of the amount. So please tell everyone you know about this project and keep up the great work! 

 

In return I'd like to announce a new STRETCH GOAL: If we can reach 15k I'm going to bring my talented film maker friends into the desert with us to capture photos and video of the whole process. The record we're going to make is without a doubt going to reflect the magic of the surroundings (check out pictures from the studio to see what I mean), but I would love to also be able to share the visual side of this project with you. 

 

I'm absolutely blown away by the support you all have shown for this project, and I'm overflowing with gratitude and inspiration!

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My name is Anders Mouridsen, and I'm so glad you're reading this!

After being a musical mercenary for the past 14 years with artists like John Fogerty, Cam, Taylor Swift, Tim Timebomb, P!nk, Smokey Robinson and many others I finally have the songs, the band and the sound ready for my very own full-length record. I'm so inspired I can hardly sleep at night!

 

The video above pretty much sums it all up, but if you keep reading you can find some more information about me and my vision for this project. Please browse through it and let me know if you have any questions! And don't forget to check out all the fun perks I've come up with as well!


MY SECRET TRICK... Shhhh!

 

From personal and professional experience I've found that the quality of a recording, more than any other factor, comes down to how people are feeling while they're recording it. That's why I want to bring this project into the desert, where we all feel so inspired. Check out the studio at www.gatostrail.com , and I'm sure you'll see what I mean. It's truly a unique place with beautiful magical surroundings and some vibey equipment that we will be milking for every drop of inspiration. Traditional recording studios can be so sterile and soulless and most often the music you record ends up reflecting that.


THE SOUND


At the core of all of this will be my lyrics. Whether I'm working on my own music someone else's, that has always been the center of it all for me. In my musical universe everything from the chords and melody to the guitar sound or the particular microphone used on the snare drum has to serve the basic function of drawing you in to the universe of the lyric and the story that is being told.

Vocally I try my hardest to practice what I've been telling other singers for years and strip away all the BS and focus all my efforts on being as honest and vulnerable as I possibly can. If someone wants to hear vocal chops, all they have to do is turn on the TV or go on Youtube. Real honesty is much harder to come by, and that's what I strive for every time I open my mouth. This is why it's even more important to make this record with people that I trust on a deep level!

 

Through my work as a musician, I've been lucky enough to make close friends who happen to be insanely talented musicians. There's nothing wrong with music that's made on a laptop, but I'm proud to have a real band who can play together in a room. I want to capture the magic of a real performance and then combine that with all the dreamy ethereal elements that take the listener from the intimate studio setting and all the way to outer space!

 

THE MOOD

 

As I said in the video, I want the mood the record to be soaked in Scandinavian mystique and emotional ambiguity. By this I mean that I want the music to reflect the complicated and often conflicting emotions we all feel every day. Something extremely sad can also be the most beautiful, and the people we love also drives us insane at times. Music should reflect these contrasts, and if there's anything I've gained from growing up in Scandinavia it's a complete zero-tolerance for music that is oversimplifying things. I can understand how people want music that makes them feel like things (like love) are simple for a brief moment. But that has never appealed to me.

 

I mention Bon Iver's first album, because it is the perfect example of the secret trick I mentioned in the beginning. That record is not “expensive” sounding or high fidelity in any way. It's just him in his cabin with some basic gear and a broken heart. And it WORKS! Purely because of how he was feeling when he was recording it.

 

The third record I mention is Daniel Lanois' Belladonna, which is an amazing instrumental record. I really connected with this record, when I was on a writing retreat with Cam (Country singer) at a beautiful ranch in Joshua Tree. After a long and successful day of writing (I was in the desert after all!), I sat on the porch and watched the sun set over the landscape while listening to this whole record, beginning to end. It all blended together in the most inspiring way - another example of the synergy between music and places.

 

CAN I HEAR SOMETHING?

 

Absolutely! Follow me on Instagram @andersmou , where I'll be posting clips regularly throughout this campaign.

Here's a link to the full video of the song “Time Keeps” that I play a bit of in the video. It's a brutally honest song about longing for the past and trying to hold onto the fleeting moments of peace in a fast-paced and often stressful life.

Here's another song called “Alive”. I wrote this one for my wife about the ups and downs in a life full of love.

If you want to dig even deeper (which I hope you do!) you can check out some of my work as a guitarist, songwriter and producer on my website www.andersmouridsen.com .

 

SO WHERE DO I COME IN?

 

One thing that I've consistently experienced is that none of the music I've ever made feels complete before it has been received and understood by a real human on the other end. No matter how good it may be. The thing that inspires me more than anything is the connection with other people through the music. We on the stage and in the studio share our innermost thoughts and feelings and when we do it right, you hear and see yourselves in it.
 

I want you to be a part of this! You already are if you're reading this. You're part of the inspiration, motivation and accountability, and I promise I won't let you down!


... And of course, I'm very much hoping that you'll donate any amount that feels comfortable to you in order to help me bring this music into the world. I have spent my entire professional life making music and I have nothing but confidence we can make something here that you will truly appreciate and enjoy. And even more so if you're invested in it and helped bring it to life!

 

I'm excited to invest a great deal of money in this, but I do need some help with the budget, because making great music with the real gear and amazing people is really expensive.


WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

 

Most importantly - Amazing Talent: $7000

It goes without saying that if you want to make a great record, you need really great people. I'm so fortunate to be friends with some world-class musicians who're ready to go fearlessly into the desert with me- but I still want to and need to pay them. They're doing it for a fraction of their normal rates, but it still adds up. I'm paying 5 people $1400 for the week, so that amounts to $7000.

 

Secondly - Studio Time: $3500

Far too often musicians and artists are so focused on recording their “handheld” instruments that they forget they're sitting one giant instrument, which is the recording studio itself. Some of the best records of all time was made this way- not only by singing and playing great on your instruments but also by experimenting with all the musical things the studio gear can contribute. 

To squeeze every bit of talent out of these extraordinary musicians, I need them to be relaxed, comfortable and inspired, which requires that I'm not constantly checking the time and rushing things along. The irony is that in order to be 100% certain we get what we need, I need to be able to let go of control and still know that we have enough time to get comfortably across the finish line!


 

Finally - Accomodations: $1750 + $400 Food

We'll be renting the ranch house that's attached to the property and all cramming in there together. It'll be a little tight, but it's a stones throw from the studio and will help us all breathe the same creative air for the week. I also need to feed the band so they're happy and motivated and not running off into the desert in search of food!

That's really the bulk of it. I'm going to mix and master this myself, and I'm saving a fortune on that! I've tried having other people mix my music in the past, and I've realized that the only person who knows the sound I'm hearing in my head is.... you guessed it.... me! And fortunately I have the tools to do this right and lots of talented friends to help me if I get stuck along the way. 

Rather than letting the printing of CD's and vinyl eat up way too much of the budget, I'm planning on making an immersive website for the album with the music and artwork of course, but also videos, photos and stories from the making of it... And most importantly a BIG THANK YOU section to all the wonderful Indiegogo backers! 


 

So the GRAND TOTAL for this first round comes to $12,650 ... Plus all the extra expenses that'll inevitably come up along the way! 

 

Indie-Gogo recommended I included a risks & challenges section, but that's not for you to worry about :) If I don't raise the full amount I'm still going ahead with this project, and I'm not going to compromise on anything. If we run out of studio-time because we're inspired and chasing something great in the studio, I can run with that and finish the record in my own studio at home.

 

Either way, this is happening. That's a promise!

 

HOW CAN I HELP?
 

Please share this video with anyone you know and if you're able and willing, please consider donating to help me bring this music to life the way it's meant to be heard. Whether it's a single dollar or a whole big bunch of them you're helping me create something unique that wouldn't exist without you!
 

In return I'm going to give you some music that I – and everyone else involved in this project- have spent our whole lives working up the skills to create. And I've also come up with some really fun incentives that you should check out, if you haven't already!

 

Music is meant to be shared and I want to share this music with you, so please join me on this adventure and let's get it started!

story:
Hey all,

 

We are r&b/hip hop duo Elenele. Liana Harper and Landz started working together in 2009 recording "Keep It Movin'", a single off of Liana Harper’s debut EP My Journey Vol. I.   "Keep It Movin'" was about not letting a relationship or someone who may want a relationship with you to bring you down.  It was a great success and went on to be the most downloaded single.  Last year we had the opportunity to write for a webseries, titled Enlightment's The Unknown Live Talk Show.  We collaborated with a great friend and beat maker Arthur Retiz to create the song "Shine."  We wanted to have an uptempo positive song that will not only make you dance but set your spirit free.  "Shine" has received a lot of great feedback and people have asked us where this song was headed and we knew we had to do more with it. 

So we've decided to create a project together....a blend of hip hop and r&b that blends great music with positive messages.  We are currently writing that EP now with a release time slated for August/September.  But you know how it is....every artist has that one great music video that keeps you wanting more and eagerly waiting for that CD to come out.  The kind of video that creates buzz and anticipation.  This is what we'd like to do with "Shine."  

We've got great ideas and an amazing location in mind.  However, there's so much more to a music video than just a cool location and a camera...and this is where we need your help.  With your donation you can help us get:

location rental

insurance

lighting

styling (makeup, hair and clothing)

special effects

editing

dolly tracking

camera equipment

 

and more

 

Trust us, your donation will not go in vain.  Check out the amazing perks to see what you get.

If we do not meet our goal it will make it very difficult to put this dream into fruition and will delay our project a great deal.  So your support is truly needed.  If you're not able to donate, then please help by spreading the word to all of your Facebook friends, Twitter followers and mailing list.

Remember you’re a diamond….let your power SHINE!

story:
Greetings,                                                                                                         April 2, 2012

 

The Arootsakoostik Music Festival will return for its 6th year on Saturday, July 7, 2012 at Thomas Park in New Sweden, Maine.  After another very successful event in 2011, we plan to continue our tradition of bringing some of the best talent from Maine up to the County. We will be celebrating everything from acoustic folk and roots music to bluegrass, soul and rock and roll, truly something for everyone including local vendors, crafters and farmers. 

We are also very proud to continue to donate our proceeds to local charities.  Last year we raised $500 for Thomas Park and another $500 for the Caribou Children’s Museum, we hope to be able to make another donation to them this year.  We have also donated over $2,500 to Thomas Park to help aid in restoration and maintenance since we started this event.  In the past, we have raised money and awareness for the Children’s Make-A-Wish foundation, as well as several local food pantries.  As always we will be holding a canned food drive at the event to further help out the local community. 

Arootsakoostik has blossomed into a beautiful event.  The Bangor Daily news has called us one of the 50 best things to do in the summer.  We are very proud and honored to be able to continue to bring such a diverse, entertaining, and vital event to our neck of the woods.  We have people travel from all over Maine and well beyond to attend each year.  A lot of folks have begun planning their summer vacations to Northern Maine specifically for this family event. There truly is nothing else like us in the area. 

Our event is put on by a small grass roots team of good people with pure intentions who donate a lot of time and effort for the good of everyone.  We could not do this without the help and support of all involved.  As we have grown, so have our production expenses.  We are asking for the help of our local community to stage this year’s event.  Your donation would help feed our volunteers and musicians and help pay for printing and advertising costs, as well as basic promotional expenses (toilets, sound equipment, etc.), a lot of people have worked hard to get this event established, recognized and respected; we should all be proud and continue to nurture it so it can thrive for many years to come.  It truly is a win-win situation for Aroostook County.
